title: Passing altering flag to ColumnSchemaBuilder
author: SilverFire
body:
Should fix #9903 

As I mentioned in my [comment](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/9903#issuecomment-147697143), I found the only way to fix the problem.

I added optional altering flag as an additional argument in chain of calls `QueryBuilder::alterColumn() -> QueryBuilder::getColumnType($type, $alter) -> ColumnSchemaBuilder::__toString($alter) -> ColumnSchemaBuilder::buildSomeString($alter).`

The PR will probably break 3rd part Yii2 AR DBMS extensions because of additional arguments in `ColumnSchemaBuilder` methods.

:eyes: need review for better ideas
:no_entry_sign: not ready to be merged!
:broken_heart: may break BC
:memo: No specific tests

title: Added DB2 database driver
author: nikashitsa
body:
This Pull Request solves #5.
Tested on Ubuntu 14.04 x64 "DB2 v10.5.0.5", "s141128", "IP23633", and Fix Pack "5"
PHP 5.5.9, PDO_IBM-1.3.3
Tests: 212, Assertions: 1366, Errors: 1, Failures: 1, Skipped: 2.

pdo_ibm is buggy, e.g. using PDO::PARAM_NULL throws error.
It would be nice, if someone update pdo_ibm.

test config

```
$config['databases']['ibm'] = [
    'dsn' => 'ibm:yiitest',
    'username' => 'vagrant',
    'password' => 'vagrant',
    'fixture' => __DIR__ . '/ibm.sql',
];
```

Remaning issues:
- testExplicitPkOnAutoIncrement failed. In db2 it seems to be a problem.
- problems with blob (empty result string) and clob (segmentation fault error). I wrote test for that testClobBlobValues
- Need to implement checkIntegrity. Solution from https://github.com/vbsessa/yii2-db2 doesn't work in my DB2 version.

I can send DB2 and pdo_ibm installation guide below, because it's tricky.
Now we have some beginning :)

title: Wrapper for PHP webserver
author: samdark
body:
In order to try it checkout basic app template and run `./yii serve` in the app root.

Here's a help:

```
$ ./yii help serve

DESCRIPTION

Runs PHP built-in web server


USAGE

yii serve [address] [...options...]

- address: string (defaults to 'localhost')
  address to serve on


OPTIONS

--appconfig: string
  custom application configuration file path.
  If not set, default application configuration is used.

--color: boolean, 0 or 1
  whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
  If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

--docroot: string (defaults to 'web')
  path to directory to serve

--interactive: boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
  whether to run the command interactively.

--port: int (defaults to 8080)
  port to serve on. Either "host" or "host:port".

--router: string
  path to router script.
  See https://secure.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php
```

title: Catalogue support for models
author: Faryshta
body:
I don't know if this is done in other frameworks with other names.

The case usage is that on the database sometimes the columns contain an index or abbreviaton of the value to be shown to the user. Other times the data needs to be translated to be shown and it can be time consuming to type `Yii::t('app', $model->attribute)` everytime its used or create internal methods to do it.

With this there is an introduction to a new functionality named `Model::catalogues()` which handles static data to be used inside the class. The data can be accesed using the `Model::getTerminology()` static method or `Model::getAttributeTerminology` instanced method.

The method `Model::catalogues contain documentation with usage examples.`

title: Controller->viewPath can be set, fixes #10086
author: Sibilino
body:
Added setViewPath() that allows setting the base path for the
controller's views. Changed getViewPath() to return the value that was
explicitly set, before defaulting to the usual module-based path.

Thus, #10086 can be fixed using:

``` php
public $controllerMap = [
    'account' => [
        'class' => 'app\controllers\UserController',
        'viewPath' => '/home/[user]/public_html/yii_example/views/user'
    ],
    // ...
]
```

title: Advanced table alias handling for Query and ActiveQuery
author: cebe
body:
Allows to disambiguate colums without knowing the alias that has been
defined for a table elsewhere (e.g. in a relation definition).
- add methods: getAlias(), applyAlias() to Query for retrieving the
  alias for a table or disambiguate a column name.
- add methods: getRelationAlias() and applyRelationAlias() for
  retrieving the alias for a joined relation table and to disambiguate
  column names of these.
- Add alias syntax to joinWith(), e.g. joinWith('author a').
  No need to know the table name for defining an alias for the relation.

includes tests, docs are following.

Addresses the following issues:
- fixes #2377 (finally) :)
- fixes #9326
- fixes alias issues with default scope: #8743
- introduces new syntax for table alias resolution: `{{@user}}` similar to table prefix and table name escape syntax.
- picked test from https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/8788, thanks @nainoon

Open todos:
- [ ] add more tests
- [ ] complete documentation (cover #5137, adjust [gridview relation guide](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/guide/output-data-widgets.md#working-with-model-relations))
- [ ] make getAlias() work for tables from relations
- [x] add alias() method to ActiveQuery to fix #4972
- [ ] check how this relates to #7263

title: Unable to get data passed via "data-params" in pjax events
author: psolom
body:
Hey, I have found another issue related to #9952.
I am not able to reach extra params passed to pjax via "data-params" attribute.

My button link options are:

``` php
[
    'data-method' => 'post',
    'data-pjax' => 1,
    'data-pjax-container' => '#data-grid',
    'data-pjax-push-state' => 0,
    'data-pjax-timeout' => 0,
    'data-params' => ['foo' => 'bar'],
];
```

But I was not able to get ['foo' => 'bar'] object in pjax events ('pjax:success' e.g.)

I have discovered that "data-params" is not passed to pjax options in yii.js
To solve this issue "pjaxOptions" var in yii.js should be extended with "params" option, and shall look like:

``` js
pjaxOptions = {
    container: pjaxContainer,
    push:pjaxPushState,
    replace:pjaxReplaceState,
    scrollTo:pjaxScrollTo,
    timeout:pjaxTimeout,
    params:params
}
```

After the change I made I have managed to reach passed params as:

``` js
$('#data-grid').on('pjax:success', function (event, data, status, xhr, options) {
    options.params // contains {foo: "bar"} object
});
```

CHANGELOG: 

Option `params` replaced with `originalEvent` which is more flexible as you can reach triggered DOM object. For example, you are able to reach passed params in PJAX event as:

``` js
$('#data-grid').on('pjax:success', function (event, data, status, xhr, options) {
    $(options.originalEvent.currentTarget).data('params'); // contains {foo: "bar"} object
});
```

title: Fix #10217 for the case when there is hidden input combined with list view
author: omnilight
body:
I've found small, but important bug.

I the case when you have standard `Html::activeListView` as a filter input, it really adds two inputs: one is select with the name `name[]` and second is hidden input with name `name`. Second one is passed, when no value is selected.

In the case we have selected some value, query string will be: `name=&name[]=1&name[]=2`. That's correct. Now, if you deselect all values from select, `applyFilter` function will find only hidden's input value (because of `$(settings.filterSelector).serializeArray()`). So, when later it will try to override query string values, it will not override `&name[]=1&name[]=2` part because no key `name[]` will be in the `keysInFilter` variable. So my new pull-request is fixing with behavior
#10217

title: applyFilter method in yii.gridView.js cuts off all vars with the same name and left only the last in order
author: psolom
body:
As I described in #10284 I have faced an important issue that brokes url upon filtering grid view. This PR brings fix to this issue. Description of the bug:

My url:
`http://domain.com/product/index?ProductSearch%5Bname%5D=test&page=1&per-page=2&sel%5B%5D=8&sel%5B%5D=9&sel%5B%5D=10`

After it filtered with `applyFilter` method of `yii.gridView.js` it lost all `sel` vars except last one and becomes like:
`http://domain.com/product/index?ProductSearch%5Bname%5D=test&page=1&per-page=2&sel%5B%5D=10`

So filtering cuts all vars with the same name and left only the last in order.
This happens due to `getQueryParams` method in `yii.js`. Here is the result of `console.log(yii.getQueryParams(settings.filterUrl));` in `applyFilter` method:

```
{
    ProductSearch[name]: "test",
    page: "1",
    per-page: "2",
    sel[]: "10"
}
```

As you can see `yii.getQueryParams` didn't respect multiple veriables with the same name. With the PR `yii.getQueryParams` returns now object like:

```
{
    ProductSearch[name]: "test",
    page: "1",
    per-page: "2",
    sel[]: [
        "8",
        "9",
        "10"
    ]
}
```

title: Changed UrlManagers rule cacheKey to be a protected property
author: lordthorzonus
body:
I ran into an issue with route caching while extending the UrlManager in my project to load completely different sets of url rules per app locale. 

This enhancement makes the UrlManager and its descendants able to change the cache key with which the rules are stored and therefore allows it to be more easily extendable.

title: Fixed client-side IP validator
author: tafid
body:
I found a problem with client-side IP validation.
When the validated value does not have a CIDR, the `matches[4]` that represents CIDR part is `undefined` instead of expected empty string.
It leads to a wrong comparison in the if statement below, causing invalid behavior.
My patch fixes the default value for the described case and restores expected behavior.

title: MessageController output DB lost EOL when unused messages unchanged
author: Vovan-VE
body:
When storing messages to DB and neither `removeUnused`, nor `markUnused`
is enabled, then output about obsoleted messages won't say anything
about update results and lost EOL:

``` shell
[/path] $ ./yii message/extract ...
Extracting messages from <file>...

Extracting messages from <file>...

Inserting new messages...saved.
Updating obsoleted messages...[/path] $ _
```

Patched to explain what happened and fix EOL:

``` shell
...
Inserting new messages...saved.
Updating obsoleted messages...kept untouched.
[/path] $ _
```

title: file validator and mimeTypes by mask #5469
author: kirsenn
body:
Closes #5469

Added feature, now you can use

``` php
new FileValidator([
    'mimeTypes' => ['image/*', 'text/*']
]);
```

Client validation also available.
I've tried to add some unit tests, but I couldn't mock the FileHelper which method getMimeType is trying to reach real file in filesystem, so I removed them, you can check it at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/39f737df206893079ac008434377dc19a18f6e9f

How it works.
When mimeTypes are presented the `FileValidator::validateMimeType` will be called, if any mime type has '*' symbol then it calls `FileValidator::validateMimeTypeMask` method which creates a regular expression for validating by mask. The same at client side.

title: \yii\base\Security updates
author: tom--
body:
This PR attempts to implement everything discussed in
- Use PHP 7 random_bytes() in \base\Security #9878 
- Stop using openssl_random_pseudo_bytes() #9879 
-  \base\Security should use PHP's password_hash() by default #9880 

It also adds LibreSSL as a safe alternative to OpenSSL on any platform and, for Windows only on PHP >= 5.4.0, keeps `openssl_random_pseudo_bytes()` after all because it doesn't actually use OpenSSL and goes to CryptGenRandom instead.

I also added type and range checks to `generateRandomString()`. We don't generally do a lot of input checking in Yii methods but in a security API like this I think it's wise. Otherwise invisible app bugs are unmasked by these checks.

Testing the new `generateRandomKey()` isn't simple. I temporarily instrumented `::$_randomSource` so I could see that the different branches were operating correctly and I tested with
-  5.4.45 
-  5.5.30 with and without mcrypt ext
-  5.6.16 with and without LibreSSL 2.3.1
-  7.0.0

But I don't know how to implement those tests permanently.

**I haven't tested on Windows.**

I could add tests for `generateRandomString()`'s type and range checks. But it's difficult for `generateRandomKey()` because in PHP 7, different exceptions are thrown. I haven't found a solution for that.

title: fix #10435 with file get contents(/dev/urandom)
author: tom--
body:
let's consider this alternative too (compare to #10435).

Using `fopen()` and `fread()` allows us to cache file pointer. But that's not necessarily useful.

`file_get_contents()` has two advantages:
- simpler code, easier to understand, less likely to have bugs—**as already demonstrated**
- "file_get_contents() is the preferred way to read the contents of a file into a string. It will use memory mapping techniques if supported by your OS to enhance performance."

I'm not really comfortable with the `fread()` code.

title: Dieharder randomness tests for Security::generateRandomKey()
author: tom--
body:
No issue for this PR. 

This adds one unit tests running ten of the [dieharder](http://www.phy.duke.edu/~rgb/General/dieharder.php) randomness tests. It is skipped if the dieharder program isn't on the test machine. There are Homebrew and Ubuntu dieharder packages.

Works on OS X with:
- PHP 7.0.0  → should use `random_bytes()`
- PHP 5.6.16 LibreSSL  + mcrypt → should use the first `openssl_random_pseudo_bytes()`
- PHP 5.4.45 OpenSSL + mcrypt → should use `mycrypt_create_iv()`
- PHP 5.4.45 OpenSSL - mcrypt → should use `file_get_contents('/dev/urandom')`

The second `openssl_random_pseudo_bytes()` only runs on Windows.

title: Migration - added comment(), unsigned() methods. Supports only [MySQL]
author: skhdev
body:
1. All integer types can have an optional (nonstandard) attribute UNSIGNED. Unsigned type can be used to permit only nonnegative numbers in a column or when you need a larger upper numeric range for the column. For example, if an INT column is UNSIGNED, the size of the column's range is the same but its endpoints shift from -2147483648 and 2147483647 up to 0 and 4294967295.
2. Also added comment() method, more useful.

How to use:

$this->createTable('table', [
            'id' => $this->primaryKey(),
            'some_column' => $this->integer()->unsigned()->comment('Comment will be here.'),
            ...
        ]);

title: Making internal UrlManager cache protected(instead of private) to all…
author: dmdark
body:
There is an rare issue with UrlManager internal private cache. For example we have this rule configuration:

``` php
 'urlManager' => [
    'class' => 'yii\web\UrlManager',
    'enablePrettyUrl' => true,
    'showScriptName' => false,
    'hostInfo' => 'http://www.test.dev',
    'baseUrl' => '/',
    'suffix' => '/',
    'rules' => [
        [
            'pattern' => '/special-cities/<city:(moscow|kazan|barcelona)+>',
            'route' => 'company/index',
        ],
        [
            'pattern' => '<city:[\w-]+>/cities',
            'route' => 'company/index'
        ],

    ]
```

We have special rule for 3 cities and the second universal rule. If we start generating our urls with URL that matched by second rule (for example "London"), than ALL other cities, including cities from the first rule we by matched by second rule (NOT the first one). That is how internal cache work - it just saves the first matched rule in private property and than use it for same routes.

For example:

``` php
  echo Url::to(['company/index', 'city' => 'kazan'], true) . "\n";
  echo Url::to(['company/index', 'city' => 'moscow'], true) . "\n";
  echo Url::to(['company/index', 'city' => 'london'], true) . "\n";
```

will be: 
http://www.test.dev/special-cities/kazan/
http://www.test.dev/special-cities/moscow/
http://www.test.dev/london/cities/

**Its correct!** But if we use:

``` php
echo Url::to(['company/index', 'city' => 'london'], true) . "\n";
echo Url::to(['company/index', 'city' => 'kazan'], true) . "\n";
echo Url::to(['company/index', 'city' => 'moscow'], true) . "\n";
```

the result will be:
_http://www.test.dev/london/cities/
http://www.test.dev/kazan/cities/
http://www.test.dev/moscow/cities/_

Its **incorrect** because of internal cache.
### Fix

We can implement some public settings. Like `$useCache` in UrlRule or `$useInternalCache` in UrlManager. But the case is pretty rare and I think it is not it worth it. Better just to make cache _overridable_ (protected instead of private) so the developers could override it or turn it off. 

So I made it in this pull request.

title: Prefixes for yii.activeForm.js event names
author: dizeee
body:
The yii.activeForm.js script triggers `ajaxComplete` event named the same as jQuery's `ajaxComplete` which causes duplicate `$(document).ajaxComplete()` handlers execution.

For example the built in ajax redirect (`initRedirectHandler()` in yii.js) is triggered two times, which makes `Yii::$app->session->setFlash()` useless at least with Firefox 43.0.4 browser because it makes two requests but aborts the first one so the flash data is lost. In Chrome 47 the redirect is OK but still duplicate handlers execution.

Using prefixes in custom event names is a good practice.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/845698/12213980/33e42b0c-b695-11e5-901f-6c4e4adaa163.jpg)

I believe it's just typo.
Compare the two lines in `BaseMigrateController` at line 125:

```
$this->stdout("No new migration found. Your system is up-to-date.\n", Console::FG_GREEN);
```

and at line 462:

```
$this->stdout("No new migrations found. Your system is up-to-date.\n", Console::FG_GREEN);
```

The first one lost 's'.
It may seem unworthy of attention, but it complicates the parsing process of migration script result - I have to compare for different string for `migrate/up` and `migrate/new` commands. The PR suggests to make the stdout strings identical.

title: reverted c00b97a/#9915, this is expected behavior
author: cebe
body:
reverted c00b97a/#9915

When accessing non-existing properties it is [expected behavior to throw an error](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/7193#issuecomment-73287156).
This is the case in all other places of the framework.

It is also not reliably possible to determine whether a property exists beforehand.
it is not sufficient to call `property_exists()` as it may be available via `__get()`.

Instead of `property_exists()` or `isset()` it should call `$object->canGetProperty()` but this is not
guaranteed to be implemented and therefor doing such a check will not work in 2.0.x as it breaks BC.

calling isset() may break code that works through __get() but has not implemented __isset() properly.

We may discuss this for 2.1 again but I am in favor of keeping it as is.

title: 10555 - Fix for ActiveForm - When previous action doesn't reload page, this action will be triggered again when another submit button clicked
author: andrewnester
body:
Updating hidden field that represents submit button was moved to separate method `updateHiddenButton`

This method now called in `submitForm` method after data is validated and valid.

It is used for cases when we have multiple submit buttons on one active form.
It relates to #10555

Also this fix is important for #10322 because otherwise after we click on Submit to a new window button it will be opened in new window but the page with form will not be reloaded. If after this we click on Submit button, form will be loaded in new window anyway.

This fix solves these problems by updating hidden field every time submit button clicked and form is sent

title: Fixed a wrong method calling.

body:
If using `all()`, the value of `$customer` will be an array of
`Customer` instances, not a `Customer` instance.  Consequently,

```
$customer->unlink('orders', $customer->orders[0]);
```

will throw a PHP Fatal Error: Call to a member function unlink() on array.

title: fix dropdown list filtering in gridview, when gridview inserted with …
author: vologab
body:
When GridView ([/some_grid_view]  route) (surrounded by Pjax widget) inserted in page (for example in Tab widget [/tab_with_gridview route]), then, when using dropdown filter sending request without pjax, and page redirecting to [ /some_grid_view route].

It's happen because, Pjax generate listeners for element $('#some_grid_id form[data-pjax]'), but yii.gridView.js create form in "root" DOM, so event listener not catch form.submit event.

title: Fix compare validator
author: hustnaive
body:
as issue #8884 said, when I use `CompareValidator` to compare numberic string, I would get the wrong result sometimes. As if I compare the input string '00' and '000', and use compare type 'string', then the result would be true, but I don't think the string made of two zeroes is equal to that of three.

so, I think it is a bug, when the compare type is string, we must use `strcmp` instead of `==` .

this is an adjustment of #10188 fixing  #7405
isActive() should not be affected in any way by specifying "optional" property.
isActive() should be determined from only and except.
If it is active it can then be checked if optional or not.
Currently this changes the behavior that except will always have precedence.

@SilverFire please merge if you agree.

title: Advanced table alias handling for Query
author: cebe
body:
This is the basis to implement a solution for #2377 on top of it, which is #10817.

Allows to disambiguate colums without knowing the alias that has been
defined for a table elsewhere (e.g. in a relation definition).
- fixes #8743 and fixes #7263 by introducing alias syntax on querybuilder level `{{@table}}` to resolve table aliases.
  similar to table prefix and table name escape syntax.
- fixes #9326 by adding `getAlias()` and `applyAlias()` to `Query`
- fixes #4972 by adding and `alias()` to `ActiveQuery`

TODO:
- [x] add CHANGELOG lines.

title: Added Alias Syntax for joinWith()
author: cebe
body:
Add alias syntax to joinWith(), e.g. joinWith('author a').
No need to know the table name for defining an alias for the relation.

fixes #2377, alternative to #8788, which allows later implementation of
getting alias and column name ambiguation.

depends on #10813 to be merged first.

title: Activequery::joinWith() alias
author: cebe
body:
this is the final solution to fix #2377 and #4972.

replaces #10817.
- [x] TODO: agree on a name for `alias()` method. A short summary about discussion so far:

`alias()` is short and quite clear about what it does. it defines an alias for something.

`tableAlias()` adds no further information as we are deailing with tables only anyway here.
"alias" should be part of the name as that is what it does.
not sure if we can add a word that makes it clear that it is the alias for the base table and not for joined ones.

`modelTableAlias()` as proposed by @klimov-paul is very specific about what it does but a bit long.
we already have `modelClass` inside an `ActiveQuery`
thus he supposed it should be `modelTableAlias`

`baseAlias()` as proposed by @mdomba is shorter but maybe not clear enough about what `base` means.

@qiangxue @samdark @SilverFire can we have your input on the name?

title: AccessRule should do more than just string comparison to match IPs
author: cebe
body:
See for example on IPv6, the same address may be written in different formats:
- `2a01:04f8:0120:7202:0000:0000:0000:0002`
- `2a01:04f8:120:7202:0:0:0:2`
- `2a01:4f8:120:7202::2`

See also http://v6decode.com/#address=2a01%3A4f8%3A120%3A7202%3A%3A2

This only adds a failing test, no implementation, so do not merge. If someone wants to work on this, feel free to do so.

title: Brings migrations up to parity
author: df2
body:
## Schema Builder Bonanza

MySQL, Cubrid and Oracle support AFTER, FIRST and UNSIGNED. SQLite supports UNSIGNED but not AFTER or FIRST. MSSQL and PostgreSQL support neither. 

✔ New: Unsigned primary keys: `primaryKey()->unsigned()` and `bigPrimaryKey()->unsigned()`
✔ New: Constraint methods: `first()` and `after()`
✔ New: Added `char` data type to framework
✔ New: Pattern template in `ColumnSchemaBuilder::__toString()`
✔ Enh: Reorganized `QueryBuilderTest::columnTypes()` data structures
## TODO
### Pt. 1

Need to verify on DBMS:
- [x] MySQL
- [x] PostgreSQL
- [x] SQLite
### Pt. 2
- [x] Tests for `after()`, `first()` and `unsigned()`
### Pt. 3 _complete_

Need to verify on DBMS:
- [x] MySQL
- [x] PostgreSQL
- [x] SQLite

title: Use theme applyTo in View findViewFile
author: jacmoe
body:
In View::findViewFile use `$this->theme->applyTo($path)` before checking if $path is a file.

If this is not done, then Yii will find the view file in the active module's view path instead of looking in the theme path map. This is a problem only when using a view renderer with a different file extension than php. Like .twig and .jade.

Without this small fix, we have to drop dummy empty files in the module's view directories :-1:

title: db/oci/Schema.php implementing PDO::CASE_LOWER
author: CedricYii
body:
When you want to use Pdo lowercase in Yii, you have to set db component in config/main-local.php with:

```
<?php
return [
    'components' => [
        'db' => [
            'attributes' => [PDO::ATTR_CASE => PDO::CASE_LOWER,],
...
```

Then with this schema version, you will get all tables and columns names in lowercase in Yii.
All tables and columns MUST be left in the default upper case in the database Oracle.

With this configuration, you can now use the advance template out of the box.

title: Support customer logger objects via config arrays
author: bionoren
body:
For reasons I don't fully understand, if you define in your web.php config ['log' => 'logger' => ['class' => 'app\custom\logger'], ...], the value of $config['logger'] at this point is ['class' => 'app\custom\logger'], which setLogger will try to treat as an option on line 127 (which obviously causes an error). This is my attempt to support the standard config array.

Note that you can't instantiate app\custom\logger and provided it in the logger config value, since the autoloader doesn't know about your app namespace yet.

title: JSON_ERROR_SYNTAX fix for json_decode(null) in PHP 7
author: fps01
body:
json_decode produce error when decoding `null` or empty string in PHP 7.

Example.

``` php
var_dump(json_decode(null));
var_dump(json_last_error());
```

PHP 5.4.0 - 5.6.19, hhvm-3.6.1 - 3.12.0 returns:

```
NULL
int(0)
```

PHP 7.0.0 - 7.0.4 returns:

```
NULL
int(4)
```

I think we must exclude `null` and epmty string from a decode function becouse json_decode returns a right value.
What do you think about it?

title: Fixed yii\widgets\ActiveField to handle AJAX validation for inputs with changed IDs
author: dizeee
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | #7627 |

If `ActiveForm::$enableClientValidation` is set to `false` and `ActiveForm::$enableAjaxValidation` is set to `true`, than validation doesn't work no more because errors returned from the ajax validation are still formatted as `{"model-attribute": ["Error"]}`, but the attribute id in clientOptions is now set to `customid`, not `model-attribute`, so the script doesn't see the attribute errors in the response. I think the proper code in \yii\widgets\ActiveField::getClientOptions() should be:

```
$inputID = $this->getInputId();
$options['id'] = Html::getInputId($this->model, $this->attribute);
// not $options['id'] = $inputID
```

I'll tinker a bit with it and make a pull request if I'll find this working for both client and ajax validation.
Fix for the #7627 was already made by @dynasource and @cebe and the issue was closed, but it fixed only client validation while AJAX validation was left broken.

title: Multidimensional Superglobals in request
author: E-conomy
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes (also used for months in large live environment) |
| Fixed issues | Multidimensional Superglobals can now be written/read |

Currently, users can only read one dimensional $_GET $_POST etc.. SUPERGLOBALS. Such as 

`Yii::$app->request->post('item');`

With this change users can also read multidimensional GET/POST etc..

An array can be provided as parameter now:

`Yii::$app->request->post(['item', 'description'])`

or

`Yii::$app->request->get(['user', 'profile', 'name'])`

There is no limit (outside HTML form HTTP header limitations) on the depth of dimensions that can be accessed.

**Most importantly: The current functionality is fully maintained, this addition only extends with new functionality.**

Метод позволяет удобно возвращать клиента на страницу запроса.

Пример использования. Допустим есть флеш сообщение которое висит по всему сайту "подтвердите email" в нем ссылка на "повторно отослать проверочный код". При нажатии на ссылку отправляется письмо и с использованием метода goReferrer браузер перебрасывается на страницу запроса. Пользователь ничего не заметил, страница не поменяеась а только появился еще один флеш "сообщение повторно выслано"

PS: док не писал, не владею языком на должном уровне.

title: Security enhancements
author: samdark
body:
Based on @tom-- #11146 with `fread` commit applied on top. I've made some changes:
- Removed PHP version checks since both are met by default because Yii requires 5.4.0+.
- Limit PHP fread buffer in order to prevent entropy wasting.
- Fixed incorrect bytes to read calculation.
- Added more notes explaining decisions.

title: `MigrateController` refactored avoiding internal state changing
author: klimov-paul
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | depends |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | yes: changes signature for the new methods intoduced at 2.0.7 |
| Tests pass? | yes |

Recent changes at `MigrateController`, which allows autogenerating migration source code, are done in the way internal controller state is changed during the process.

Thus in case you invoke `actionCreate()` twice at the same program flow - it will end with an error.

This refactoring allows `fields` paramter to be left intact and removes redundant internal field `foreignKeys`.

title: Generate the javascript to validate the client only when really necessary
author: thiagotalma
body:
When we use the `RequiredValidator->when` and `RequiredValidator->whenClient`, we want to decide whether the field is required or not.

However, the generation of validation javascript code does not respect the rule when we have only the `RequiredValidator->when` set. Then the client will always validate the field as required.

In this PR, the validation on the client is only done when there is no `RequiredValidator->whenClient` rule and, having the `RequiredValidator->when` rule, the field is mandatory.

| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | #7540 #7546 |

title: Handles relation's alias in relation declaration
author: CedricYii
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | not tested through yii unit tests |
| Fixed issues | #10883 |

Using the syntax `==relationAlias==`, the query inside a relation can now adress the alias of the relation without knowing it in advance.

Example:

``` php
class Customer {
...
  public function getOrders()
  {
      return $this->hasMany( Order::className(), ['customerid' => 'customerid'] )
                  ->andOnCondition( [ '==relationAlias==.statusid' => 1 ] );
  }
...
}
```

Then

``` php
$customer = Customer::find()
                   ->alias( 'c' )
                   ->innerJoinWith('orders o');
```

Build the query:

```
select customer.* from customer c
join order o on o.customerid = c.customerid 
where o.statusid = 1
```

title: Fixes #7670 Added normalizer to yii\web\UrlRule
author: cronfy
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | yes |
| Tests pass? | yes/no |
| Fixed issues | #7670 |

This pull request introduces canonizer option in `yii\web\UrlRule`. With it one is able to choose strategy to use when dealing with trailing slashes: redirect, throw 404 or just route.

This is PREVIEW-only version (with some debug code). I would like to hear any feedback and correct the code.

I created this enhancement to avoid routing logic to spread between yii config, `.htaccess` and `on beforeRequest` events. I want to keep this logic in single place and as close to routing rules itself as possible.

Implementation also helps when dealing with legacy code, where different behavior is required at different sections of a site and it is required to keep existing behavior while switching to yii2. Say, `site.org/news/` would require trailing slash with redirect if no slash found, but `site.org/catalog` would require no trailing slashes with 404 if one is given.

Example usage for yii2-basic (I wrap it into GroupUrlRule to demonstrate how it can be isolated from other routing rules, but standalone rules still working of course):

```
'rules' => [
    [
        'class' => 'yii\web\GroupUrlRule',
        'ruleConfig' => ['class' => 'yii\web\UrlRule', 'canonize' => 'trailing-slash'],
        'rules' => [
            'test/home' => 'site/index',
            // ... other rules
        ]
    ]
]
```

With this config 
- `http://site.com/test/home/` shows `site/index` page (yii2 default behavior for `$suffix = '/'`)
- `http://site.com/test/home` will redirect to `http://site.com/test/home/` (introduced behavior).
- `http://site.com/////test///home////` will redirect to  `http://site.com/test/home/` too (introduced behavior).
- `Url::toRoute('site/index')` will produce `/test/home/` (yii2 default behavior for `$suffix = '/'`).

More complex example: 

```
'rules' => [
    [
        'class' => 'yii\web\GroupUrlRule',
        'ruleConfig' => [
            'class' => 'yii\web\UrlRule',
            'canonize' => [
                'trailing-slash' => null, // ignore whether trailing slash exists or not
                'collapse-slashes' => true, // collapse multiple slashes to one
                'action' => '404' // throw NotFound exception for urls with multiple shashes
            ]
        ],
        'rules' => [
            'test/home' => 'site/index',
            // ... other rules
        ]
    ]
]
```

With this config 
- `http://site.com/test/home` shows the page `site/index` (yii2 default behavior for `$suffix = ''`)
- `http://site.com/test/home/` shows 404 page from yii2`(yii2 default behavior for``$suffix = ''``)
- `http://site.com/////test///home////` shows 404 from canonizer (introduced bhavior).
- `Url::toRoute('site/index')` will produce `/test/home` (no trailing slash, yii2 default behavior for `$suffix = ''`).

title: loadMultiple() returns true even if load() returns false
author: xaerobiont
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | may be |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | yes |

The problem is `loadMultiple()` method in `base/Model` doesn't checks result of `load()`.
I.e. you don't specify some property as safe or any other situation when `load()` returns `false` - you get `true` from loadMultiple. In other words method anyway returns true even is something failed. I think it's bug.

Futhermore: I beleive this method should return false if one of the models doesn't loaded, but now it returns true whether at least one of them populated. I think it's not good, but I didn't change this logic.

title: #4479 REST filtering support by involving a search class
author: tunecino
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | not covered but should pass |
| Fixed issues | none. ENH related to #4479 |

**Usage:**

``` php
namespace app\controllers;

class UserController extends \yii\rest\ActiveController
{
    public $modelClass = 'app\models\User';
    public $searchClass = 'app\models\UserSearch'
}
```

Then being sure that the search class is using `$this->load($params, '' )` instead of `$this->load($params)` (as generated by _gii_) **or** by alternatively overriding `formName()` in model:

``` php
public function formName()
{
    return '';
}
```

**Results:**
`yii\rest\IndexAction` should use that search class to filter results (if is set) when doing `/resources?attribute1=value&attribute2=value2&...` as defined and handled in the search class where also validations, scenarios and custom rules can be maintained.

**Note:**
The search class existed and has been widely used since Yii 1.x but as a simple example generated by _gii_ and as first was designed by @qiangxue. I think it is time to make it implement an interface as we should expect the class to have a search method in this case or in future cases.

title: array_key_exists problem
author: timestee
body:
Double/Float key will be automatically translated to an int. So when
you do $array[1.0] = 2;, $array[1] will be defined.But for
array_key_exists(), this conversion is not done automatically. I
encountered this problem with key 660019  under a weird  environment.

To take the speed advantage of isset() while keeping the reliable
result from array_key_exists(), Perhaps the below code works the best:
isset($array[$key]) || array_key_exists($key, $array)

- `on update` does not exist in Oracle, potentially a trigger could be added here

title: Added FileMailer implementation of mailer interface
author: dmeroff
body:
Added `yii\swiftmailer\FileMailer` that saves emails under runtime directory, which can be useful during development.

 `yii\swiftmailer\FileMailer` has 2 properties:
- `path` - the path under which email will be written. If it is not set, `@app/runtime/mail` directory will be used
- `callback` - the callback that is used to generate filename

PHP7 `--grounp=base`

```
Tests: 146, Assertions: 2939, Skipped: 1.
```

PHP7 with Xdebug `--grounp=base`

```
Tests: 146, Assertions: 2939, Skipped: 1.

I guess PHP7's trace string generator was affected from array optimization, then lacks compatibility for referenced zval.

title: Fixes false positive on loadFilesRecursive
author: brummm
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues |  |

When running a functional test with codeception, I wasn't getting a null of UploadedFile::getInstance().

Examining further, I realized that the $errors variable type, on elseif, was a string and UPLOAD_ERR_NO_FILE was a integer, therefore the test was returning true ($errors !== UPLOAD_ERR_NO_FILE).

But the $errors value was "4" (string) and UPLOAD_ERR_NO_FILE is 4 (integer).

intval($errors) worked for me and I see no drawbacks on using it.

title: Восстановление обратной совместимости yii\db\QueryBuilder
author: stranger-ru
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | yes/no |
| Tests pass? | no |

До версии `2.0.8` при передаче в методы, подобные:

```
$query->andFilterWhere(['in', 'поле', 'значение']);
```

если `значение` было не массивом, то оно преобразовывалось в массив в **yii\db\QueryBuilder**:
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/2.0.7/framework/db/QueryBuilder.php#L1115

В версии `2.0.8` это преобразование убрали, что повлекло за собой большое количество поломанного кода в различных проектах.

Я вернул это преобразование `значение` в **yii\db\QueryBuilder** обратно.

title: Chg #11689 Using closures for View::renderDynamic()
author: ElisDN
body:
Changed `yii\base\View::beginCache()` and `yii\base\View::renderDynamic()` to work with placeholders and closures instead of `eval()`._x000D_
_x000D_
Before:_x000D_
_x000D_
``` php_x000D_
if ($this->beginCache($id)) {_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
    echo $this->renderDynamic('return Yii::$app->user->identity->name');_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
    $this->endCache();_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
After:_x000D_
_x000D_
``` php_x000D_
if ($this->beginCache($id, ['placeholders' => [_x000D_
    'username' => Yii::$app->user->identity->name_x000D_
]])) {_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
    echo $this->renderDynamic('username');_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
    $this->endCache();_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
or:_x000D_
_x000D_
``` php_x000D_
if ($this->beginCache($id, ['placeholders' => [_x000D_
    'username' => function () {_x000D_
        return Yii::$app->user->identity->name;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
]])) {_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
    echo $this->renderDynamic('username');_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
    $this->endCache();_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q | A |_x000D_
| --- | --- |_x000D_
| Is bugfix? | no |_x000D_
| New feature? | yes |_x000D_
| Breaks BC? | yes |_x000D_
| Tests pass? | yes |_x000D_
| Fixed issues | #11689 |_x000D_

title: Adds indexes on message tables which partly fixes #11725
author: OndrejVasicek
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | enhancement |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | - |
| Fixed issues | #11725 |

I added message indexes into the migration script and tested it.

I also added indexes into the SQL file for PostgreSQL. I used “clustered” (see https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.1/static/sql-cluster.html), which isn’t possible via migration method, but it’s welcome here. Also tested.

I’m afraid I don’t have enough knowledge to complete other languages. Is it generated or made manually? Do you think you could complete it?

DBs support:
- [x] PostgreSQL
- [x] MySQL
- [x] MSSQL
- [x] SQLite
- [x] Oracle

title: When db don't support comments, then show warning instead throw excep…
author: AnikanovD
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | ? |
| New feature? | ? |
| Breaks BC? | ? |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | #11841 |

Migration

```
<?php

use yii\db\Migration;

class m160705_104733_test_sqlite extends Migration
{
    public function up()
    {
                $this->createTable('some', [
                        'column' => $this->string()->comment('hay hay'),
                ]);
    }

    public function down()
    {
        echo "m160705_104733_test_sqlite cannot be reverted.\n";

        return false;
    }
}
```

Before

```
Yii Migration Tool (based on Yii v2.0.9-dev)

Creating migration history table "migration"...Done.
Total 1 new migration to be applied:
    m160705_104733_test_sqlite

Apply the above migration? (yes|no) [no]:yes
*** applying m160705_104733_test_sqlite
    > create table some ...
Exception 'yii\base\UnknownMethodException' with message 'Calling unknown method: m160705_104733_test_sqlite::db()'

in /var/www/at.anikanov.me/yiihack/web/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Component.php:285

Stack trace:
...
```

After

```
Yii Migration Tool (based on Yii v2.0.9-dev)

Creating migration history table "migration"...Done.
Total 1 new migration to be applied:
    m160705_104733_test_sqlite

Apply the above migration? (yes|no) [no]:yes
*** applying m160705_104733_test_sqlite
    > create table some ...
    > sqlite is not support comments
    > done (time: 0.011s)
*** applied m160705_104733_test_sqlite (time: 0.032s)


1 migration was applied.

Migrated up successfully.

```

title: Improve BaseArrayHelper::keyExists speed a little bit
author: egorio
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |

Somebody can use BaseArrayHelper::keyExists in loops. 
I think we can improve BaseArrayHelper::keyExists with added isset(...) before array_key_exists because it works a little bit faster.

We also can do it in some other places, but I'm not sure it's necessary.

Ref: http://php.net/manual/en/function.array-key-exists.php#107786

title: Activerecord where exists relation
author: urusai88
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | ? |

Allows to use relations in exists where.

``` php
$document->andWhere(['exists', 'comments']);
```

result:

``` sql
SELECT * FROM {{%document}} WHERE EXISTS (SELECT * FROM {{%comment}} WHERE {{%document}}.[[id]] = {{%comment}}.[[doc_id]])
```

``` php
$document->andWhere(['and', ['exists', 'comments'], ['exists', 'opens']]);
```

result:

``` sql
SELECT * FROM {{%document}} WHERE (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM {{%comment}} WHERE {{%document}}.[[id]] = {{%comment}}.[[doc_id]])) AND (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM {{%open}} WHERE {{%document}}.[[id]] = {{%open}}.[[doc_id]]))
```

``` php
$document->andWhere(['exists', 'comments' => function(ActiveQuery $q){
    $q->alias('alias');
}]);
```

result:

``` sql
SELECT * FROM {{%document}} WHERE EXISTS (SELECT * FROM {{%comment}} `alias` WHERE {{%document}}.[[id]] = {{alias}}.[[doc_id]])
```

title: Allow overriding 'app' messages by wildcard category
author: squio
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | probably not |
| Tests pass? | most likely |
| Fixed issues | comma-separated list of tickets # fixed by the PR, if any |

When a wildcard '*' message category is specified in config, the messages for category 'app' are still hard-coded to PhpMessageSource with default configuration. This is confusing.

This patch applies the configuration for '*' to category 'app' as well.

The occurrence of `{attribute_name}` in template property will be replaced by name of the corresponding attribute when rendering.It can be used to add class to the DetailView row. Eg. ``` php $template = '{label}{value}'; ```

title: Make simple url rule with default parameter
author: mdmunir
body:
Currently, to make url rule with default parameter, we must do this

``` php
'rules' => [
    ...
    [
        'pattern' => 'about',
        'route' => 'site/page',
        'defaults' => ['view' => 'about']
    ]
]
```

IMO, its more simple if we just do this

``` php
'rules' => [
    'about' => ['site/page', 'view' => 'about']
]
```

title: Reverted fix of beforeValidate event calling in `yii.activeForm.js`
author: SilverFire
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | yes (fixes) |
| Fixed issues | #10681, #11972, probably #11992 |

I'm reverting @lynicidn commit e8bcb93 because it introduces buggy behavior. The problem that was reported in #10681 is not a bug indeed.
1. From the docs: 
   > beforeValidate event is triggered before validating the whole form
2. AJAX validation is being executed each time for all available inputs, but the result of AJAX validation will be used for each particular input only when it was touched at least once. It means, that each AJAX validation call does not mean full form validation.
3. For Ajax validation we have `ajaxBeforeSend` and `ajaxComplete` events

@nkovacs, @samdark, @githkim, @lynicidn - if you have something to add - feel free to text your ideas. Otherwise, the PR will be merged in 3 days.

Thank you

| Q | A |

Currently when the $filterInputOptions in yii\grid\DataColumn is overruled with only a custom prompt in the new array, it will loose its bootstrap class and make it look like a default select box.

This PR fixes to problem, that way when only the prompt is changed, the class will stay it is default, and does need to be specific in the custom array.

for specific databases.

- create: `$command->createView(string $name, \yii\db\Query $subquery)`
- drop: `$command->dropView(string $name)`

title: Revamps PageCache to store data in one entry (#10506)
author: sergeymakinen
body:
| Q | A |_x000D_
| --- | --- |_x000D_
| Is bugfix? | yes |_x000D_
| New feature? | yes |_x000D_
| Breaks BC? | no |_x000D_
| Tests pass? | yes |_x000D_
| Fixed issues | #10506 |_x000D_
_x000D_
This updated `PageCache` combines together `PageCache` and `FragmentCache` to provide caching in one entry._x000D_
### Features_x000D_
- fully backwards compatible (incl. dynamic content)_x000D_
- easy to be extended_x000D_
- able to store/retrieve an additional data in `beforeCacheResponse` and `afterRestoreResponse` (_for example: I store Last-Modified in data and then retrieve it later in `HttpCache`_)_x000D_
- all data is stored in one cache entry_x000D_
- able to cancel caching by returning `false` in `beforeCacheResponse`_x000D_

title: Add short validator names `time` and `datetime`.
author: nkovacs
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | yes, but highly unlikely in practice (see below) |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues |  |

These map to `DateValidator` with `$type` set to
TYPE_TIME and TYPE_DATETIME.

Looking at [Validator::createValidator](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/2.0.9/framework/validators/Validator.php#L190), if the model has a method called `time` or `datetime`, this won't override it, but if there's a class called `time` or `datetime`, it will override the class. This is extremely unlikely, since classes are usually uppercased and namespaced.

title: Add UrlNormalizer for UrlRule and UrlManager
author: rob006
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | ? |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | #7670, #8281, #8370 |

fixes #7670, fixes #8281, fixes #8370
closes #10745, closes #11381

Another attempt to #7670. :) Mostly based on #11381, but with many simplifications and improved performance. By default, there is only one normalizer assigned for UrlMananger and UrlRules reuse it. Each UrlRule can have their own normalizer, which will be cached with rule. Config for normalization of trailing slashes was simplified - right now this behavior depends on suffix: 
- if `suffix` has trailing slash, trailing slash will be forced during normalization
- if `suffix` does not have trailing slash, trailing slashes will be removed during normalization.

title: \yii\data\Filter
author: niksamokhvalov
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | #4479 |

`\yii\data\Filter` for filtering in the RESTful services and forms (GridView). I suggest used parameter `?filter` in format JSON for filtering the collections:

```
/api/v1/users?filter={"field": "value"}
```

and array from the query parameters for forms:

`/news?NewsSearch[year]=2016&NewsSearch[active]=1`

**Operators**
- !=
- >
- <
- <=
- >= 
- % (set in the value)

**Examples**

```
/api/v1/users?filter={"id": [1,6,46,8], "active": 1)
/api/v1/users?filter={"!=id": 13, "age": null)
/api/v1/users?filter={"email": "nik@samokhvalov.info)
/api/v1/users?filter={">=age": 18, "<age": 30, "gender": "w", "name": "%Natalie")
```

**Work in progress**
- [x] Basic logic
- [ ] Data providers
- [ ] tests
- [ ] docs

title: resolveTableNames() update for MSSQL to add case of linked database t…
author: hAppywAy
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | no |

With Mircrosoft SQL Server 2008+, [you may use linked servers](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms188279%28v=sql.110%29.aspx) to work with data from multiple sources. In your statement, to request new server and its db from the old one server, you have to prefix remote dB table by server name you declared into MSSQL.

`return 'remoteServerName.dbName.schemaName.tableName';`

To make it possible, it's necessary to modify Schema.php from mssql classes to include remote server name into resolveTableNames().

title: Language meta information should reflect actual application language (instead of hardcoded EN)
author: basil-inc
body:
Currently, the layout of the basic and advanced app templates has English hardcoded as language:

``` php
<html lang="EN">
```

Since language is a dynamic attribute in the application config. Based on Paul's suggestion, I propose to use this:

``` php
<html lang="<?= str_replace('_', '-', Yii::$app->language) ?>">
```

title: fix sort constants for correct sorting SQL generation
author: iJackUA
body:
as QueryTrait expect now 
`SORT_ASC, SORT_DESC`
instead 
`Query::SORT_ASC, Query::SORT_DESC`

but Sort class was still using "own" sort constans and SQL was generated without ASC / DESC operators

Maybe  QueryTrait code comments should be also changed from

> (e.g. `['id' => SORT_ASC, 'name' => SORT_DESC]`).

to

> (e.g. `['id' => Sort::ASC, 'name' => Sort::DESC]`). 

to use consistent constant naming all over framework ?

title: Bug in yii\db\mysql\QueryBuilder class
author: DrmagicE
body:
In the insert() function,the $columns should be an array for the foreach.
Here is a simple fix that just turns the param into an array.

An example for reproducing the bug:

``` sql
-- (without a  primary key)
create table `yiitest`（

author: akimkelar

| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | comma-separated list of tickets # fixed by the PR, if any |

As you see, if you are a guest, then loginRequired logic are involved. 
BUT! this logic do nothing except adding header with redirect to response. And... Further works standard mechanism of resolving controller/action, action creation and firing it. So, even you do not see result of action work because of redirect, it works. And works very well. You can, for example, delete some record, if you are familiar with yii, you have an idea about database schema (controller user will be good example), even you are the guest and you do not have any idea about the administrator account.
We have fixed this misconception by simple adding of Yii::$app->end() after $user->loginRequired(); in our project.
Please, take action

title: Override template per attribute in widget config
author: squio
body: | Q | A | | --- | --- | | Is bugfix? | no | | New feature? | yes | | Breaks BC? | no | | Tests pass? | yes | This change allows to override the rendering template per attribute for just one or a few attributes. Use case: a DetailView widget containing one full width image without label. This could be achieved to set a template attribute in the relevant config row like this: ``` 'photo' => [ 'attribute' => 'photo', 'template' => '{value}', 'value' => Html::img($model->photo), 'format' => 'raw', ] ```

title: Added first() method to ActiveRecord and Query classes.
author: zalatov
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues |  |

Find one selects all data from DB and then reduce it to one record.
Find first set limit to returned data.

For example, you can execute this:
`
$lastLog = BigLogTable::find()->orderBy(['insert_stamp' => SORT_DESC])->one();
`
And you do not suspect that all entries will be selected before result truncated to one record.

This speciality discussed on yii forums, but not included in repository yet.

Runtime cache of found view files.
This reduce count of calls to disk and manipulations with strings when calculation the result path.
Caching increase speed when findViewFile() calls many times.

For example, we calls $this->renderPartial() for one view file more than 500 times.

title: Sphinx fulltext search engine integration
author: klimov-paul
body:
Relates to #11

Depends on #1205 and #1249

Here is a Sphinx fulltext search engine integration.
It uses ability of the Sphinx searchd daemon to work via MySQL network protocol.

The code have much in common with “yii\db”, but I have to abandon the idea of direct inheritance (instead of Connection class), since the significant differences are present. Still some classes from “yii\db” are used directly, like “Transaction” and “Expression”.

“Relation” feature is still incomplete, while I am waiting for #1205 and #1249 resolution. Still “hasOne” relations work properly both to and from Sphinx Active Record.

Suggestions and critics are welcome.

title: Better Query::andWhere() behavior
author: brandonkelly
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |

This commit slightly improves the behavior of Query::andWhere().

If the query already has conditions on it created with the `['AND', condition1, ...]` array syntax, andWhere() will just append $condition to that array now, rather than creating another nested AND condition.

There’s no tangible difference here, but it makes debugging queries a little easier if andWhere() had been called on it multiple times. Now you're just looking at a single-dimensional array of all the conditions added by andWhere(), rather than several nested conditions.

title: Keeping queries more inexpensive
author: Abbas-Hashemian
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | no |
| New feature? | yes |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | no |
| Fixed issues | comma-separated list of tickets # fixed by the PR, if any |

In different parts of app repetitive cross joins are expensive. An intermediate inner join will enhance it :
(10 + 10)where... < (10 \* 10)where...
We have similar thing in the ActiveQuery. The child queries could be a sub query for a cleaner join but they are merged into the parent query which means multiplication of the number of rows instead of adding the number of rows.

And actually if we use joinWith , the eager loading won't work properly and it still makes two queries instead of one single join query (tracked up to ActiveQueryTrait::findWith -> ActiveRelationTrait::popuplateRelation ... $this->one() and $this->all() without any condition about joinWith). To check it we can make some passive breakpoints (echo without exit) in the Command::queryInternal to see how much load is on an active query command including information_schema.

title: Correct MSIE8 reserved word error
author: mrgarry
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues |  |

In MSIE8 and below, yii.gridView file is not loaded and GridView widget is not working (throws Identifier expected error). The reason is that the variable name 'class' is a reserved word. To correct this, the variable name should be changed into an array key, which eliminates the error.

More info about the causes of error: https://tiffanybbrown.com/2013/09/10/expected-identifier-bug-in-internet-explorer-8/

title: added check for console controller
author: schmunk42
body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no(t really) |
| Tests pass? | see travis |

This addresses errors when using command maps for the application or modules.
The help command scans i.e. command maps of modules and may pick up web controllers, which usually do not have this method.

```
root@106bd7de9315:/app# yii
Exception 'yii\base\UnknownMethodException' with message 'Calling unknown method: app\controllers\user\ProfileController::getHelpSummary()'

in /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Component.php:285

Stack trace:
#0 /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/console/controllers/HelpController.php(96): yii\base\Component->__call('getHelpSummary', Array)
#1 /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/console/controllers/HelpController.php(184): yii\console\controllers\HelpController->getCommandDescriptions()
#2 /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/console/controllers/HelpController.php(67): yii\console\controllers\HelpController->getDefaultHelp()
#3 [internal function]: yii\console\controllers\HelpController->actionIndex(NULL)
#4 /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/InlineAction.php(55): call_user_func_array(Array, Array)

title: Update Html Helper to include bootstrap icon generation.
author: kartik-v
body:
Not sure where to put this. Since Twitter Bootstrap is built into yii framework - proposing this in the `BaseHtml` class. The bootstrap glyphicon is potentially used in a lot of places (in views, grids, navs, menus, buttons), and its a lot easier to use it like the following:

``` php
echo Html::icon('pencil');
```

The prefix `glyphicon glyphicon-` and tag `i` or `span` can be customized as parameters. So this can work even if we have something like `FontAwesome` or  `Jquery UI icons` to be generated by changing the prefix.

title: Use custom error action regardless of response format
author: erikverheij
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
`Yii\web\ErrorHandler` has the ability to set a custom action for rendering errors. Now it uses that action regardless of the response format. Previously the custom action was not triggered when the response format was something other than `FORMAT_HTML` which is unexpected behavior.

title: #12840: Added unit tests for yii.validation.js
author: arogachev
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes, it contains some bug fixes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #12840_x000D_
_x000D_
Used @nkovacs draft as starting point(https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/11037#issuecomment-193356450). I also fixed some bugs in `yii.validation.js` and did some refactoring._x000D_
_x000D_
## Implemented tests_x000D_
_x000D_
- yii.validation.js_x000D_
_x000D_
## Running tests_x000D_
_x000D_
- JS tests use jQuery and Punycode.js libraries from `vendor/bower` to match those that are used in assets and prevent installing and synchronizing duplicates via NPM. So make sure you have them installed. If no - run `composer install` to install them via Composer Asset Plugin._x000D_
- Install Node.js. I used the latest version available at the moment - `v7.1.0`. Note that used `jsdom` dependent library version requires `Node.js >= 4`._x000D_
- Run `npm install` to install dependencies._x000D_
- Execute `npm test` for running tests._x000D_
_x000D_
## Problems list_x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] Sinon can not be installed via Composer Asset Plugin. If I add line `"npm-asset/sinon": "^1.17.6"` to `required-dev` section of `composer.json` and run `composer update` I get the following error:_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
[RuntimeException]_x000D_
Failed to execute git clone --mirror 'git+ssh://git@github.com/sinonjs/sinon.git' '/home/vagrant/.composer/cache/vcs/git-ssh---git-github.com-sinonjs-sinon.git/'_x000D_
Cloning into bare repository '/home/vagrant/.composer/cache/vcs/git-ssh---git-github.com-sinonjs-sinon.git'..._x000D_
Permission denied (publickey)._x000D_
fatal: Could not read from remote repository._x000D_
Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists._x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Possibly related: https://github.com/fxpio/composer-asset-plugin/issues/187._x000D_
_x000D_
I tried `--prefer-dist` option, that didn't help. I also have generated SSH key and it's added it to `ssh-agent` (error is mentioned in [git-workflow](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/internals/git-workflow.md#1-fork-the-yii-repository-on-github-and-clone-your-fork-to-your-development-environment) document which is a part of internal docs)._x000D_
_x000D_
This is not actual anymore because Node.js and NPM are used for testing._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] Sometimes "image validator with FileReader API is not available" test takes a long time to load and gives warning with time written inside of a red label. This is because of swapping native `FileReader`:_x000D_
_x000D_
```js_x000D_
var initialFileReader = FileReader;_x000D_
_x000D_
beforeEach(function () {_x000D_
    FileReader = undefined;_x000D_
});_x000D_
_x000D_
afterEach(function () {_x000D_
    FileReader = initialFileReader;_x000D_
});_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
But:_x000D_
_x000D_
- It happens pretty seldom and increases time by about half of second only._x000D_
- I can't see a better solution for testing this, so this is not a big problem._x000D_
- Similar technique is used for swapping native JS components in other places._x000D_
_x000D_
So this is not a big deal._x000D_
_x000D_
This is not actual anymore because Node.js and NPM are used for testing and for testing that case different approach is used._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] Run tests in command line instead of a browser._x000D_
_x000D_
Node.js and NPM are used for testing._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] Error while running `npm test`:_x000D_
_x000D_
> Error: timeout of 15000ms exceeded. Ensure the done() callback is being called in this test._x000D_
_x000D_
Happens very seldom, this is because of jsdom and integrating jQuery. Default timeout is 2000ms. And this is always not enough, so I increased it to be 15000ms._x000D_
_x000D_
Solved with increasing timeout to 30s, see #13160._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] In build detailed info the line after "with width more than minimum width" (validateImage method, with successfully read image) is not printed. It's OK locally though._x000D_
_x000D_
Can't see it in some builds, maybe it was Travis glitch related with formatting._x000D_
_x000D_
It's gone in the latest builds, for example in [this one](https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/jobs/182190268)._x000D_
_x000D_
## Integration with Travis CI_x000D_
_x000D_
I found this [article](https://ma27.github.io/travis-ci/2016/05/06/travis-for-nodejs-and-php.html) and used it as starting point._x000D_
_x000D_
> TravisCI uses the software which is shipped by default on a `precise`: An ancient setup with NodeJS 0.10 and NPM 1.x. The current 3.x series of NPM is much more stable than the ancient NPM 1.x and fixed a lot of misbehavior which has been implemented in the older versions of NPM. Especially code which has been written for the browser will experience issues due to some implementation details of NPM releases prior to the 3.x series._x000D_
_x000D_
We can't use Node.js < 4 because of [jsdom](https://github.com/tmpvar/jsdom) dependency. I refused to use [3.x branch](https://github.com/tmpvar/jsdom/tree/3.x) of jsdom because it's considered legacy and no longer maintained._x000D_
_x000D_
I tried to change dist to `trusty` and install newer versions of Node.js and NPM. It worked, but another error appeared during creating test MySQL database:_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
- mysql -e 'CREATE DATABASE yiitest;';_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Error's text:_x000D_
_x000D_
> ERROR 2002 (HY000): Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)_x000D_
_x000D_
Then I found https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6842 and fixed it with installation of MySQL 5.6 (default is MySQL 5.5 for trusty dist)._x000D_
_x000D_
Hovewer new problems appeared._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] On PHP 5.4:_x000D_
_x000D_
> Warning: PHP Startup: Unable to load dynamic library_x000D_
> '/home/travis/.phpenv/versions/5.4.45/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-zts-20100525/apc.so' -_x000D_
> /home/travis/.phpenv/versions/5.4.45/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-zts-20100525/apc.so:_x000D_
> cannot open shared object file: _x000D_
> No such file or directory in Unknown on line 0_x000D_
_x000D_
Related: https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6853_x000D_
_x000D_
I'm trying to fix it by installing PECL package, see this [article](http://olvlvl.com/2016-09-travis-apc). Hovewer no results yet, because it tries to install it for PHP 7 version (that's weird because version in the build is 5.4)._x000D_
_x000D_
Fixed._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] On HHVM 2 tests related with PostgreSQL are now failing._x000D_
_x000D_
Specified 3.6 version for testing (the same as on Precise), created separate issues - #12981, #12982._x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] Get rid of oauth token, #12987.

title: fix #12969 pjax not working because of non insync ID
author: dynasource
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  |no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    |no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #12969_x000D_
_x000D_
This commit fixes the pjax `ID not set` issues out of the box. It is not required anymore to supply an unique ID to Pjax widgets anymore because the software is creating a truly unique one by itself. The algorithm to do this is based on the line & class (the trace) where the Pjax widget is called. This is unique for most Pjax::begin calls. When developers call this trough a pjax proxy (like i.e. a ->pjaxify), also the second trace is required, which is covered by this commit. MD5 does the rest._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Disable serialization by default for ArrayCache for increased performance
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
I would expect the ArrayCache to be optimized for speed since it's only used during a single requests, but the serialization is turned on by default which has a major performance impact (see test below)._x000D_
Turning the serialization off might brake backwards compatibilty due to the check in the yii/caching/Cache class: ```if ($dependency !== null && $this->serializer !== false) {```_x000D_
_x000D_
Test results:_x000D_
unserialized: 9.3 ms_x000D_
serialized: 3391.6 ms_x000D_
_x000D_
Test data: two dimensional array (100x100)_x000D_
_x000D_
Test run: 100 x 1 write, 10 reads_x000D_
_x000D_
Test:_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
$data = array_fill(0, 100, array_fill(0, 100, rand(0, 10000)));_x000D_
_x000D_
Yii::$app->arrayCache->serializer = false;_x000D_
Yii::beginProfile('cacheTest-unserialized');_x000D_
for ($i = 1; $i <= 100; $i++) {_x000D_
    Yii::$app->arrayCache->set("cacheTest-unserialized-$i", $data);_x000D_
    for ($j = 1; $j <= 10; $j++) {_x000D_
        Yii::$app->arrayCache->get("cacheTest-unserialized-$i");_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
Yii::endProfile('cacheTest-unserialized');_x000D_
_x000D_
Yii::$app->arrayCache->serializer = null;_x000D_
Yii::beginProfile('cacheTest-serialized');_x000D_
for ($i = 1; $i <= 100; $i++) {_x000D_
    Yii::$app->arrayCache->set("cacheTest-serialized-$i", $data);_x000D_
    for ($j = 1; $j <= 10; $j++) {_x000D_
        Yii::$app->arrayCache->get("cacheTest-serialized-$i");_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
Yii::endProfile('cacheTest-serialized');_x000D_
```

title: Default cache ttl (duration) property (fixes #6809)
author: SDKiller
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #6809 _x000D_
_x000D_
Some PROS in addition to discussion in #6809_x000D_
_x000D_
- from the prorposed https://github.com/php-fig/fig-standards/blob/master/proposed/simplecache.md_x000D_
> If no value is sent and the driver supports TTL then the library may set a default value for it or let the driver take care of that._x000D_
_x000D_
Althow it is not obvious from the draft, that default value cannot be hardcoded, IMO everyone expects it should be configurable._x000D_
_x000D_
- there are examples of configurable defaults among other frameworks, e.g. https://github.com/zendframework/zend-cache/blob/master/src/Storage/Adapter/AdapterOptions.php#L66_x000D_
_x000D_
BC: to keep BC default value is 0, proposed change should not affect implementations, which extend `\yii\caching\Cache`._x000D_
_x000D_
Note about tests: _x000D_
as of now all tests for core cache classes do not suppose setting cache configuration or passing params to `\yiiunit\framework\caching\DbCacheTest::getCacheInstance`

title: Closes #7420: Attributes for prompt generated with `renderSelectOptions` of `\yii\helpers\Html` helper
author: arogachev
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

_x000D_
We have the following options of implementing this:_x000D_
_x000D_
- Initial suggestion from @nkovacs (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/7420#issue-58740067), adding separate additional array element:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
echo $form->field($model, 'foo')->dropDownList(['value1' => 'One', 'value2' => 'Two'], [_x000D_
    'prompt' => 'please choose',_x000D_
    'promptOptions' => [_x000D_
        'class' => 'drop-down-prompt',_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
- Method suggested by @Faryshta (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/7420#issuecomment-75860925), using one array, storing prompt text under `label` key and the other attributes under according keys in the same array:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'prompt' => ['label' => 'Please Choose', 'class' => 'drop-down-prompt', 'value' => '-1'];_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Rendering option without content inside of a tag [will work](http://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_option_label.asp):_x000D_
_x000D_
```html_x000D_
<option label="Please Choose", "class"="drop-down-prompt", "value"="-1"></option>_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
But with this method there are some problems with older browsers, also putting text inside of a tag is more traditional way and it's consistent with other options._x000D_
_x000D_
Using `label` for both `label` attribute and tag content is not good idea too, because the label attribute value is intended to be shorter form of tag content. Example:_x000D_
_x000D_
```html_x000D_
<select>_x000D_
  <option label="Volvo">Volvo (Latin for "I roll")</option>_x000D_
  <option label="Saab">Saab (Swedish Aeroplane AB)</option>_x000D_
  <option label="Mercedes">Mercedes (Mercedes-Benz)</option>_x000D_
  <option label="Audi">Audi (Auto Union Deutschland Ingolstadt)</option>_x000D_
</select>_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
So if user decides to specify custom `label` we can't distinguish between them._x000D_
_x000D_
As a workaround we can use some other special key like `text`, use it as tag content and use the rest of array as tag attributes:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'prompt' => ['label' => 'Choose', 'text' => 'Please Choose', 'class' => 'drop-down-prompt', 'value' => '-1'];_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Rendering result:_x000D_
_x000D_
```html_x000D_
<option label="Choose", "class"="drop-down-prompt", "value"="-1">Please Choose</option>_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
However such mixing is not clear in my opinion._x000D_
_x000D_
- Solution I implemented in this PR. Use `text` for content tag and specify options as subarray._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'prompt' => [_x000D_
    'text' => 'Please select', 'options' => ['class' => 'prompt', 'value' => '-1', 'label' => 'None'],_x000D_
],_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Rendering result:_x000D_
_x000D_
```html_x000D_
<option class="prompt" value="-1" label="None">Please select</option>_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
- Also I was thinking about shorter form without associative array at the top level, something like that:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'prompt' => ['Please select', ['class' => 'prompt', 'value' => '-1', 'label' => 'None']],_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
But this adds strict order and inconsistent with config style in other places.

title: Added Application::setContainerDefinitions() to configure DI in declarative style
author: SilverFire
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | not implemented yet_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #11758_x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] Draft implementation & docs_x000D_
- [x] Tests_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR is an implementation of idea, suggested by @hiqsol in #11758 _x000D_
_x000D_
The proposal is to allow dependency injection configuration be: _x000D_
_x000D_
- declarative_x000D_
- located in the standard place_x000D_
- be consistent with configuring of similar construction (aliases)_x000D_
_x000D_
Example:_x000D_
_x000D_
config.php_x000D_
```php_x000D_
_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'id' => 'my-super-application',_x000D_
    'basePath' => dirname(__DIR__),_x000D_
    'bootstrap' => ['log'],_x000D_
    'containerDefinitions' => [_x000D_
          yii\web\Request::class => app\components\Request::class,_x000D_
          yii\web\Response::class => [_x000D_
              'class' => app\components\Response::class,_x000D_
              'format' => 'json'_x000D_
          ],_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
];_x000D_
```

title: urlName don't contain module name. This is bug, if set prefix and con…
author: mikebelozorov
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
…troller contain module_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
class Module extends \yii\base\Module implements BootstrapInterface_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public static $controllerNamespace = 'frontend\modules\api_0_2\controllers';_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @inheritdoc_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function bootstrap($app)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        Yii::$app->urlManager->addRules([_x000D_
            [_x000D_
                'class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule',_x000D_
                'controller' => [_x000D_
                    'api_0_2/test',_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                'prefix' => 'api/0.2',_x000D_
                'extraPatterns' => [_x000D_
                    'GET test' => 'test',_x000D_
                ]_x000D_
            ]_x000D_
        ]);_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
rest/UrlRule:148_x000D_
        $controllers = [];_x000D_
        foreach ((array) $this->controller as $urlName => $controller) {_x000D_
            if (is_int($urlName)) {_x000D_
                $urlName = $this->pluralize ? Inflector::pluralize($controller) : $controller;_x000D_
            }_x000D_
            $controllers[$urlName] = $controller;_x000D_
        }_x000D_
        $this->controller = $controllers;_x000D_
```_x000D_
As a result, the variable $urlName equals "api_0_2/tests"_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
rest/UrlRule:172_x000D_
            $prefix = trim($this->prefix . '/' . $urlName, '/');_x000D_
```_x000D_
As a result, the variable $prefix equals "api/0.2/api_0_2/tests" - this is bug

title: Rename `yii\base\InvalidParamException` to `yii\base\InvalidArgumentException`
author: arogachev
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13080_x000D_
_x000D_
First of all, I'm not completely sure if `InvalidArgumentException` is the best name, maybe better to use `InvalidArgException` for brevity (previous name was shortened - `InvalidParamException`, not `InvalidParameterException`). But, from the other side, many dependent libraries use `InvalidArgumentException` (including `Doctrine` for example). Just try autocomplete it in IDE._x000D_
_x000D_
Additional fixes:_x000D_
_x000D_
- Reordered changes for 2.1 in CHANGELOG._x000D_
- Refactored long lines (more than 120 chars) related to this change._x000D_
- Removed unused import of `yii\base\InvalidParamException` in one place._x000D_
_x000D_
TODO:_x000D_
_x000D_
- [ ] Add this change to yii2-faker. (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2-faker/blob/master/FixtureController.php#L219) Requires creation of another branch._x000D_
- [ ] Check other extensions for using `yii\base\InvalidParamException`._x000D_
_x000D_
Closes #13080
