title: [POC] Add host validation to `yii\web\Request`
author: rob006
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13050_x000D_
_x000D_
Closes #13050_x000D_
_x000D_
Alternative to #13063 with approach more similar to CSRF validation. It still fails by default if host is invalid, but there are no additional filters -  allowed hosts are set at `Request` level which makes configuration easier and (IMO) more logical. Also validation is performed in `Request::getHostInfo()` so there is no risk that we will have corrupted host in `Request::$hostInfo` - at worst case it will be empty (`false` to be exact)._x000D_
_x000D_
It still is only POC and mostly copy-paste from #13063. If there will be interest of this approach, I will update phpdoc and add more test cases._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Making JS tests ready to go into master
author: cebe
body:
This PR contains the changes from #12936 by @arogachev as well as improved travis-ci configuration for NodeJS. I have squashed the work on JS tests to one commit as they were not applicable on current master (contained a lot of changes and reverts):_x000D_
_x000D_
>   **Implemented Javascript test suite**_x000D_
>    _x000D_
>    fixes #12840_x000D_
>    _x000D_
>    Used @nkovacs draft as starting_x000D_
>    point(https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/11037#issuecomment-193356450)._x000D_
>    I also fixed some bugs in `yii.validation.js` and did some refactoring._x000D_
>    _x000D_
>    Implemented tests:_x000D_
>    _x000D_
>    - yii.validation.js_x000D_
>    _x000D_
>    Running tests:_x000D_
>    _x000D_
>    - Install Node.js. I used the latest version available at the moment -_x000D_
>      `v7.1.0`. Note that used `jsdom` dependent library version requires_x000D_
>    `Node.js >= 4`._x000D_
>    - Run `npm install` to install dependencies._x000D_
>    - Execute `npm test` for running tests._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
I have already merged the adjustements made to the travis-ci setup to master: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/compare/729ddc5b76e8159d051e9c5783f5534eeb212efb...47ece37b5af8c3b21dc551724ba73ba5e66b40db_x000D_
In combination with #13100 by @rob006 the build seems to be quite stable to me._x000D_
_x000D_
The changes have already been reviewed and commented in #12936. lets have a second look at what has changed in `yii.validation.js` and get this ready to be merged._x000D_
_x000D_
Huge thanks to @arogachev already for preparing this and all others participating for the input._x000D_
_x000D_
- JS is now a separate branch in the travis test suite: https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/builds/180400521_x000D_
- here is the build log: https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/jobs/180400530

title: Code Climate PHPMD settings
author: bizley
body:
I have recently started using Code Climate for my project as well and I have noticed that PHPMD settings taken from Yii 2 file are not met. You can verify this by looking at [Code Climate Yii 2 analysis](https://codeclimate.com/github/yiisoft/yii2)._x000D_
_x000D_
Based on the CC and PHPMD docs I've prepared separate PHPMD ruleset that appears to work.  _x000D_
This set contains all rules previously listed in `checks` and in addition it excludes `naming.xml\BooleanGetMethodName` which states_x000D_
_x000D_
> Method which returns a boolean should be named 'is...()' or 'has...()'_x000D_
_x000D_
since it conflicts with Yii 2 component's getters.

title: Make validator getClientOptions public
author: nkovacs
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #11163 _x000D_
_x000D_
This allows implementing custom client-side validation_x000D_
without extending every validator._x000D_
_x000D_
The backwards compatibility break is caused by the change in ImageValidator. `ImageValidator::getClientOptions` was protected since 2.0.0 (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/6dd2203a5c0db168f51369cab206ff07e3c1fd04#diff-504fd084646834cd27fce3dbdce26bbeR350), so if you extended the class and overrode the method with a protected method, the visibility change will cause a fatal error (because you can't make a public method protected in a subclass)._x000D_
_x000D_
Fixes #11163

title: Allowing customize others params request formats in descendant class
author: leandrogehlen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Using visual js libraries like [jQuery Kendo UI](http://www.telerik.com/kendo-ui) or [jQuery EasyUI](http://www.jeasyui.com/) the sort request params are sent in the following format:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
[_x000D_
    ['field' => 'category', 'dir' => 'asc'],_x000D_
    ['field' => 'created_at', 'dir' => 'desc']_x000D_
]_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
thus, is necessary to convert this format to "Yii sort params format". For this, now, is possible to write a_x000D_
descendant class like:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
_x000D_
namespace app\components;_x000D_
_x000D_
use yii\web\Request;_x000D_
use Yii;_x000D_
_x000D_
class Sort extends \yii\data\Sort_x000D_
{_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @inheritdoc_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public $enableMultiSort = true;_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @inheritdoc_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    protected function parseSortAttributes($params)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $attributes = [];_x000D_
        foreach ($params as $item) {_x000D_
             $attributes[] = ($item['dir'] == 'desc') ? $item['field'] . '-' : $item['field'];_x000D_
        }_x000D_
        return $attributes;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
and set this like  default class in `config/web.php`:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
_x000D_
$config = [_x000D_
    'id' => 'yii2-basic-web',_x000D_
    'basePath' => dirname(__DIR__),_x000D_
    'bootstrap' => ['log'],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
         ... _x000D_
     ]_x000D_
];_x000D_
_x000D_
Yii::$container->set('yii\data\Sort', 'app\components\Sort');_x000D_
_x000D_
return $config;_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Allow remove of previous URL when recovered
author: Eseperio
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    |no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    |no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Customized previous URL is persistent, that makes impossible to condition display of previous link. I explain._x000D_
_x000D_
I have a web with products, they are listed in home and in search view. When you click on a product (open product view) in search results i want to show a "back to results" link, but when click on a product in Main page i don´t want to show this link._x000D_
The problem is that as the links is stored in session it is always displayed one time it is defined._x000D_
This modification allows to clear previous url value just when it is recovered. _x000D_
To condition display of backlink in my project i do "if($prev=Url::previous('name')) {//display link}"

title: Fixes PageCacheTest: requestedRoute is not set up

body:

After this PR is merged #12145 passes the tests. :)

title: Add support \yii\db\Expression attribute to \yii\data\Sort
author: lav45
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
If you want to sort the data in an unusual way we usually use the class `\yii\db\Expression` as the wrapper of our expression._x000D_
```php_x000D_
Product::find()_x000D_
    ->orderBy(new Expression("[[price]] ASC NULLS LAST"))_x000D_
   ->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
But this option cannot be used when sorting settings `\yii\data\ActiveDataProvider`_x000D_
_x000D_
I propose to extend the functionality of the class `\yii\data\Sort` to preserve the possibility to sort by an arbitrary expression._x000D_
```php_x000D_
$dataProvider = new ActiveDataProvider([_x000D_
    'query' => Product::find(),_x000D_
]);_x000D_
$dataProvider->sort->attributes['price'] = [_x000D_
    'asc' => [new Expression("[[price]] ASC NULLS LAST")],_x000D_
    'desc' => [new Expression("[[price]] DESC NULLS LAST")],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```

title: Add OR relation for targetAttribute in UniqueValidator
author: developeruz
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #7820_x000D_
_x000D_
1) Bug fix:_x000D_
`['name', 'unique', 'targetClass' => User::className(), 'targetAttribute' => 'realname']`,_x000D_
compares that in DB doesn't exist row with `realname=$model->name`_x000D_
`['name', 'unique', 'targetClass' => User::className(), 'targetAttribute' => [‘realname’]]`,_x000D_
used to compare that in DB doesn’t exist row with `realname=$model->realname` and $model->name doesn’t affect the validation at all. _x000D_
After my fix, if a key is not specified in targetAttributes, validator compares with validated attribute values._x000D_
`['name', 'unique', 'targetClass' => User::className(), 'targetAttribute' => [‘realname’]]`,_x000D_
means `realname=$model->name`_x000D_
`['name', 'unique', 'targetClass' => User::className(), 'targetAttribute' => [‘realname’ => ‘realname’]]`,_x000D_
means `realname=$model->realname`_x000D_
_x000D_
2) New feature: _x000D_
All targetAttribute values were combined with AND condition_x000D_
`['name', 'unique', 'targetClass' => User::className(), 'targetAttribute' => ['realname', 'nick', 'altname']]`_x000D_
checks that in DB exist row where `realname=name AND nick=name AND altname=name`_x000D_
$combineType allows user to change condition type_x000D_
`['name', 'unique', 'targetClass' => User::className(), 'targetAttribute' => ['realname', 'nick', 'altname’], ‘combineType’ => ‘or’]`_x000D_
checks that in DB row exists where `realname=name OR nick=name OR altname=name`

title: Fixed autoloading inside BaseYii scope
author: and800
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Currently the autoloader includes files inside `yii\BaseYii::autoload()` method. That means that the included code shares the scope with that method, including `self` pointing to `BaseYii` and `static` pointing to `Yii`. I've added a workaround which Composer uses: execute `include` statement in separate function.

I know that \yii\caching\ChainedDependency exists, but this way is much more convinient:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
 'dependency' => [_x000D_
        'class' => 'yii\caching\DbDependency',_x000D_
        'sql' => [_x000D_
           'SELECT updated_at from agency where user_id = ' . Yii::$app->user->id,_x000D_
           'SELECT max(updated_at) from offer_has_agency where agency_id = ' . Yii::$app->user->identity->agency->id,_x000D_
           'select count(*) from message where message.status = 1 and message.to = ' . Yii::$app->user->id,_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
```

title: Removes redunant code and allows override query relation in descendan…
author: leandrogehlen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    |  no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Sometimes it's necessary to change default behavior for relation queries._x000D_
_x000D_
Example:_x000D_
_x000D_
I have created a `MultiTenantRecord` where `ActiveRecord::find()` must be overrided, like:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
_x000D_
public static function find()_x000D_
{_x000D_
    $identity = Yii::$app->user->identity;_x000D_
    if ($identity instanceof TenantInterface) {_x000D_
        return parent::find()->where([static::tableName().'.tenant_id' => $identity->getTenantId()]);_x000D_
    } else {_x000D_
        throw new NotSupportedException("Identity does not implements TenantInteface");_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
but this should be occurs only "master" record not for relation._x000D_
Then this allows customize query for relation_x000D_

title: Populating missing languages
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #11502_x000D_
_x000D_
- `MessageController` now properly populates missing languages in case of extraction with "_db_" format and no new messages.  _x000D_
  Previously with no new messages to extract missing languages were ignored._x000D_
- Unit tests for extracting messages with "_db_" format added._x000D_
- Test checking case #11502 added in `BaseMessageControllerTest`._x000D_
- `testMarkObsoleteMessages()` had to be overridden because in case of DB messages source message is wrapped in `@@` and not translation._x000D_
_x000D_
Additionally I've made few slight modifications in `MessageController`:_x000D_
- Excessive `else` has been removed in explicit cases._x000D_
- Failure to create language directory throws exception now in case of "_php_" and "_po_" formats._x000D_
- Db component is verified with `Instance::ensure()` to allow tests configuration._x000D_
- Single-character variable `$m` renamed to keep Code Climate happier._x000D_
- Console output "_Nothing new...skipped_" replaced with "_Nothing to save_" to make it compatible with other message saving methods and `BaseMessageControllerTest`._x000D_
_x000D_
`DbMessageControllerTest` is based on SilverFire's code for `DbMessageSourceTest`.

title: Refactored UrlManagerTest to cover more use cases
author: cebe
body:
UrlManager is a complex class with a large bunch of options that needs_x000D_
to be tested_x000D_
and we had a few regressions in the past even though there are already a_x000D_
lot of tests_x000D_
covering it. Test coverage measured by lines does not help us determine_x000D_
how good it is tested,_x000D_
we need test coverage for every major path through the code._x000D_
_x000D_
I have refactored the UrlManager tests to reflect the different options_x000D_
and cases to_x000D_
have a better overview of which cases are covered and which are not._x000D_
_x000D_
UrlManager has two main operation modes:_x000D_
_x000D_
- "default" url format, which is the simple case. These are covered by_x000D_
  methods in `UrlManagerTest`._x000D_
_x000D_
- "pretty" url format. This is the complex case, which involves UrlRules_x000D_
  and url parsing._x000D_
  I have created two separate classes for this case:_x000D_
  Url creation for "pretty" url format is covered by_x000D_
`UrlManagerCreateUrlTest`._x000D_
  Url parsing for "pretty" url format is covered by_x000D_
`UrlManagerParseUrlTest`._x000D_
_x000D_
Each of the test classes have a `getUrlManager` method that creates a_x000D_
UrlManager instance_x000D_
with a specific configuration and certain variations in options._x000D_
It is also tested that options that are not relevant in a certain_x000D_
operation mode have no effect on the result._x000D_
_x000D_
To make sure to not remove tests that have existed before, here is a map_x000D_
of where code has been moved._x000D_
The following test methods existed in the [old test_x000D_
class](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/4187718c148610b02fc973a19be53600e6230604/tests/framework/web/UrlManagerTest.php):_x000D_
_x000D_
- `testCreateUrl()` split between UrlManagerTest and_x000D_
  UrlManagerCreateUrlTest variations should all be covered by_x000D_
`variationsProvider()`._x000D_
- `testCreateUrlWithNullParams()` covered by UrlManagerCreateUrlTest by_x000D_
  `testWithNullParams()`_x000D_
- `testCreateUrlWithEmptyPattern()`_x000D_
- `testCreateAbsoluteUrl()` covered in UrlManagerCreateUrlTest by new_x000D_
  tests via `variationsProvider()`._x000D_
- `testCreateAbsoluteUrlWithSuffix()` covered in UrlManagerCreateUrlTest_x000D_
  by `testAbsolutePatterns`._x000D_
_x000D_
- `testParseRequest()` covered by UrlManagerParseUrlTest, UrlNormalizer_x000D_
  related parts moved to UrlNormalizerTest._x000D_
- `testParseRESTRequest()` moved to UrlManagerParseUrlTest_x000D_
- `testHash()` covered in different tests in UrlManagerCreateUrlTest._x000D_
- `testMultipleHostsRules($host)` kept as is._x000D_
_x000D_
Before:_x000D_
_x000D_
    $ vendor/bin/phpunit tests/framework/web/UrlManagerTest.php_x000D_
    ..._x000D_
    OK (12 tests, 89 assertions)_x000D_
_x000D_
After:_x000D_
_x000D_
    $ vendor/bin/phpunit tests/framework/web/UrlManager*.php_x000D_
    ..._x000D_
    OK (72 tests, 648 assertions)_x000D_

Rename method, because 

``` php
echo \Yii::$app->urlManager->createUrl('site/page', ['id' => 'about']);
```

It is generate absolute url too (`/index.php/site/page/id/about/`).

title: Add support of `srcset` to `yii\helpers\Html::img()`
author: Kolyunya
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #10834 _x000D_
_x000D_
Not sure if we should distinguish between `src` and `srcset` passed as the first argument using `yii\helpers\ArrayHelper::isAssociative()` or just pass `srcset` in `options` while passing `null` to `$src`._x000D_
_x000D_
If we choose the former it will hit the performance of each and every call to `Html::img()` in all existing and future applications. We also won't be able to support non-assiciative `srcsets` like following. Missing descriptor defaults to `1x` according to the [docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img). Not sure if we should support this though._x000D_
```php_x000D_
$srcset = [_x000D_
    'base-url',_x000D_
    '2x' => 'other-url',_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
If we choose the latter the method invocation will look somewhat _weird_ but I think we can live with it:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?= Html::img(null, ['srcset' => [_x000D_
    '1x' => 'foo',_x000D_
    '2x' => 'bar',_x000D_
]]); ?>_x000D_
```

title: `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable` should work consistent over all databases
author: boboldehampsink
body:
Cubrid, MSSQL, MySQL, and OCI already restart the identity by default, PGSQL doesn't. This PR makes the use of the `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable` method more consistent._x000D_
_x000D_
_Note: RESTART IDENTITY is available from PGSQL 8.4+__x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13577_x000D_

title: `yii\test\ActiveFixture::resetTable()` should use `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable()` instead of manual delete/reset
author: boboldehampsink
body:
Because `yii\db\QueryBuilder::resetSequence()` is not implemented for all drivers, using `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable()` will yield better results over all drivers. For example, it enables the use of ActiveFixture for MSSQL, where it couldn't be used before._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13577_x000D_

title: Fixtures named dependencies.
author: ArgosOleg
body:
**Example**_x000D_
In fixture class:_x000D_
```_x000D_
class FirstFixture extends ActiveFixture_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $depends  = [_x000D_
        // the old set dependent fixtures, and it remains if you _x000D_
        SecondFixture::class,_x000D_
_x000D_
        // new set_x000D_
        'second_fixture_alias' => SecondFixture::class_x000D_
    ];_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
In test class:_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
class SomeCest_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public function _before(UnitTester $I)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $I->haveFixtures([_x000D_
            'first_fixture_alias' => FirstFixture::class,_x000D_
        ]);_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    public function checkFixtures(UnitTester $I)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        // the old grab dependent fixtures behavior, and it remains if you _x000D_
        $data = $I->grabFixture(SecondFixture::class);_x000D_
_x000D_
        // new behavior_x000D_
        $data = $I->grabFixture('second_fixture_alias');_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | don't check_x000D_

title: 13598 access filter rule support
author: mrbig
body:
_x000D_
Proposed solution to Issue #13598 _x000D_
_x000D_
I've added the rulesParamCallabck, wich is checked and called before the $user->can is called. Any parameters returned are passed the the $user->can() call._x000D_
_x000D_
I think it would be very useful to know about the current action in the callback, because mostly you would look from incoming parameters that are dependent on the action. But because of this I had to change the signature of the 'matchRole' method. I admit this is not 100% safe when there are dependent implementations, so I can accept if you rather ignore the 'action' parameter to ensure backward compatibility._x000D_
_x000D_
Unit tests were added to demonstrate the usage of the new feature. The tests mimic the example from the [definitive guide](http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/guide-security-authorization.html#using-rules)_x000D_
_x000D_
Please let me know your toughts on this change._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: Add ensureBehaviors() to detachBehavior*()
author: mdeweerd
body:
Need to add ensureBehaviors() to detachBehavior*().

The intent may be to detach behaviors defined in behaviors().
In the original implementation, if these behaviors() are not yet attached, they can not selectively be detached.

title: Added support for hint index for mysql DB driver
author: fdezmc
body:
Allowing support for hint index in MySQL with ActiveQuery and ActiveRecord (#10869)._x000D_
_x000D_
Currently hint index with Expression for ActiveQuery with joins fails: _x000D_
(_yiiunit\framework\db\mysql\ActiveQueryTest::testFromIndexHint is incorrect_)_x000D_
```_x000D_
$query = (new Query)_x000D_
    ->from([new Expression('{{user}} {{t}} FORCE INDEX (primary) IGNORE INDEX FOR ORDER BY (i1)')])_x000D_
    ->leftJoin(['p' => 'profile'], 'user.id = profile.user_id USE INDEX (i2)');_x000D_
_x000D_
--- Expected_x000D_
+++ Actual_x000D_
@@ @@_x000D_
-'SELECT * FROM {{user}} {{t}} FORCE INDEX (primary) IGNORE INDEX FOR ORDER BY (i1) LEFT JOIN `profile` `p` USE INDEX (i2) ON user.id = profile.user_id'_x000D_
+'SELECT * FROM {{user}} {{t}} FORCE INDEX (primary) IGNORE INDEX FOR ORDER BY (i1) LEFT JOIN `profile` `p` ON user.id = profile.user_id USE INDEX (i2)'_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
and hint index with ActiveRecord is not currently supported._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
***This pull request allow all functionality for hint index on mysql DB driver***_x000D_
_x000D_
ActiveQuery with no joins:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$query = (new Query)_x000D_
	->from(['o' => order])->hintIndex(['order', 'forceIndex', 'primary']);_x000D_
_x000D_
+++ Actual_x000D_
@@ @@_x000D_
'SELECT `order`.* FROM `order` FORCE INDEX (primary)'_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
ActiveQuery with joins:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$query = (new Query)_x000D_
    ->from('order')->hintIndex([['order', 'forceIndex', 'primary'], ['order', 'ignoreIndex', 'FK_order_customer_id', 'orderBy']])_x000D_
    ->leftJoin('customer', 'order.customer_id = customer.id')->hintIndex(['customer', 'useIndex', 'primary']);_x000D_
_x000D_
+++ Actual_x000D_
@@ @@_x000D_
'SELECT * FROM `order` FORCE INDEX (`primary`) IGNORE INDEX FOR ORDER BY (`FK_order_customer_id`) LEFT JOIN `customer` USE INDEX (`primary`) ON order.customer_id = customer.id_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
ActiveRecord with no joins:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = ['order', 'useIndex', ['primary', 'FK_order_customer_id']];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->hintIndex($hintIndex)->where(['id' => 1, 'customer_id' => 1]);_x000D_
+++ Actual_x000D_
@@ @@_x000D_
'SELECT * FROM `order` USE INDEX (`primary`, `FK_order_customer_id`) WHERE (`id`=1) AND (`customer_id`=1)'_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
ActiveRecord with joins:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = ['order', 'forceIndex', 'primary'];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->hintIndex($hintIndex)_x000D_
	->leftJoin('customer', 'order.customer_id = customer.id')->hintIndex(['customer', 'forceIndex', 'primary']);_x000D_
+++ Actual_x000D_
@@ @@_x000D_
'SELECT `order`.* FROM `order` FORCE INDEX (`primary`) LEFT JOIN `customer` FORCE INDEX (`primary`) ON order.customer_id = customer.id'_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Hinted columns as string:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = ['order', 'ignoreIndex', 'FK_order_customer_id'];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->hintIndex($hintIndex)->where(['id' => 1, 'customer_id' => 1]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Multiple hints at once_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = [['order', 'forceIndex', ['primary']], ['order', 'ignoreIndex', 'FK_order_customer_id', 'orderBy']];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->hintIndex($hintIndex)->orderBy('customer_id');_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
With alias_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = ['order', 'ignoreIndex', 'customer_id'];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->from(['o' => 'order'])->hintIndex($hintIndex)->where(['id' => 1, 'customer_id' => 1]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
With joinWith, primary and alias_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = ['order', 'forceIndex', 'primary'];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->hintIndex($hintIndex)->joinWith('items');_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
With relation by puntuation and hint on join table_x000D_
```_x000D_
$hintIndex = ['item', 'forceIndex', 'primary', 'orderBy'];_x000D_
$query = Order::find()->joinWith('orderItems.item')->hintIndex($hintIndex)->orderBy('item.id');_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
All logic is in the specific DB driver class:_x000D_
- _/yii2/framework/db/mysql/QueryBuilder.php__x000D_
- _/yii2/framework/db/sqlite/QueryBuilder.php_ (*)_x000D_
- _/yii2/framework/db/cubrid/QueryBuilder.php_ (*)_x000D_
- _/yii2/framework/db/mssql/QueryBuilder.php_ (*)_x000D_
- _/yii2/framework/db/oci/QueryBuilder.php_ (*)_x000D_
- _/yii2/framework/db/pgsql/QueryBuilder.php_ (*)_x000D_
_x000D_
_(*) This DB drivers support for hint index is not implemente in this pull-request yet. Query::hintIndex property will be ignore__x000D_
_x000D_
I have no experience enought with other DB drivers than mysql, so just write functionality for mysql._x000D_
Support for the left DB drivers can be done following this approach._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

 _x000D_
I think solution suggested by @bsyomov in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/13243#issuecomment-268099889 is probably better because it does not allow characters like comma, etc. in attribute name. From the other side, who knows, maybe such special characters can take place in some API's related attributes. Creating black list for them can be a hassle. Anyway I changed regex to be the same as in GridView for consistency._x000D_

Ideally, if regex is the same for GridView and DetailView it's better to store it in some common constant. However GridView and DetailView are not directly related with each other, so I left them separate for now._x000D_
_x000D_
GridView is pretty poorly tested. Ideally this needs to be tested there too.

title: Add `mergeType`, `beforeKeys` and `afterKeys` to `registerJs()` method to solve issues dealing with order of inline JS includes.
author: derekisbusy
body:
Add method `jsLines()` and replace implode statements with `jsLines()` method._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | needs testing_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | Helps fix issues related to the order in which JS scripts get included. _x000D_
_x000D_
**`mergeType`** parameter to define how existing inline JS with the same keys should be merged together._x000D_
_x000D_
 For example the Pjax widget would require inner pjax containers to be appended so that the events get binded in the correct order. In this case you would use `View::MERGE_PREPEND` since the `registerJs()` method is in the `run()` method the inner widgets are called first and thus the order is reversed. An alternative would be to use `registerJs()` in the `begin()` method but this would break if nesting widgets between the layout and action views since the layout is rendered after the action's view.  Thus the only way to correctly order the widgets inline scripts when nested in both the layout and action is to use `View::MERGE_PREPEND` in the `run()` method of the widget. _x000D_
_x000D_
**`afterKeys`** which enables JS code to be deferred and included after another widgets code if needed. For example with the Pjax widget you want to make sure the ActiveForm events are attached first to prevent the Pjax request from happening before Ajax validation._x000D_
_x000D_
**`beforeKeys`** that works the same as `afterKeys` except the JS code get's included before._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
**Example usage:**_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$view->registerJs($js, View::POS_READY, 'pjax', View::MERGE_PREPEND,null,'activeform');_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Or could use separate methods to make code cleaner:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$view->registerJs($js, View::POS_READY, 'pjax', View::MERGE_PREPEND)_x000D_
      ->addAfter('activeform');_x000D_
_x000D_
$view->registerJs($js, View::POS_READY, 'some-widget', View::MERGE_PREPEND)_x000D_
     ->addBefore(['activeform','other-widget', '..']);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Added support for callables and closures to the `js` paramter of `registerJs()` method so that widgets can handle their own lines._x000D_
_x000D_
 ```php_x000D_
_x000D_
class MyWidget extends \yii\base\Widget_x000D_
{_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @inheritdoc_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function run()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
         // ... _x000D_
         $this->registerClientScript();_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * Registers the needed JavaScript._x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function registerClientScript()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
            self::$js .= ".fadeIn().fadeOut()";_x000D_
            $view = $this->getView();_x000D_
            // merge skip makes sure the callback is added once_x000D_
            $view->registerJs([self::className()], View::POS_READY, 'my-custom-widget', View::MERGE_SKIP);_x000D_
    }_x000D_
  public static $js = "";_x000D_
    _x000D_
    public static function initJs($view)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        // can use the callback to customize the output _x000D_
        return "jQuery(document)".implode("\n", self::$js).";\n";_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_

_x000D_
When I have generate `dropDownList` or `radioButtonList` from DB at time return same key and value like_x000D_

```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    2 => 2,_x000D_
    3 => 3_x000D_
]_x000D_
``` _x000D_

because `column` method is return first column in `select` statement. when i change position in select statement like set `label` field first at time return my expected results like._x000D_
_x000D_

```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    2 => 'My label/title-1',_x000D_
    3 => 'My label/title-2'_x000D_
]_x000D_
``` _x000D_

title: Take advantage of hash_hkdf() on PHP >= 7.1.2
author: charlesportwoodii
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_

| Fixed issues  | n/a_x000D_
_x000D_
PHP 7.1.2 implements a native `hash_hkdf()` implementation, which is faster than a pure PHP implementation. (see php/php-src#1105). This PR improves Yii2 to take advantage of that native function if it is available.

title: setStatusCode method of Response should return $this
author: kyle-mccarthy
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
The `setStatusCode` method of `yii\web\Response` should return the Response instance.  This will allow for returning a response in a controller without having issues related to returning void._x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
/**_x000D_
 * @return \yii\web\Response _x000D_
 */_x000D_
public function actionExample()_x000D_
{_x000D_
    $model = new Example();_x000D_
    if ($model->load(Yii::$app->request->post() && $model->save()) {_x000D_
        return $this->asJson(['message' => 'Example saved']);_x000D_
    }_x000D_
    return $this->asJson(['message' => 'Could not save example', 'errors' => $model->getErrors()])->setResponseCode(400);_x000D_
}_x000D_
```

title: Extract profiling methods from BaseYii to standalone Profiler class
author: cronfy
body:
I extracted `BaseYii::beginProfile()` and `BaseYii::endProfile()` to standalone `yii\base\Profiler` class as was described at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/9458#issuecomment-282320423_x000D_
_x000D_
Now profiler is a core component and can be configured (replaced) via `components` application configuration:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'components' => [_x000D_
    'profiler' => [_x000D_
        'class' => `\my\own\Profiler`,_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    ..._x000D_
]_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Improve SQL LIKE condition handling and testing (fixes #13745)
author: sergeymakinen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13745 _x000D_
_x000D_
This PR adds real db tests of QueryBuilder’s `LIKE` handling and fixes all bugs I found for now:_x000D_
_x000D_
- Cubrid doesn’t like `\`, it’s okay with `!`_x000D_
- Oracle doesn’t have a quote char by default at all, moreover later pro_oci versions (in PHP 7.x) handle quoting so they won’t quote `\` while in PHP 5.x Yii will do it by itself (which leads to another bug, that inserts `\\` instead of `\` but it’s another issue…)_x000D_
- sqlsrv driver doesn’t like preparing (it keeps telling about placeholders/params count mismatch) when using `ESCAPE`_x000D_

Introduce `yii\mail\Template` class, allowing view rendering in isolation._x000D_
This allows access to `yii\mail\MessageInterface` via `$this->context->message` inside the view all the time,_x000D_
including layouts, and use `message` key for rendering params without any conflicts.

title: Fix error during handling of closure errors
author: mikehaertl
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | -_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/13689_x000D_
_x000D_
If an error occurs inside a closure method, the error handler will fail. For example:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
        $x = array_map(function ($r) {_x000D_
            return $r->doesnotexist;_x000D_
        }, [1, 2, 3]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Will lead to:_x000D_
_x000D_
> An Error occurred while handling another error:_x000D_
ReflectionException: Method app\controllers\ClientController::app\controllers\{closure}() does not exist in /var/www/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/ErrorHandler.php:199_x000D_
_x000D_
The fix is easy, but I was not sure how to properly test this.

title: Add new HTTP status code 451
author: yyxx9988
body:
> Unavailable For Legal Reasons (RFC 7725)_x000D_
> A server operator has received a legal demand to deny access to a resource or to a set of resources that includes the requested resource. The code 451 was chosen as a reference to the novel Fahrenheit 451._x000D_
_x000D_
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes#4xx_Client_errors for more info.

title: Add `yii\web\Request::getOrigin()` method that returns HTTP_ORIGIN of current CORS request
author: yyxx9988
body:
>The Origin request header indicates where a fetch originates from. It doesn't include any path information, but only the server name. It is sent with CORS requests, as well as with POST requests. It is similar to the Referer header, but, unlike this header, it doesn't disclose the whole path._x000D_ _x000D_ From https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Origin_x000D_ _x000D_ ### Working code samples_x000D_ ```php_x000D_ ";_x000D_ echo "";_x000D_ echo " Another Resource";_x000D_ echo "";_x000D_ echo "",_x000D_ "

This resource behaves two-fold:";_x000D_ echo "

    ",_x000D_ "
  • If accessed from http://arunranga.com it returns an XML document
    • ";_x000D_ echo "
  • If accessed from any other origin including from simply typing in the URL into the browser's address bar,";_x000D_ echo "you get this HTML document
    • ", _x000D_ "
",_x000D_ "",_x000D_ "";_x000D_ }_x000D_ ?>_x000D_ ```_x000D_ See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Server-Side_Access_Control for more info._x000D_

The @property-read tag allows a class to know which ‘magic’ properties are present that are read-only._x000D_
https://phpdoc.org/docs/latest/references/phpdoc/tags/property-read.html_x000D_
_x000D_
The @property-write tag allows a class to know which ‘magic’ properties are present that are write-only._x000D_
https://phpdoc.org/docs/latest/references/phpdoc/tags/property-write.html

title: Fix input ID uniqueness
author: uaoleg
body:
In case when on one page there are several forms for the same `ActiveRecord` model, than auto-generated by `ActiveForm` inputs have identical HTML attribute `id`, that obviously causes lots of problems._x000D_
_x000D_
I propose:_x000D_
1. Add simple counter to guarantee uniqueness even for inputs of same attribute of same model_x000D_
2. Add "salt" for a case of ajax requests, when counter will turn back to "0"_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | possibly, if developers used auto generated IDs in there JS quires_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fix number attributes comparison
author: uaoleg
body:
Assume we have 2 attributes: `min` and `max`. Also we have a rule that `max` is equal or greater than `min` and they both are optional._x000D_
Than in case `min` is empty and `max` is set we got a validation error. The reason is that `parseFloat()` function converts empty string of `min` to `NaN`._x000D_

title: Add basic support for content-security-profile header
author: bicf
body:
Referred to issue #13962  (missing csp in Yii2)_x000D_
For the specs see https://www.w3.org/TR/CSP2/ for more infos._x000D_
_x000D_
The config file for the basic-template:_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'csp' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'yii\web\ContentSecurityPolicy',_x000D_
            'addNonceScript' => false,_x000D_
            'addNonceStyle' => false,_x000D_
            'addKeys' => false,_x000D_
            'csp' => [_x000D_
                \yii\web\ContentSecurityPolicy::DIRECTIVE_DEFAULT_SRC => "'self'",_x000D_
                \yii\web\ContentSecurityPolicy::DIRECTIVE_IMG_SRC => "'self' data:",_x000D_
                \yii\web\ContentSecurityPolicy::DIRECTIVE_SCRIPT_SRC => "'self' 'unsafe-inline'",_x000D_
                \yii\web\ContentSecurityPolicy::DIRECTIVE_STYLE_SRC => "'self' 'unsafe-inline'",_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
            'selectedHashAlgorithms'=>[_x000D_
                \yii\web\ContentSecurityPolicy::HASH_SHA_256,_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
```

title: Update checkbox/radio for configurable enclosed option.
author: kartik-v
body: The BaseHtml checkbox and radio implementation hard-codes a container to envelop the input when label is passed. For example: `<div class="checkbox">` or `<div class="radio">`. This should be configurable. The current Pull Request allows the container enclosure to be optional by including an `hasContainer` option.This is set to true by default so current implementation is not affected. But it also allows this to be set to false for some scenarios. For example, the false option is very useful for generating inline checkbox lists or inline radio lists, where the enclosure is not required.

title: fix file upload bug if used with dynamic forms and elements are zero
author: RobinKamps
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
If used with dynamic forms and fileInput it comes to typeError if there are no file-inputs (min elements = 0). Due to this error the whole form will not be validated at the client side._x000D_
I tested other input validations (url, string etc) on a similar setting (dynamic forms with zero elements) and all worked fine, only the file-input-validation did not work._x000D_
This little addition fixes the issue._x000D_
_x000D_
The error was:_x000D_
[Error] TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating '$(attribute.input, attribute.$form).get(0).files')_x000D_
	getUploadedFiles (yii.validation.js:371)_x000D_
	file (yii.validation.js:75)_x000D_
	validate (create:1090:2956)_x000D_
	(anonyme Funktion) (yii.activeForm.js:338)_x000D_
	each (jquery.js:365)_x000D_
	validate (yii.activeForm.js:323)_x000D_
	submitForm (yii.activeForm.js:427)_x000D_
	dispatch (jquery.js:4737)_x000D_
	handle (jquery.js:4549)

title: Can create fixtures throw anonymous function and Fixture
author: bscheshirwork
body:
#13974_x000D_
_x000D_
Can create from the anonymous function (key `token`) and from the anonymous class (php7, key `user`)_x000D_
_x000D_
Anonymous class must use alias `@codecept_data_dir` in `dataFile`._x000D_
_x000D_
`depends` use name of fixture `user`_x000D_
_x000D_
Can create multiply fixture by same class._x000D_
_x000D_
[source createFixtures](https://github.com/bscheshirwork/yii2/blob/27b294606455bf73ed808ec11ae8e9096525f6df/framework/test/FixtureTrait.php#L164-L253)_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
//inside Cest_x000D_
    public function _fixtures(){_x000D_
        Yii::setAlias('codecept_data_dir', codecept_data_dir());_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            'user' => new class extends \yii\test\ActiveFixture {_x000D_
                public $modelClass = 'dektrium\user\models\User';_x000D_
                public $dataFile = '@codecept_data_dir/user.php';_x000D_
            },_x000D_
            'token' => function(){_x000D_
                return Yii::createObject([_x000D_
                    'class' => \yii\test\ActiveFixture::className(),_x000D_
                    'modelClass' => 'dektrium\user\models\Token',_x000D_
                    'depends' => ['user'],_x000D_
                    'dataFile' => codecept_data_dir() . 'token.php',_x000D_
                ]);_x000D_
            },_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
This definition can be used instead of this classes with 1 line:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function _fixtures(){_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            'user' => [_x000D_
                'class' => UserFixture::className(),_x000D_
                'dataFile' => codecept_data_dir() . 'user.php'_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
            'token' => [_x000D_
                'class' => TokenFixture::className(),_x000D_
                'dataFile' => codecept_data_dir() . 'token.php'_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
_x000D_
namespace frontend\fixtures;_x000D_
_x000D_
use yii\test\ActiveFixture;_x000D_
_x000D_
class ProfileFixture extends ActiveFixture_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $modelClass = 'dektrium\user\models\Profile';_x000D_
_x000D_
    public $depends = [_x000D_
        'common\fixtures\UserFixture'_x000D_
    ];_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
_x000D_
namespace frontend\fixtures;_x000D_
_x000D_
use yii\test\ActiveFixture;_x000D_
_x000D_
class TokenFixture extends ActiveFixture_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $modelClass = 'dektrium\user\models\Token';_x000D_
_x000D_
    public $depends = [_x000D_
        'common\fixtures\UserFixture'_x000D_
    ];_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no (can create multiple fixture with same class. Depends `class` called first of it)_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes/no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13974_x000D_

title: Fix `yii\filters\AccessRule::matchIP()`
author: Kolyunya
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
[Here](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/filters/AccessRule.php#L112) `matchIP()` may be passed a `null` which will be passed to `strncmp()` [here](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/filters/AccessRule.php#L177)._x000D_
`strncmp()` expects to be receive a `string`, not `null` and it [seems to be triggering a warning](https://3v4l.org/sFe7o) on an `HHVM`..

title: Added assignments cache to check access on request
author: leandrogehlen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    |  no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_

_x000D_
On request the method checkAccess load assingments from database every invocation._x000D_
Example: _x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$access = [_x000D_
  'person',_x000D_
  'category',_x000D_
  'product'_x000D_
];_x000D_
_x000D_
foreach ($access as $permission)  {_x000D_
  if (Yii:$app->user->can($permission)) { // this will be executed the same SQL 3 times_x000D_
   ..._x000D_
  }_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Allow AccessControl filter to work without User component
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | a bit_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #4793_x000D_
_x000D_
This allows `AccessControl` filter to work without `user` component since only matching role mechanism depends on it._x000D_
_x000D_
- `yii\filters\AccessControl::user` can be set to `false` to explicitly switch this component support off for the filter,_x000D_
- `yii\filters\AccessControl::denyAccess()` throws `yii\web\ForbiddenHttpException` if the user is already logged in **or in case of detached User component**,_x000D_
- `yii\filters\AccessRule::matchRole()` throws `yii\base\InvalidConfigException` if User component is detached and `yii\filters\AccessRule::roles` are not empty._x000D_
_x000D_
With default configuration behavior is the same as before._x000D_
_x000D_
Also `yiiunit\framework\filters\AccessRuleTest` methods don't require mocking User component anymore.

title: Allow to use custom AR constructors
author: ElisDN
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | potentially_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #5786, #8639, #13779, #5771_x000D_
_x000D_
The PR replaces all `new $modelClass` internal calls to `$modelClass::instantiate()`. It allows to use custom constructors in ActiveRecord-based classes:_x000D_
_x000D_
~~~php_x000D_
class User extends ActiveRecord_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public static function instantiate($row = [])_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $record = (new \ReflectionClass(static::className()))->newInstanceWithoutConstructor();_x000D_
        $record->init();_x000D_
        return $record;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
    _x000D_
    public function __construct($name, $email)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $this->name = $name;_x000D_
        $this->email = $email;_x000D_
        $this->created_at = time();_x000D_
        parent::__construct();_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
~~~_x000D_
_x000D_
without internal issues with all types of relations._x000D_
_x000D_
Backwards compatibility_x000D_
------_x000D_
_x000D_
The `$row` argument can be an empty array in new cases. It may break existing code. For example, for [STI](https://github.com/samdark/yii2-cookbook/blob/master/book/ar-single-table-inheritance.md) you must add `empty($row)` checking before `switch` sentence:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public static function instantiate($row = [])_x000D_
{_x000D_
    if (empty($row)) {_x000D_
        return new self();_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    switch ($row['type']) {_x000D_
        ..._x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
or use safe `ArrayHelper::getValue($row, 'type')` instead of unsafe `$row['data']` calling.

title: add method registerCsrfMetaTags
author: RobinKamps
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | comma-separated list of tickets # fixed by the PR, if any_x000D_
_x000D_
Short version:_x000D_
There is no convenient way to register csrf tags dynamically (with cache enabled)._x000D_
`$view->registerCsrfMetaTags();` will register csrf meta tags._x000D_
`$view->registerCsrfMetaTags(true);` will register csrf meta tags rendered dynamically._x000D_
_x000D_
Long version:_x000D_
_x000D_
To enable csrf in layout/view `echo Html::csrfMetaTags();` could be used._x000D_
However `$this->renderDynamic('echo yii\helpers\Html::csrfMetaTags();');` does not work properly if used in head section of layout._x000D_
It is placed before all page content - this could be a bug or wanted behavior? Anyway its causing some widgets to crash (like kartik switch input for example)._x000D_
_x000D_
`$this->renderDynamic('return Yii::$app->view->registerMetaTag([\'name\' => \'csrf-token\', \'content\' => Yii::$app->request->csrfToken]);');` does not work obviously, too._x000D_
_x000D_
Using something like `registerMetaTag(['name' => 'csrf-token', 'content' => $this->renderDynamic('return Yii::$app->request->csrfToken;')]);` _x000D_
does not work, because renderTagAttributes are html encoded (thus < and > in BLOB are converted to `<![CDATA[YII-DYNAMIC-0]]>`  (should be <![CDATA[YII-DYNAMIC-0]]>))_x000D_
_x000D_
Of course one can always add _x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
echo '<meta name="csrf-param" content="' . $this->renderDynamic('return Yii::$app->request->csrfParam;') . '">';_x000D_
echo '<meta name="csrf-token" content="' . $this->renderDynamic('return Yii::$app->request->csrfToken;') . '">';_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
to the head section of layout._x000D_
_x000D_
However a better way instead of putting this direct to layouts would be to use `registerMetaTags` in controller, so that the existence can be action specific. But dynamicRender fails on `registerMetaTag(['name' => 'csrf-token', 'content' => $this->renderDynamic('return Yii::$app->request->csrfToken;')]);` as mentioned above due to encoding._x000D_
_x000D_
With this little enhancement `$view->registerCsrfMetaTags();` could be used from controller or layout and if called with param `$view->registerCsrfMetaTags(true);` it will be automatic handled by dynamicRender._x000D_

body:

Provide difference assigned values by attributes is user friendly._x000D_
Array of behaviors:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
            [_x000D_
                'class' => AttributeBehavior::className(),_x000D_
                'attributes' => [_x000D_
                    ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_INSERT => ['number', 'name'],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                'values' => [_x000D_
                    'number' => [$this, 'getNextNumber'],_x000D_
                    'name' => [$this, 'getNewName']_x000D_
                ]_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
```_x000D_
instead of _x000D_
```php_x000D_

title: Implement retrieving DBMS constraints
author: sergeymakinen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes (thanks to [this](https://github.com/sergeymakinen/docker-yii2-php) and [this](https://github.com/sergeymakinen/docker-test-db))_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | partially #8163, also see #8152, #9003, #13647_x000D_
_x000D_
This small PR adds:_x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] DBMS constraints retrieving methods._x000D_
- [x] DBMS constraints low-level manipulation methods._x000D_
- [x] DMBS constraints `QueryBuilder` tests._x000D_
- [x] DMBS constraints `Command` tests._x000D_
_x000D_
Please note: _x000D_
_x000D_
- This PR is **not** a complete solution for a constraints management. It's a first part that adds all that low-level stuff. I will implement other parts during a 2.0.13 development timeframe._x000D_
- Some existing code is outdated or not needed anymore (or both O:). But it requires a discussion and deserves a separate issue._x000D_
- The SQL tokenizer is aimed mostly at db developers (= (99% of time) no one beside Yii db core developers/contributors). It's not an all-purpose solution. It helps to get a required information from the SQL code without getting trapped by regex limitations._x000D_
- MySQL's constraint code works with 5.1+. If this is still an issue (tests only pass on 5.0+), I will make it BC with 4.x+/5.0+ (with a help of `SqlTokenizer`)._x000D_
- `Schema` caching was updated, now it's trivial to add any new information along with the existing without having to think about caching. Tests were intentionally left untouched to catch regressions (if any).

title: Update db-migrations.md
author: kradwhite
body:
By default, the class BaseMigrateController property migrationPath is assigned the value '@app/migrations'. In the method getNewMigrations() is the conversion migrationNamescpaces in the path to the file and merges it all into a single array along with the path migrationPath. If the project for migration module is a separate table in the database, all migration came from migrationPath are not initialized and therefore try to migrate. Therefore, it is necessary to specify the property 'migrationPath' => null._x000D_

we need use _x000D_
invert ([attribute => event]) syntax:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
[_x000D_
    'class' => AttributesBehavior::className(),_x000D_
    'attributes' => [_x000D_
        'attribute1' => [_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_INSERT => new Expression('NOW()'),_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_UPDATE => \Yii::$app->formatter->asDatetime('0000-00-00'),_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'attribute2' => [_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_VALIDATE => [$this, 'storeAttributes'],_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_AFTER_VALIDATE => [$this, 'restoreAttributes'],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'attribute3' => [_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_VALIDATE => $fn2 = [$this, 'getAttribute2'],_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_AFTER_VALIDATE => $fn2,_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'attribute4' => [_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_DELETE => function($event) {static::disabled() || $event->isValid = false;},_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
],_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Apply child table alias/name for joinWith case to condition columns
author: bscheshirwork
body:
One step to resolve the problem with ambigous column name and apply alias._x000D_
_x000D_
As part of #7263:_x000D_
_x000D_
For case `joinWith` functional: only one child table inside `joinWithRelation` for each time_x000D_
i.e. not allowed _x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT * FROM_x000D_
a JOIN b,c _x000D_
WHERE a.id = b.a_id and b.id = c.b_id_x000D_
```_x000D_
i.e. ActiveQuery for the child table is have single `from` and can be use single prefix._x000D_
_x000D_
Note:_x000D_
for #14161_x000D_
This method can be private or _x000D_
`framework/validators/ExistValidator.php`_x000D_
`framework/validators/UniqueValidator.php`_x000D_
can use this method too_x000D_
_x000D_
Example: after path_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class Duration extends \yii\db\ActiveRecord {_x000D_
..._x000D_
    public function getUnit()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return $this->hasOne(DurationUnit::className(), ['id' => 'unitId'])->inverseOf('durations');_x000D_
    }_x000D_
..._x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
```php_x000D_
        echo Duration::find()_x000D_
            ->joinWith([_x000D_
                'unit as unitAlias' => function (DurationUnitQuery $query) {_x000D_
                    $query->andWhere(['id' => [5, 3, 2, 1]]);_x000D_
                }_x000D_
            ])_x000D_
            ->andWhere(['id' => [4, 5, 9]])_x000D_
            ->alias('durationAlias')_x000D_
            ->createCommand()->getRawSql();_x000D_
```_x000D_
produce_x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))_x000D_
```_x000D_
current _x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
and "as target" result must be_x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`durationAlias`.`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))_x000D_
```_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes/no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes/no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #7263, #14166, #14161, #14150_x000D_

_x000D_
As part of #7263:_x000D_
_x000D_
For case `joinWith` functional: only one child table inside `joinWithRelation` for each time_x000D_
i.e. not allowed _x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT * FROM_x000D_
a JOIN b,c _x000D_
WHERE a.id = b.a_id and b.id = c.b_id_x000D_
```_x000D_
i.e. ActiveQuery for the child table is have single `from` and can be use single prefix._x000D_
_x000D_
Note:_x000D_
for #14161_x000D_
This method can be private or _x000D_
`framework/validators/ExistValidator.php`_x000D_
`framework/validators/UniqueValidator.php`_x000D_
can use this method too_x000D_
_x000D_
Example: after path_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class Duration extends \yii\db\ActiveRecord {_x000D_
..._x000D_
    public function getUnit()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return $this->hasOne(DurationUnit::className(), ['id' => 'unitId'])->inverseOf('durations');_x000D_
    }_x000D_
..._x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
```php_x000D_
        echo Duration::find()_x000D_
            ->joinWith([_x000D_
                'unit as unitAlias' => function (DurationUnitQuery $query) {_x000D_
                    $query->andWhere(['id' => [5, 3, 2, 1]]);_x000D_
                }_x000D_
            ])_x000D_
            ->andWhere(['id' => [4, 5, 9]])_x000D_
            ->alias('durationAlias')_x000D_
            ->createCommand()->getRawSql();_x000D_
```_x000D_
produce_x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))_x000D_
```_x000D_
current _x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
and "as target" result must be_x000D_
```SQL_x000D_
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`durationAlias`.`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
include some tests_x000D_

title: GridView-columns-special-value-to-disable-colunm
author: bscheshirwork
body:
For a case non-simple-gii-generated GridView..._x000D_
_x000D_
Add a simple logic to turn off the column:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    <?= GridView::widget([_x000D_
        'dataProvider' => $dataProvider,_x000D_
        'filterModel' => $searchModel,_x000D_
        'columns' => [_x000D_
            ['class' => 'yii\grid\SerialColumn'],_x000D_
'~5 first like this' => [_x000D_
                'format' => 'raw',_x000D_
                'attribute' => 'attributeName',_x000D_
                'label' => $searchModel->getAttributeLabel('searchAttributeName'),_x000D_
                'content' => callbackToAttributeName(),_x000D_
                'filter' => filterToAttributeName(),_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
_x000D_
'underDiscussion' => \Yii::$app->user->can('viewUnderDiscussionColumn') ? [_x000D_
                'format' => 'raw',_x000D_
                'attribute' => 'attributeName',_x000D_
                'label' => $searchModel->getAttributeLabel('searchAttributeName'),_x000D_
                'content' => callbackToAttributeName(),_x000D_
                'filter' => filterToAttributeName(),_x000D_
            ] : false,_x000D_
_x000D_
'~5 last like this' => [_x000D_
                'format' => 'raw',_x000D_
                'attribute' => 'attributeName',_x000D_
                'label' => $searchModel->getAttributeLabel('searchAttributeName'),_x000D_
                'content' => callbackToAttributeName(),_x000D_
                'filter' => filterToAttributeName(),_x000D_
            ]',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ]); ?>_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
p.s.: `visible` is request to create the column before disable it. Its terrible._x000D_

title: Change extractMessagesFromTokens to protected
author: faenir
body:
In my modules I use function like this:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public static function t($message, $params = [], $language = null)_x000D_
{_x000D_
    return \Yii::t('category_name', $message, $params, $language);_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
Due to this there is no need to specify a category each time._x000D_
```php_x000D_
Module::t('message')_x000D_
```_x000D_
But `message/extract` not working without category._x000D_
I wanted to extend the method `extractMessagesFromTokens `, but it `private`. Can we change it to `protected`?

title: Nested fields and expand
author: bboure
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #6844 _x000D_
_x000D_
This is my approach of @mdmunir's https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/11493_x000D_
I avoided touching ArrayHelper's toArray() which in my opinion should not be involved into this._x000D_
_x000D_
Also, I introduced the concept of selecting nested fields as well and introduced the '*' wildcard for selecting all fields._x000D_
_x000D_
You can now do: `user/1?fields=*,orders.*,orders.items.name&expand=orders.items`_x000D_
_x000D_
Which means: _x000D_
- get user 1 and all it's fields._x000D_
- expand orders and get all fields from orders_x000D_
- expand orders' items but only get the name._x000D_
_x000D_
Note that `*,orders.*` is required to explicitly get all fields from user and orders._x000D_
`order.items.name` alone means "only get order.items.name" fields._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Added support for specifying aliases for migrationNamespaces
author: cebe
body:
This is used to specify pathes to migrations that do not have_x000D_
namespaces._x000D_
_x000D_
While not directly supported by the migration command provided by the_x000D_
framework, these migrations exist in a lot of extensions because custom implementations_x000D_
of migration controllers out of the framework were using this approach_x000D_
to load multiple migrations from multiple paths._x000D_
_x000D_
Even the framework itself currently ships non-namespaced migrations:_x000D_
_x000D_
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/17a1d91e4a517f4f15dce973bf3c50dd939dce63/framework/rbac/migrations/m140506_102106_rbac_init.php_x000D_
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/17a1d91e4a517f4f15dce973bf3c50dd939dce63/framework/caching/migrations/m150909_153426_cache_init.php_x000D_
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/17a1d91e4a517f4f15dce973bf3c50dd939dce63/framework/log/migrations/m141106_185632_log_init.php_x000D_
_x000D_
This change allows existing applications to adopt the new namespace-based approach_x000D_
while keeping existing migrations. While it would be possible to add_x000D_
namespaces to migrations in the application itself, it is not easily possible_x000D_
to add namespaces to migrations that come from external sources like_x000D_
extensions._x000D_
_x000D_
related discussion in #13359 and #13356._x000D_
_x000D_
this replaces #13359_x000D_
_x000D_
- [x] I will add some tests to verify behavior later.

title: ActiveRecordInterface improvements
author: SamMousa
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_

_x000D_
Small improvements to `ActiveRecordInterface` to make it more complete._x000D_
The following functions have been added. For each I have listed 1 "proof", one instance where it is called based on the assumption that the class is an active record class._x000D_
_x000D_
- populateRecord [ActiveQueryTrait#134](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/db/ActiveQueryTrait.php#L134)_x000D_

title: Set default response formatter configs using array syntax
author: brandonkelly
body:
With the exception of JSONP, if a controller wants to change default response formatter options, currently it needs to respecify the formatter class name:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
Yii::$app->response->formatters[Response::FORMAT_JSON] = [_x000D_
    'class' => 'yii\web\JsonResponseFormatter',_x000D_
    'prettyPrint' => true,_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
With this change, you can just tweak the setting, since the formatter config will already be defined as an array:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
Yii::$app->response->formatters[Response::FORMAT_JSON]['prettyPrint'] = true;_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_

title: Enh: comment wording in BaseActiveRecord::init()
author: drodata
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Based on the 3rd convention of extending Component/Object:_x000D_
_x000D_
> If you override the [[yii\base\Object::init()]] method, make sure you call the parent implementation of init() **at the beginning of** your init() method._x000D_
>_x000D_
> https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/guide/concept-components.md_x000D_
_x000D_
Suppose I created an AR class named `Customer`, and attached some events by overriding the `init()` method, I think_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public function init()_x000D_
{_x000D_
    parent::init();_x000D_
    $this->on(self::EVENT_AFTER_INSERT, [$this, 'doSomething']);_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
is better than_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public function init()_x000D_
{_x000D_
    $this->on(self::EVENT_AFTER_INSERT, [$this, 'doSomething']);_x000D_
    parent::init();_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Bug #14296 log targets failure capturing [not fully completed]
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | isolated log tests - yes, not sure about the whole app_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #14296_x000D_
_x000D_
This fix adds condition check for log targets exporting and in case of failure exception is thrown._x000D_
Exception is caught by dispatcher and the warning can be passed to the next log target if there are any left._x000D_
_x000D_
## Status of this PR:_x000D_
_x000D_
### EmailTarget_x000D_
- [x] condition check based on the result of `send()` method implemented through `\yii\mail\MessageInterface`_x000D_
- [x] tests covered_x000D_
_x000D_
### FileTarget_x000D_
- [x] condition check based on the result of `fwrite()` and `file_put_contents()` methods - exception is thrown when methods return `false` or write less bytes than expected_x000D_
- [ ] tests covered - not sure how to mock `fwrite()` error properly - possible solution is to do it like in the `/tests/framework/log/SyslogTargetTest.php` or to use `vfsStream` library but this is not included in the `composer.json` right now_x000D_
_x000D_
### DbTarget_x000D_
- [x] condition check based on whether the result of `execute()` method with `INSERT` statement returned more than 0 rows or not_x000D_
- [ ] tests covered - not sure how to mock failed INSERT statement_x000D_
_x000D_
### SyslogTarget_x000D_
- [x] condition check based on the result of `syslog()` method_x000D_
- [x] tests covered - overridden methods `openlog()`, `syslog()` and `closelog()` return boolean values now_x000D_

title: Fix support for database schemas in gii model generator
author: nineinchnick
body: Fixes #1435. I've checked and only pgsql and mssql got schemas. Both in getTableNames for non-default schema return list of tables prefixed with schema name.

title: issue #13674 fix
author: dabkhazi
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13674 _x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
framework/db/mssql/QueryBuilder.php_x000D_
_x000D_
Before (normalizeColumns):_x000D_
_x000D_
             foreach ($columns as $name => $value) {_x000D_
                 // @see https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/12599_x000D_
                if (isset($columnSchemas[$name]) && $columnSchemas[$name]->type === Schema::TYPE_BINARY && $columnSchemas[$name]->dbType === 'varbinary' && is_string($value)) {_x000D_
                     $phName = self::PARAM_PREFIX . count($params);_x000D_
                    $columns[$name] = new Expression("CONVERT(VARBINARY, $phName)", [$phName => $value]);_x000D_
                 }_x000D_
             }_x000D_
_x000D_
After:_x000D_
_x000D_
             foreach ($columns as $name => $value) {_x000D_
                 // @see https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/12599_x000D_
                if (isset($columnSchemas[$name]) && $columnSchemas[$name]->type === Schema::TYPE_BINARY && $columnSchemas[$name]->dbType === 'varbinary' && (is_string($value) || is_null($value))) {_x000D_
                     $phName = self::PARAM_PREFIX . count($params);_x000D_
                    $params[$phName] = $value;_x000D_
                    $columns[$name] = new Expression("CONVERT(VARBINARY(MAX), $phName)", [$phName => $value]);_x000D_
                 }_x000D_
             }_x000D_
_x000D_
Comments: _x000D_
+is_null($value) - this fix inserting null values into varbinary field_x000D_
+$params[$phName] = $value; - this fix params counter_x000D_
_x000D_
framework/rbac/DBManager.php_x000D_
_x000D_
Before (getRule):_x000D_
_x000D_
        $row = (new Query())->select(['data'])_x000D_
             ->from($this->ruleTable)_x000D_
             ->where(['name' => $name])_x000D_
             ->one($this->db);_x000D_
_x000D_
After:_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * Convert binary column to string_x000D_
     * @param string $column the name of column to be converted_x000D_
     */       _x000D_
    protected function toStringBinaryColumn($column) {  _x000D_
        if ($this->db->getDriverName() == 'sqlsrv') {_x000D_
            $toType = $this->db->charset == 'utf8' ? 'NVARCHAR(MAX)' : 'VARCHAR(MAX)';_x000D_
            return new Expression("CONVERT($toType,$column) $column");  _x000D_
        }_x000D_
        return $column;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
    _x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * Check if the columns of type binary and convert it to string_x000D_
     * @param string $table the name of table_x000D_
     * @param array $columns the column names_x000D_
     */    _x000D_
    protected function normalizeColumns($table,$columns) {_x000D_
        if (($tableSchema = $this->db->getSchema()->getTableSchema($table)) !== null) {_x000D_
            $result = [];_x000D_
            $columnSchemas = $tableSchema->columns;_x000D_
            foreach ($columns as $column) {_x000D_
                if (isset($columnSchemas[$column]) && $columnSchemas[$column]->type === \yii\db\Schema::TYPE_BINARY) {_x000D_
                    $result[] = $this->toStringBinaryColumn($column);_x000D_
                } else {_x000D_
                    $result[] = $column;_x000D_
                }   _x000D_
            }_x000D_
            return $result;_x000D_
        }_x000D_
        return $columns;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
getRule:_x000D_
_x000D_
        $row = (new Query)->select($this->normalizeColumns($this->ruleTable,['data']))        _x000D_
             ->from($this->ruleTable)_x000D_
             ->where(['name' => $name])_x000D_
             ->one($this->db);_x000D_
_x000D_
Comments: Rule lives in column with name - data, for mssql DB it has type Varbinary and before unserialize the value of this column we need to convert value into string._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Add testcase demonstrating UniqueValidator bug
author: laszlovl
body:
Commit 0df8020dd0e2990a9bc39bd84056aa2c88d50df7 broke UniqueValidator for models with a "default scope"._x000D_
_x000D_
What happens is that UniqueValidator queries the target class only `select()`'ing the primary key, while the default scoped relation's foreign key is necessary in `filterByModels`. Because of the `asArray()` in UniqueValidator, the missing column isn't handled gracefully by ActiveRecord but triggers a key error._x000D_
_x000D_
There are a few possible solutions, not sure which one is preferred._x000D_
_x000D_
1. Remove `asArray()` in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2-framework/blob/master/validators/UniqueValidator.php#L178_x000D_
2. Remove if block in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2-framework/blob/master/validators/UniqueValidator.php#L174 so every column is selected_x000D_
3. Gracefully handle non-existing keys in `filterByModels`

title: Adds lifecycle events
author: markhuot
body:
Adds events to all components so you may hook into their `init` without modifying the class code._x000D_
_x000D_
There a many uses for these events and I admit I may not be thinking of all of them. My primary reason for needing this is to add behaviors to objects that I don't control the instantiation of._x000D_
_x000D_
E.g., in Craft (a CMS built on Yii), I can't control the generation of `Field` objects while writing a plugin for the CMS. Because of this there's no good place to add a `Behavior` to the `Field`._x000D_
_x000D_
With component lifecycle events I can do something like this, though, to add behaviors every time a `Field` is instantiated:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
Event::on(Field::className(), Field::EVENT_AFTER_INIT, function ($event) {_x000D_
  $event->sender->attachBehavior('myBehavior', MyBehavior::class);_x000D_
});_x000D_
```_x000D_
You can see a related PR for Craft here: https://github.com/craftcms/cms/pull/1856#issuecomment-317914044_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | none_x000D_

title: Add handleOptions to Cors filter so OPTIONS requests are handled for the preflight check.
author: michaelarnauts
body:
The handling of the CORS preflight check in yii2 is broken at the moment and workarounds are being applied all the time._x000D_
_x000D_
Most posts or comments handle the case of the `yii\rest\ActiveRestController` where you have to add a `'except' => ['options']` to the Authentication filter, because an OPTIONS call will be routed to the `actionOptions` function. If you don't add this, the request will succeed trough the Cors filter, and arrive at the Authentication filter, where it will be rejected since the preflight check has no Authentication._x000D_
_x000D_
This recommendation is potentially dangerous, since code in the `actionOptions` can be executed without authentication. Also, when you extend from a `yii\rest\Controller`, the routing isn't done to `actionOptions`, and you can't use `'except' => ['options']` to force the request to go trough. A better approach is needed. _x000D_
_x000D_
This MR adds a `handleOptions` to the `Cors` filter. If you add this filter in your behaviour, you obviously expect those requests to arrive at your controller so you want the preflight check to pass. This change makes sure that the preflight checks are handled correctly by accepting them with a 200 OK, but not executing the code of the actual request (since the beforeAction returns `false`)._x000D_
_x000D_
Since CORS requests don't have authentication, you still need to have the Cors filter before the Authentication filter. By returning false in the CORS filter, the handling is stopped and the Authentication filter isn't executed, so the request isn't rejected with an 401 Unauthorised._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes/no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes/no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #14032, but a lot more. See also https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues?q=cors%20OPTIONS_x000D_
_x000D_

body:
Sometimes when we use ErrorAction, we need use different layout, but now it's little bit difficult to do it easily, so this small new feature help to solve problem_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
    public function actions()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            'error' => [_x000D_
                'class' => 'yii\web\ErrorAction',_x000D_
                'layout' => 'error'_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

However it could have some side effects to client side scripts:_x000D_

(Users may also wonder if they actually count their typed in characters.)
