title: [WIP] Prefer `assertSame()` over `assertEquals()` in tests
author: rob006
body:
For testing I've enabled the `php_unit_strict` rule for php-cs-fixer, which blindly changes `assertEquals()` to `assertSame()`. Obviously this results some failed tests, but results are still quite surprising to me:_x000D_
_x000D_
- Over 2500 assertions was changed, and this results only ~270 failed tests. _x000D_
- Many of failures relates to comparing objects where `assertSame()` does not make sense._x000D_
- Most of failures is result of ambiguous or simply invalid tests. For example:_x000D_
_x000D_
https://travis-ci.org/rob006/yii2-dev/jobs/266138271_x000D_
```_x000D_
6) yiiunit\framework\caching\ArrayCacheTest::testMultiGet_x000D_
Failed asserting that Array &0 (_x000D_
    'number_test' => 42_x000D_
    'non_existent_key' => false_x000D_
) is identical to Array &0 (_x000D_
    'number_test' => 42_x000D_
    'non_existent_key' => null_x000D_
)._x000D_
_x000D_
/home/travis/build/rob006/yii2-dev/tests/framework/caching/CacheTestCase.php:183_x000D_
/home/travis/build/rob006/yii2-dev/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit:52_x000D_
_x000D_
7) yiiunit\framework\caching\ArrayCacheTest::testGetOrSet_x000D_
Failed asserting that false is identical to null._x000D_
_x000D_
/home/travis/build/rob006/yii2-dev/tests/framework/caching/CacheTestCase.php:267_x000D_
/home/travis/build/rob006/yii2-dev/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit:52_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
This two tests are invalid. For cache type has meaning - tests expects that misses will return `null`, but (correctly) `false` is returned. This tests passes only because invalid assertion is used. _x000D_
_x000D_
At first I thought that using `php_unit_strict` as hard rule does not make much sense, but now I'm not sure. Such rule really helps catch invalid assertions, and type should be testes in most (all?) of the cases. Especially since PHP 7 and `strict_types`. We just need to write some assertion for testing objects (which will work as `assertEquals()` for objects and as `assertSame()` for everything else).

title: Enable `ordered_class_elements` rule in php-cs-fixer config
author: rob006
body:
https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/PHP-CS-Fixer_x000D_
_x000D_
> **ordered_class_elements**_x000D_
> Orders the elements of classes/interfaces/traits._x000D_
_x000D_
Configured order:_x000D_
1. used traits,_x000D_
2. constants,_x000D_
3. properties (public first, private last),_x000D_
4. constructor,_x000D_
5. destructor,_x000D_
6. magic methods,_x000D_
7. rest of class body._x000D_
_x000D_
Forcing this order may be required if we want to write fixer for empty lines between class elements which follows Yii convention (no empty line between properties with the same visibility, two lines between properties and methods)._x000D_

title: Cache user assignments to avoid unnecessary DB queries
author: cebe
body:
alternative to #9138 and #10981, only cache on `checkAccess` call which is usually_x000D_
called on every request. Cache is not necessary in RBAC management._x000D_
_x000D_
Similar to #14061 but includes proper cache invalidation and test._x000D_
_x000D_
`getAssignments()` always queries the DB. The cache is only applied on_x000D_
`checkAccess` calls, and invalidated as soon as the RBAC structure is_x000D_
modified through the manager component (verified by the test case)._x000D_
_x000D_
Regarding [concerns of memory usage](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/14061#issuecomment-297982502)_x000D_
if used in batch mode on multiple users, you can call_x000D_
`invalidateCache()` method if this really causes a problem._x000D_
_x000D_
fixes #7743_x000D_
close #9138_x000D_
close #14061_x000D_
close #10981_x000D_
_x000D_
See also_x000D_
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/7626#issuecomment-77745166_x000D_
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/14061#issuecomment-319645488_x000D_

title: Allow get non-exists attributes of DynamicModel
author: MuVO
body:
Currently I have an issue when used DynamicModel in case of ad-hoc validation, when creating request-based «virtual» model: if I passed request data which must be validated but request does not contains some required attributes, my application will throws an exception because validator tried to validate non-existent attributes._x000D_
Use case:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function actionIndex()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $rules = [_x000D_
            [['id', 'email'], 'required'],_x000D_
            ['id', 'integer'],_x000D_
            ['name', 'string'],_x000D_
            ['email', 'email'],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
_x000D_
        $preModel = DynamicModel::validateData(\Yii::$app->request->bodyParams, $rules);_x000D_
_x000D_
        /*_x000D_
         * some code _x000D_
         */_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
If HTTP form wouldn't contain any of attributes, which enumerated in rules this cause fatal exception in application instead of fills of "errors" of dynamic model._x000D_
_x000D_
I think this is not right behavior of this class. Dynamic model is a «virtual» model, therefore its logic could have some differs from basic model. For example, primary purpose of dynamic model — ad-hoc data validation. But actually we can't correctly verify source object, if this object hasn't some attributes, if even "required" validators were created._x000D_
_x000D_
I offer following solution of this issue: DynamicModel must always "correctly" handling a getting of *any* attributes. If getting of non-exsting attribute called, it just return an empty null-value. If we would need, we could check this attribute by relevant validator — e.g., "required"._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes/no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes/no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes/no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes/no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | comma-separated list of tickets # fixed by the PR, if any_x000D_

title: Remove Yii autoloader
author: samdark
body:
When original Yii 2.0 autoloader was implemented there was no PSR-4 so it was a requirement to support aliases for extensions to load their classes. Also we wanted to have something like Yii 1.1 `Yii::import()` which proved to be quite useless when using autoloading._x000D_

title: performance issue on rbac schema
author: ivan-redooc
body:
This commit solve a performance issue when a medium-tiny prermission/role hierarchy is used with a lot of users adding an index on `auth_assignment`.`user_id`.
See the queries in `yii\rbac\DbManager::getInheritedPermissionsByUser` and `yii\rbac\DbManager::getAssignments`.

title: Simplifying access to ActiveQuery from ActiveRecord
author: oldy777
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_

Use case:_x000D_
Old_x000D_
```_x000D_
$customer = Customer::find()->select(['*', '([[status]]*2) AS [[status2]]'])->where(['name' => 'user3'])->one();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
New_x000D_
```_x000D_
$customer = Customer::select(['*', '([[status]]*2) AS [[status2]]'])->where(['name' => 'user3'])->one();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Old_x000D_
```_x000D_
Customer::find()->count()_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
New_x000D_
```_x000D_
Customer::count()_x000D_
```

title: Eliminating constant
author: egorpromo
body: In yii\base\Controller we have `Yii::$app->trigger(Application::EVENT_BEFORE_ACTION, $event);`. It is hard and complicated to look at yii\base\Application.php every time. This event is used only once. There is no need to use constant. It is possible to do the same thing in simple way. So I think we can eliminate redundant information to ease our work.

title: i18N: View path does not change if language folder exists
author: ghost
body:
The directory structure:

```
views
|-- de-DE
| -- faq.php
-- faq.php
```

The source language is 'en-US' (unchanged). The current language is 'de-DE'. I expected that the views/de-DE/faq.php would be rendered. But it instead the original views/faq.php is rendered.

title: Add rest\GroupUrlRule; add rest\UrlRule param controllerPrefix
author: bscheshirwork
body:
For more "versioned" of config of `RESTful` `api` application_x000D_
_x000D_
All of rules of major version is one rest\GroupUrlRule;_x000D_
In nested rules `module` prefix is omitted;_x000D_
_x000D_
Current_x000D_
```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'modules' => [_x000D_
        'v1' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v1\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'v2' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v2\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'urlManager' => [_x000D_
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,_x000D_
            'enableStrictParsing' => true,_x000D_
            'showScriptName' => false,_x000D_
            'rules' => [_x000D_
                ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'controller' => ['v1/user', 'v1/post']],_x000D_
                ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'controller' => ['v2/user', 'v2/post']],_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
propose_x000D_
```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'modules' => [_x000D_
        'v1' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v1\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'v2' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v2\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'urlManager' => [_x000D_
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,_x000D_
            'enableStrictParsing' => true,_x000D_
            'showScriptName' => false,_x000D_
            'rules' => [_x000D_
                // v1_x000D_
                [_x000D_
                    'class' => 'yii\rest\GroupUrlRule',_x000D_
                    'prefix' => 'v1',_x000D_
                    'rules' => [_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => 'post',_x000D_
                            'pluralize' => false,_x000D_
                            'only' => ['index', 'view', 'options'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                       'user',_x000D_
                        //another yii\rest\UrlRule of v1 module with differences in params_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                // v2_x000D_
                [_x000D_
                    'class' => 'yii\rest\GroupUrlRule',_x000D_
                    'prefix' => 'v2',_x000D_
                    'rules' => [_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => 'post',_x000D_
                            'pluralize' => false,_x000D_
                            'only' => ['index', 'view', 'options'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                        'u' => 'user',_x000D_
                        //another yii\rest\UrlRule of v2 module with differences in params_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                //..._x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_

title: Added filter docs
author: samdark
body:
Added some docs. Please check if these are enough to get started with filters. While putting it together some questions surfaced:_x000D_
_x000D_
1. Data filters overall aren't bound to REST so probably it's a good idea to move them under `data` namespace. @klimov-paul have you considered it?_x000D_
2. Not sure it's a good idea to enable filters in REST `IndexAction` by default. My concern is that it could be used for quite complicated conditions that could be exploited to hurt API performance._x000D_

title: Add routePrefix to rest url rule
author: bscheshirwork
body:
This PR only for add single property `routePrefix`._x000D_
_x000D_
In `yii\web\GroupUrlRule` this property can be used as part of `ruleConfig`_x000D_
_x000D_
In nested rules `module` prefix is omitted;_x000D_
_x000D_
Current_x000D_
```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'modules' => [_x000D_
        'v1' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v1\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'v2' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v2\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'urlManager' => [_x000D_
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,_x000D_
            'enableStrictParsing' => true,_x000D_
            'showScriptName' => false,_x000D_
            'rules' => [_x000D_
                ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'controller' => ['v1/user', 'v1/post']],_x000D_
                ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'controller' => ['v2/user', 'v2/post']],_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
propose_x000D_
```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'modules' => [_x000D_
        'v1' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v1\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'v2' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v2\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'urlManager' => [_x000D_
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,_x000D_
            'enableStrictParsing' => true,_x000D_
            'showScriptName' => false,_x000D_
            'rules' => [_x000D_
                // v1_x000D_
                [_x000D_
                    'class' => 'yii\web\GroupUrlRule',_x000D_
                    'prefix' => 'v1',_x000D_
                    'routePrefix' => '',_x000D_
                    'ruleConfig' => ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'routePrefix' => 'v1'],_x000D_
                    'rules' => [_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => 'post',_x000D_
                            'pluralize' => false,_x000D_
                            'only' => ['index', 'view', 'options'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => ['user'],_x000D_
                        ]_x000D_
                        //another yii\rest\UrlRule of v1 module with differences in params_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                // v2_x000D_
                [_x000D_
                    'class' => 'yii\web\GroupUrlRule',_x000D_
                    'prefix' => 'v2',_x000D_
                    'routePrefix' => '',_x000D_
                    'ruleConfig' => ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'routePrefix' => 'v2'],_x000D_
                    'rules' => [_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => 'post',_x000D_
                            'pluralize' => false,_x000D_
                            'only' => ['index', 'view', 'options'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                             'controller' => ['u' => 'user'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                        //another yii\rest\UrlRule of v2 module with differences in params_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                //..._x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Add routePrefix AND add yii\rest\GroupUrlRule
author: bscheshirwork
body:
This PR is part 2 of split. Same as #14996, applied #15042 changes_x000D_
_x000D_
For more "versioned" of config of `RESTful` `api` application_x000D_
_x000D_
All of rules of major version is one rest\GroupUrlRule;_x000D_
In nested rules `module` prefix is omitted;_x000D_
_x000D_
Current_x000D_
```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'modules' => [_x000D_
        'v1' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v1\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'v2' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v2\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'urlManager' => [_x000D_
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,_x000D_
            'enableStrictParsing' => true,_x000D_
            'showScriptName' => false,_x000D_
            'rules' => [_x000D_
                ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'controller' => ['v1/user', 'v1/post']],_x000D_
                ['class' => 'yii\rest\UrlRule', 'controller' => ['v2/user', 'v2/post']],_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
propose_x000D_
```php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'modules' => [_x000D_
        'v1' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v1\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        'v2' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'app\modules\v2\Module',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'components' => [_x000D_
        'urlManager' => [_x000D_
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,_x000D_
            'enableStrictParsing' => true,_x000D_
            'showScriptName' => false,_x000D_
            'rules' => [_x000D_
                // v1_x000D_
                [_x000D_
                    'class' => 'yii\rest\GroupUrlRule',_x000D_
                    'prefix' => 'v1',_x000D_
                    'rules' => [_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => 'post',_x000D_
                            'pluralize' => false,_x000D_
                            'only' => ['index', 'view', 'options'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                       'user',_x000D_
                        //another yii\rest\UrlRule of v1 module with differences in params_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                // v2_x000D_
                [_x000D_
                    'class' => 'yii\rest\GroupUrlRule',_x000D_
                    'prefix' => 'v2',_x000D_
                    'rules' => [_x000D_
                        [_x000D_
                            'controller' => 'post',_x000D_
                            'pluralize' => false,_x000D_
                            'only' => ['index', 'view', 'options'],_x000D_
                        ],_x000D_
                        'u' => 'user',_x000D_
                        //another yii\rest\UrlRule of v2 module with differences in params_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                //..._x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Named params is DI container
author: vtvz
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | tests of DI group is pass_x000D_
_x000D_
Example:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class Foo_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $bar;_x000D_
    public $bar2;_x000D_
_x000D_
    public function __construct($bar, $bar2)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $this->bar = $bar;_x000D_
        $this->bar2 = $bar2;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
//....._x000D_
_x000D_
$container->set(Foo::class, [], [_x000D_
    'bar2' => 'value_two',_x000D_
    'bar' => 'value_one',_x000D_
]);_x000D_
_x000D_
//....._x000D_
_x000D_
$container->get(Foo::class);_x000D_
// which is equivalent to:_x000D_
new Foo('value_one', 'value_two');_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Tests:_x000D_
```bash_x000D_
docker-compose build; docker-compose run --rm php vendor/bin/phpunit -v --group di_x000D_
PHPUnit 4.8.34 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors._x000D_

body:
Stores string in temporary file, renders and returns result using existing renderPhpFile function._x000D_
_x000D_

- [ ] Tests_x000D_
- [x] Documentation (PHPDoc)_x000D_
- [ ] Documentation (Guide)_x000D_
- [ ] Example of use case_x000D_
_x000D_
The purpose of this feature is to create a way to utilize Yii framework View class to work with string-based PHP view code that are stored in data base or generated dynamically._x000D_
_x000D_
This can be used for CMS editable PHP templates for widgets, templated e-mail messages and templated PDF documents (generated from HTML code)._x000D_
_x000D_
This implementation should be tested how it performs in console environment, where `Yii::$app->view` is a bit different than in web environment.

title: Added dynamic content API
author: sergeymakinen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | N/A_x000D_
_x000D_
The dynamic content feature is very handy but it lacks a public API._x000D_
_x000D_
This PR defines API for [dynamic content](http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/guide-caching-fragment.html#dynamic-content), reimplements `FragmentCache` & `PageCache` with this API. And allows any cache aware filters/widgets to benefit from this feature with a very little effort required._x000D_
_x000D_
Naming could be adjusted but I think this API is simple and strict enough._x000D_
_x000D_
It's BC safe:_x000D_
- `$dynamicPlaceholders` in `FragmentCache` & `PageCache` are `@internal` but these classes are powered by `BaseObject` and `DynamicContentAwareInterface` defines a getter/setter anyway_x000D_
- the `updateDynamicContent` method is now in the trait and its forth parameter is optional_x000D_
- affected classes are already covered_x000D_
- anything else?_x000D_
_x000D_
`$cacheStack` & `$dynamicPlaceholders` are marked as deprecated (as public properties). They should be `private` in 2.1 (I don't see reasons to expose them). I don't know if a deprecation is really required since they are `@internal`.

| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #15117 _x000D_
_x000D_
> `MigrateController::truncateDatabase()` gets table names from `Schema::getTableSchemas()`, where the `TableSchema::$name` for the migrations table is plain **`migration`** (or `{prefix}migration` if current `Connection::$tablePrefix` is `{prefix}`). The metadata for **this** table name is discarded._x000D_
> _x000D_
 > But `MigrateController::getMigrationHistory()`, which is called when migrating up, gets the metadata for `MigrateController::$migrationTable`, defined as **`{{%migration}}`** by default. If the metadata for **this** table name is cached, `Schema::getTableMetadata()` will return that regardless of the value of `$refresh` (and the actual schema state). That's what this issue is all about._x000D_
> _x000D_
> I suppose a solution would involve tuning table prefix resolution for schema caching and/or migrations._x000D_
> _x000D_
> @U-D13_x000D_

title: Fix DbSession::writeSession race condition.
author: ddinchev
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13212_x000D_
_x000D_
It has been previously reported #13212 There is a race condition in `DbSession::writeSession()`. _x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
Integrity constraint violation: SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry 'kupbup8mepuaco3dr5qdretsde' for key 'PRIMARY'_x000D_
The SQL being executed was: INSERT INTO `YiiSession` (`data`, `id`, `expire`) VALUES ('__flash|a:0:{}', 'kupbup8mepuaco3dr5qdretsde', 1510386856)_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
After updating to `2.0.13`, I get around a dozen of those errors per day (I use MySQL 5.7), on a low traffic website that has less than a thousand visits a day. The session table has less than 1000 rows, the garbage collector is working correctly. I guess prior to `2.0.13` the errors were not exposed through the standard error logger - now this is fixed by #14908 _x000D_
_x000D_
I'm not entirely sure why would the generated session id collide so often. My solution does the check if session id already exists in the storage in a transaction. Performance impact should be negligible as there should be only one session read/write per request._x000D_

title: Console improvements
author: brandonkelly
body:
Made a few improvements to Yii's CLI support:_x000D_
_x000D_
1. camelCased console command options can now optionally be specified in kebab-case. So for example if you have an option called `dumpJson`, now either `--dumpJson` or `--dump-json` will work._x000D_
_x000D_
   It was technically already possible for console commands to support kebab-cased options, as the option regex has always allowed `-`s. (For example we made it possible by overriding a command’s `__get()` and `__set()` methods [in a recent project](https://github.com/pixelandtonic/craftcom/blob/c801526a6efe1a185b32930b255fc13b6506127f/src/console/controllers/PackagesController.php#L23-L42).) So to ensure we don’t break BC, the code makes sure that the kebab-cased option wasn’t already in `$options` before converting it to camelCase._x000D_
_x000D_
   In addition, any camelCase option names are now converted to kebab-case in the `help` command outputs, e.g. `help command/path` and `help/list-action-options command/path`._x000D_
_x000D_
2. Added support for `--<option> <value>` and `-<alias> <value>` syntax, as an alternative to `--<option>=<value>` and `-<alias>=<value>`. Basically when looping through the `$params` in yii\console\Request::resolve(), if it gets to a raw param value that didn't have an option name, it will check whether the last param was missing a value, and if so, it overrides its assumed value (`true`) with the current value._x000D_
_x000D_
   Technically this is a change in behavior for yii\console\Request::resolve(), which given the options `--foo bar` would have previously returned the params `['foo' => true, 0 => 'bar']`, however that would have resulted in an `Unknown option` error in yii\console\Controller::runAction(), so I don’t think anyone will consider this a breaking change :)_x000D_
_x000D_
3. Improved the `help/list-action-options` command output, for options without a description. Previously they would have been output as `--<option>:<option>`, which was confusing; now they will output as just `--<option>`._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_

title: change order of autoload if phpunit run from outside
author: bscheshirwork
body:
Preamble: _x000D_
_x000D_
I try to create test environment for yii2 on local machine._x000D_
_x000D_
I want to use difference/fresh/git@dev version of PHPUnit_x000D_
I look at configs `tests/data/config-docker.php`, `tests/docker-compose*.yml`_x000D_
I prepare common composition_x000D_
```yml_x000D_
# Local run unit tests_x000D_
# for docker-compose CLI like this manual https://blog.jetbrains.com/phpstorm/2016/11/docker-remote-interpreters/_x000D_
# run directly:_x000D_
# docker-compose -f ../yii2-phpunit-docker-composition.yml run --rm --entrypoint bash php_x000D_
# and run `composer install` before first time use_x000D_
version: '2'_x000D_
services:_x000D_
  php:_x000D_
    image: bscheshir/codeception:php7.1.12-fpm-yii2 #contain phpunit_x000D_
    volumes:_x000D_
      - ./yii2/tests/data/config-docker.php:/var/www/html/tests/data/config.php # use named connection for db_x000D_
      - ./yii2:/var/www/html #src and tests shared to container_x000D_
      - ~/.composer/cache:/root/.composer/cache_x000D_
    environment:_x000D_
      TZ: Europe/Moscow_x000D_
      XDEBUG_CONFIG: "remote_host=192.168.0.83 remote_port=9002 remote_enable=On"_x000D_
      PHP_IDE_CONFIG: "serverName=codeception"_x000D_
    depends_on:_x000D_
      - pgsql_x000D_
      - mysql_x000D_
# example for pgsql_x000D_
# also add ./tests/data/config.local.php_x000D_
# <?php_x000D_
# $config['databases']['pgsql']['dsn'] = 'pgsql:host=pgsql;port=5432;dbname=yii2advanced';_x000D_
# $config['databases']['pgsql']['username'] = 'yii2advanced';_x000D_
# $config['databases']['pgsql']['password'] = 'yii2advanced';_x000D_
  pgsql:_x000D_
    image: postgres:10.1_x000D_
    environment:_x000D_
      TZ: Europe/Moscow_x000D_
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres_x000D_
      POSTGRES_DB: yiitest_x000D_
      POSTGRES_USER: postgres_x000D_
    networks:_x000D_
      default:_x000D_
        aliases:_x000D_
         - postgres_x000D_
  mysql:_x000D_
    image: mysql:8.0.3_x000D_
    entrypoint: ['/entrypoint.sh', '--character-set-server=utf8', '--collation-server=utf8_general_ci']_x000D_
    environment:_x000D_
      TZ: Europe/Moscow_x000D_
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: secret_x000D_
      MYSQL_DATABASE: yiitest_x000D_
      MYSQL_USER: travis_x000D_
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: travis_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I install dependencies_x000D_
```sh_x000D_
docker-compose -f ../yii2-phpunit-docker-composition.yml run --rm --entrypoint composer php install_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I try to run tests from my installation of PHPUnit_x000D_
```sh_x000D_
docker-compose -f ../yii2-phpunit-docker-composition.yml run --rm --entrypoint bash php_x000D_
root@13acef9fb08c:/var/www/html# /repo/vendor/bin/phpunit _x000D_
PHPUnit 6.2.4 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors._x000D_
..._x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
But I have [error](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/2878) with another composer autoload. Some classes of PHPUnit catch from yii2 composer autoloader. _x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
Proposition:_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fixed an issue where function availability is not checked.
author: SamMousa
body:
I noticed that in my local environment a test was failing._x000D_
My local environment has LibreSSL available; the code path that checks for that doesn't check if the function `openssl_pseudo_random_bytes` exists before using it._x000D_
The test suite depends on that check to return false to test for proper exceptions._x000D_

author: KoJIT2009
body:
add support Instance for object property in dic._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
Config_x000D_
```_x000D_
'container' => [_x000D_
        'definitions' => [_x000D_
            \console\models\TestService::class => [_x000D_
                'class' => \console\models\TestService::class,_x000D_
                'model' => Instance::of(\console\models\TestModel::class)_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
            \console\models\TestModel::class => [_x000D_
                'class' => \console\models\TestModel::class,_x000D_
                'property' => 20_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ]_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
```_x000D_
Classes_x000D_
_x000D_
TestService_x000D_
```_x000D_
class TestService extends BaseObject_x000D_
{_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @var \console\models\TestModel_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    private $model;_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @return \console\models\TestModel_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function getModel(): TestModel_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return $this->model;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @param \console\models\TestModel $model_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function setModel(TestModel $model)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $this->model = $model;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
TestModel_x000D_
```_x000D_
class TestModel_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $property = 10;_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Result_x000D_
```_x000D_
class console\models\TestService#28 (1) {_x000D_
  private $model =>_x000D_
  class console\models\TestModel#22 (1) {_x000D_
    public $property =>_x000D_
    int(20)_x000D_
  }_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Add signature of callable in DI
author: bscheshirwork
body:
Look at this:_x000D_
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/0455e852a7809c28eba293f9076854b62c57019f/framework/di/Container.php#L161-L163_x000D_
_x000D_
I think we need tell about signature of function :smile_cat: _x000D_
_x000D_
I expect to have configured object after use `Yii::createObject()`. I want to info about do it._x000D_
_x000D_
Example app config:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    'container' => [_x000D_
        'definitions' => [_x000D_
            \yii\queue\cli\VerboseBehavior::class => function ($containerDI, $params, $config) {_x000D_
                return new class($config) extends \yii\queue\cli\VerboseBehavior_x000D_
                {_x000D_
                    public function afterError(\yii\queue\ErrorEvent $event)_x000D_
                    {_x000D_
                        if (!($event->error instanceof \components\queue\TemporaryException)) {_x000D_
                            parent::afterError($event);_x000D_
_x000D_
                            return;_x000D_
                        }_x000D_
                        $this->command->stderr(date('Y-m-d H:i:s'), \yii\helpers\Console::FG_YELLOW);_x000D_
                        $class = get_class($event->job);_x000D_
                        $this->command->stderr(" [$event->id] $class (attempt: $event->attempt, pid: $event->workerPid)",_x000D_
                            \yii\helpers\Console::FG_GREY);_x000D_
                        $this->command->stderr(' - ', \yii\helpers\Console::FG_YELLOW);_x000D_
                        $this->command->stderr('TemporaryException', \yii\helpers\Console::BG_RED);_x000D_
                        $this->command->stderr(PHP_EOL);_x000D_
                    }_x000D_
                };_x000D_
            },_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes/no_x000D_

title: "ezyang/htmlpurifier" package has been made optional
author: klimov-paul
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #8452 (patrially)_x000D_
_x000D_
"html" data format is not mandatory to be used inside every application - it is necessary only in case web user is allowed to enter an HTML code, which should be shown as HTML code._x000D_
It is much more common to simply secure any web user input passing it to `htmlspecialchars()`, e.g. `Html::encode()` instead._x000D_
_x000D_
"ezyang/htmlpurifier" package has been made optional._x000D_
`HtmlPurifier` unlikely to be moved into a separated package since it produces tight coupling with `Formatter::asHtml()`, which can not be simply removed or dropped as developer may extend `Formatter` class providing his own implementation.

title: Event names changed matching 'dot-separated string' format
author: klimov-paul
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Extracted from disscussion at #14349_x000D_
Event names have been changed to 'dot-separated string' format, which is recommended by PSR._x000D_
Such format facilitates usage of wildcards for event handler specification.

title: improved dockerized tests
author: schmunk42
body:
- added ENV variable for using custom runtime folder_x000D_
- create assets directory before using asset-manager_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes (when using host-volumes for debugging tests)_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes (ENV var)_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes(!)_x000D_
_x000D_
When running and/or debugging tests from a host-volume with Docker, several tests fail due to disk-sync issues, therefore I added a variable to use a custom runtime folder, if not set it behaves like before._x000D_
_x000D_
Although the asset directory is available as empty folder from the repo, I also had issues with it in the above setup, when it was not create before the asset-manager was used.

--color: boolean, 0 or 1_x000D_
  whether to enable ANSI color in the output._x000D_

title: incorrect float to string conversion in yii\helper\BaseStringHelper
author: kminooie
body:
on my system,  (string) $number in line_x000D_
   return str_replace(',', '.', (string) $number);_x000D_
is converted to scientific notation, so it returns this 1.51643E+9 instead of 1516425820.449680. _x000D_
_x000D_
By the way this result is being used in \yii\log\Target::getTime(), this is obviously not the expected output of this code, yet I can not find anything in my php configuration/environment that would explain this. Although, it seems that I am only encountering this when I am using cli. _x000D_
_x000D_
I am seeing this on fedora ( latest php) and debian 9, running:_x000D_
_x000D_
$ php --version_x000D_
PHP 7.1.12-2+0~20171207160618.12+stretch~1.gbp5c91f3 (cli) (built: Dec  7 2017 16:06:20) ( NTS )_x000D_
Copyright (c) 1997-2017 The PHP Group_x000D_
Zend Engine v3.1.0, Copyright (c) 1998-2017 Zend Technologies_x000D_
    with Zend OPcache v7.1.12-2+0~20171207160618.12+stretch~1.gbp5c91f3, Copyright (c) 1999-2017, by Zend Technologies_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
it seems number_format() is a more foolproof and setting independent way of accomplishing this conversion_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Implement ExpressionInterface in Query
author: SilverFire
body:
This changes makes possible to build `Query` object using `queryBuilder->buildExpression()` and use unified interface._x000D_
_x000D_
After this changes, it is possible to use Query in conditions, where `Expression` was allowed before. Maybe later we could move logic from the `QueryBuilder::build()` method away to `QueryExpressionBuilder::build()` in order to make `QueryBuilder` class less massive._x000D_
_x000D_
Also this PR changes visibility for properties inside `Condition` classes from `protected` to `private`. Thinking about marking conditions with keyword `final` to discourage their extending and force composition over inheritance._x000D_
_x000D_
Fixes #14732, fixes #11218, fixes #14810, fixes #10855

title: Automatically expand relations in \yii\rest\Serializer
author: michaelarnauts
body:
Since #14219 got merged, the foundation for this patch was accepted. Now, the only remaining thing for a clean solution for rest calls is this._x000D_
_x000D_
This patch allows, for example, the following in a `\yii\rest\Controller` (or a `\yii\web\Controller` with a `\yii\rest\Serializer` serializer)._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function actionGetUsersWithServiceData(int $id)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return User::find($id)_x000D_
            ->with(['services'])_x000D_
            ->all();_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Output to frontend:_x000D_
```json_x000D_
[_x000D_
  {_x000D_
    "id": 1,_x000D_
    "name": "Mike",_x000D_
    "services": [_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 1,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 1"_x000D_
      },_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 2,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 2"_x000D_
      }_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
  },_x000D_
  {_x000D_
    "id": 2,_x000D_
    "name": "Bob",_x000D_
    "services": [_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 3,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 3"_x000D_
      }_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
  }_x000D_
]_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
The output of this function will be passed to the `\yii\rest\Serializer` and it will automatically include the `services` in the JSON output, since you've loaded it with `with()`._x000D_
_x000D_
Currently, this is not possible in yii2. You have to revert to using `asArray()` on the query, but that messes up the types of the attributes, since they are not mapped to the model. You also lose the ability to call functions on the objects before sending them to the frontend._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Automatically expand relations in \yii\rest\Serializer
author: michaelarnauts
body:
Since #14219 got merged, the foundation for this patch was accepted. Now, the only remaining thing for a clean solution for rest calls is this._x000D_
_x000D_
This patch allows, for example, the following in a `\yii\rest\Controller` (or a `\yii\web\Controller` with a `\yii\rest\Serializer` serializer)._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function actionGetUser(int $id)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return User::find($id)_x000D_
            ->with(['services'])_x000D_
            ->one();_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    public function actionGetAllUsers()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return User::find()_x000D_
            ->with(['services'])_x000D_
            ->all();_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Output to frontend (`/get-user/1`)_x000D_
```json_x000D_
{_x000D_
  "id": 1,_x000D_
  "name": "Mike",_x000D_
  "services": [_x000D_
    {_x000D_
      "id": 1,_x000D_
      "name": "Service 1"_x000D_
    },_x000D_
    {_x000D_
      "id": 2,_x000D_
      "name": "Service 2"_x000D_
    }_x000D_
  ]_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Output to frontend (`/get-all-users`)_x000D_
```json_x000D_
[_x000D_
  {_x000D_
    "id": 1,_x000D_
    "name": "Mike",_x000D_
    "services": [_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 1,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 1"_x000D_
      },_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 2,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 2"_x000D_
      }_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
  },_x000D_
  {_x000D_
    "id": 2,_x000D_
    "name": "Bob",_x000D_
    "services": [_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 1,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 1"_x000D_
      },_x000D_
      {_x000D_
        "id": 4,_x000D_
        "name": "Service 4"_x000D_
      }_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
  }_x000D_
]_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
The output of this function will be passed to the `\yii\rest\Serializer` and it will automatically include the `services` in the JSON output, since you've loaded it with `with()`._x000D_
_x000D_
Currently, this is not possible in yii2. You have to revert to using `asArray()` on the query, but that messes up the types of the attributes, since they are not mapped to the model. You also lose the ability to call functions on the objects before sending them to the frontend._x000D_
_x000D_

This method helps to solve one of the important problems of the first run of the project after deployment. _x000D_
_x000D_
With the advent of HTTP/2 compression of files is not required. And in some cases, it is impossible without rewriting the JS code of some components, because when compressed, they begin to conflict with each other._x000D_
_x000D_
In the process, `AssetController::actionPublish()` will publish all asset packages from the configuration file in the Web-accessible directory._x000D_

        [_x000D_
            'class' => SomeClass::class,_x000D_
            'prop1' => 1,_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
        [_x000D_
            'arg1',_x000D_
            'arg2',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
```_x000D_
 _x000D_
Become:_x000D_
 _x000D_
```php_x000D_
    SomeInterface::class => [_x000D_
	'class' => SomeClass::class,_x000D_
	'prop1' => 1,_x000D_
	'__construct()' => [_x000D_
            'arg1',_x000D_
            'arg2',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Speed up fetching MySQL constraints (fixes #15776)
author: sergeymakinen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #15776 _x000D_
_x000D_
Big kudos to @berosoboy & @MartijnHols. :)_x000D_
_x000D_
Just for reference, here is my version that I forgot to add initially:_x000D_
_x000D_
```sql_x000D_
SELECT DISTINCT_x000D_
    `kcu`.`CONSTRAINT_NAME` AS `name`,_x000D_
    `kcu`.`COLUMN_NAME` AS `column_name`,_x000D_
    `tc`.`CONSTRAINT_TYPE` AS `type`,_x000D_
    CASE_x000D_
        WHEN :schemaName IS NULL AND `kcu`.`REFERENCED_TABLE_SCHEMA` = `kcu`.`TABLE_SCHEMA` THEN NULL_x000D_
        ELSE `kcu`.`REFERENCED_TABLE_SCHEMA`_x000D_
    END AS `foreign_table_schema`,_x000D_
    `kcu`.`REFERENCED_TABLE_NAME` AS `foreign_table_name`,_x000D_
    `kcu`.`REFERENCED_COLUMN_NAME` AS `foreign_column_name`,_x000D_
    `rc`.`UPDATE_RULE` AS `on_update`,_x000D_
    `rc`.`DELETE_RULE` AS `on_delete`,_x000D_
    `kcu`.`ORDINAL_POSITION` AS `position`_x000D_
FROM `information_schema`.`KEY_COLUMN_USAGE` AS `kcu`_x000D_
INNER JOIN `information_schema`.`TABLE_CONSTRAINTS` AS `tc`_x000D_
    ON `tc`.`TABLE_SCHEMA` = `kcu`.`TABLE_SCHEMA` AND `tc`.`TABLE_NAME` = :tableName AND `tc`.`CONSTRAINT_NAME` = `kcu`.`CONSTRAINT_NAME`_x000D_
LEFT JOIN `information_schema`.`REFERENTIAL_CONSTRAINTS` AS `rc` # FORCE INDEX (`TABLE_NAME`)_x000D_
    ON `rc`.`CONSTRAINT_SCHEMA` = `kcu`.`TABLE_SCHEMA` AND `rc`.`TABLE_NAME` = :tableName_x000D_
WHERE `kcu`.`TABLE_SCHEMA` = COALESCE(:schemaName, DATABASE()) AND `kcu`.`TABLE_NAME` = :tableName_x000D_
ORDER BY `kcu`.`ORDINAL_POSITION` ASC_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
As `FORCE INDEX` doesn't seem to recognize keys in `information_schema`, this version is obviously slower.

title: Index information in TableSchema
author: lucianobaraglia
body:
See https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/797#issuecomment-31102969

This is a draft for the definitive implementation.
Only for Mysql.
If discussion is positive, I could work for other implementations too (pgsql and sqlite, maybe).

**Some notes:**
- In **MySql** the way to search for indexes and unique keys could use the same `regexp`, so the same method could be used, but ketp them separated for readability.
- In **MySql** indexes are called keys, but left them as indexes because is more universal

title: Improved emailvalidator & tests
author: SamMousa
body:
This is a first commit in fixing the emailvalidator._x000D_
Instead of having several different tests that test different sets of email addresses, I've refactored the code to test 1 list of email addresses more thoroughly._x000D_
_x000D_
The reasoning is this:_x000D_
1. An email address like: `Bob <bob@example.com>` is either valid or not._x000D_
2. It might require IDN to be validated._x000D_
3. It might contain a name to be validated._x000D_
_x000D_
Each email is then tested against all scenarios:_x000D_
1. If we claim it requires IDN, it MUST NOT validate when we haven't enabled IDN._x000D_
2. If we claim it contains a name it MUST NOT validate when names are not allowed._x000D_
_x000D_
The tests currently fail for several reasons:_x000D_
1. I've added an error case that identifies the original issue causing this PR (expected)._x000D_
2. It seems some email addresses are not properly validate while they should be._x000D_
_x000D_
Specifically:_x000D_
`example@xn--zcack7ayc9a.de`, as far as I can tell, this is a valid email address that does not require IDN and does not contain a name. _x000D_
`после-преобразования-в-idn-тут-будет-больше-чем-64-символа@пример.com`, as far as I can tell, is a valid email address that requires IDN and does not have a name._x000D_
_x000D_
I have validated both email addresses via this tool https://verifalia.com/validate-email, which agrees that both email addresses are syntactically valid._x000D_
Note that the second one is valid, but then fails due to extended, ISP specific, validation. _x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #15947 _x000D_

title: Fix UniqueValidator for PostgreSQL
author: lav45
body:
Checks the uniqueness of keys in `jsonb` field._x000D_
_x000D_
This add-on allows you to use special characters `[[` , `]]` in the `targetAttribute` settings_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class News extends ActiveRecord_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public function rules()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            [['title'], 'unique',_x000D_
                'targetAttribute' => [_x000D_
                    'title' => "[[data]]->>'title'",_x000D_
                ]_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Callback execution with mutex synchronization
author: zhuravljov
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | no_x000D_
_x000D_
It can be able to execute callback code with mutex synchronization. For example:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$result = $mutex->sync($mutexName, 10, function () {_x000D_
    // business logic execution with synchronization_x000D_
    return $result;_x000D_
}));_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Moved from #15985.

title: fix timezone
author: sashsvamir
body:
In php > 7.0 was removing warning on empty setting `date.timezone`, so now we don't need set this on Application::preInit(), because `date_default_timezone_get()` always return timezone._x000D_
_x000D_
#16065

title: Allows configure `Connection::dsn` by key=>value array
author: leandrogehlen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
This is useful to configure connection by enviroment vars_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
_x000D_
return [_x000D_
    'class' => yii\db\Connection::className(),_x000D_
    'dsn' => [_x000D_
        'driver' => getenv('DB_DRIVER'),_x000D_
        'host' => getenv('DB_HOST') ,_x000D_
        'dbname' => getenv('DB_DATABASE')_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    'username' => getenv('DB_USERNAME'),_x000D_
    'password' => getenv('DB_PASSWORD'),_x000D_
    'charset' => 'utf8',_x000D_
    'enableSchemaCache' => YII_ENV !== 'dev',_x000D_
];_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_

but as we are not running oracle tests on travis it got unnoticed._x000D_

I try to migrate from 2.3 to 2.4 of Codeception and I got some strange errors. _x000D_
_x000D_
For example - if 4 test runs both the last test generate a error. I trace this. And I can see strange behavior: the unserialize of cache table schema will set `\Yii::$app` to `null`._x000D_
_x000D_
Directly past same data to unserizlize don't make any effect... But this is happens. May be this is not a unique case..._x000D_
_x000D_
This PR will propose restore global $app._x000D_

title: How to see Username instead of User_ID in the view, editing a record
author: panoramik2020
body:
Hi,_x000D_
I am using the BlameableBehavior class to have automatically filled in the columns for the date of insertion, modification date, the author of the insertion and the author of change for each record. Everything is ok but I can not replace the user ID with the username in the two columns (one is for insertion and the other for editing). Below is the code_x000D_
_x000D_
in BlameableBehavior.php_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
class BlameableBehavior extends AttributeBehavior_x000D_
{_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @var string the attribute that will receive current user ID value_x000D_
     * Set this property to false if you do not want to record the creator ID._x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public $createdByAttribute = 'created_by';_x000D_
	_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @var string the attribute that will receive current user ID value_x000D_
     * Set this property to false if you do not want to record the updater ID._x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public $updatedByAttribute = 'updated_by';_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * {@inheritdoc}_x000D_
     *_x000D_
     * In case, when the property is `null`, the value of `Yii::$app->user->id` will be used as the value._x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public $value;_x000D_
```_x000D_
	_x000D_
_x000D_
in ModelX.php_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
public function behaviors(){_x000D_
   return [_x000D_
      [_x000D_
         'class' => BlameableBehavior::className(),_x000D_
            'createdByAttribute' => 'created_by',_x000D_
            'updatedByAttribute' => 'updated_by',_x000D_
      ],_x000D_
      'timestamp' => [_x000D_
         'class' => 'yii\behaviors\TimestampBehavior',_x000D_
         'attributes' => [_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_INSERT => ['created_at', 'updated_at'],_x000D_
            ActiveRecord::EVENT_BEFORE_UPDATE => ['updated_at'],_x000D_
         ],_x000D_
      ],_x000D_
   ];_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
How can I declare I want to see the username and not the user ID?_x000D_
_x000D_
tHANKS_x000D_

title: [ENH] introduce yii\behaviors\OptimisticLockBehavior to avoid #9133 bug
author: tunecino
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes/no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #9133_x000D_
_x000D_
This is more of an enhancement than bug fix as the mentioned bug in #9133 really depends on how devloppers did implement optimistic lock, and may still have it, due to the way it was designed. A quick example is this code in `ActiveRecord::deleteInternal()` : _x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    $lock = $this->optimisticLock();_x000D_
    if ($lock !== null) {_x000D_
        $condition[$lock] = $this->$lock;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
    $result = static::deleteAll($condition);_x000D_
    if ($lock !== null && !$result) {_x000D_
        throw new StaleObjectException('The object being deleted is outdated.');_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
That code assumes user have loaded a version number to model's optimistic lock attribute but it is rare to perform `$model->load()` on delete actions, either does the generated code for controllers by gii or built-in REST controllers, so the code is just getting it from database and upgrading without checking if there is a version attribute in user inputs. And there is no easy way to perform a "dirty attribute but equal to what we already have in db" check within ActiveRecord._x000D_
_x000D_
That said, this PR is an enhancement introducing a behavior that when implemented, ensure Optimistic Lock works properly. It parses the version value directly from `Yii::$app->request` as it is usually done with headers.

title: Xml element attributes feature
author: codespede
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
This will allow having attributes for xml elements generated from yii\web\XmlResponseFormatter._x000D_
_x000D_
For having attributes for an XML element, one has to return an array as the value of that element in the following format:_x000D_
_x000D_
`[_x000D_
	'value' => 'value for that element',_x000D_
	'xml-attributes' => [_x000D_
		'attribute-1' => 'value-1',_x000D_
		'attribute-2' => 'value-2',_x000D_
		..._x000D_
		..._x000D_
	]_x000D_
]`_x000D_
_x000D_
For example, if the element returned is 'city', and it needs two attributes 'type' and 'population', the return value for the attribute 'city' should be like:_x000D_
`_x000D_
_x000D_
    return [_x000D_
          'value' => 'New York',_x000D_
          'xml-attributes' => [_x000D_
                  'type' => 'Metropolitan',_x000D_
                  'population' => '10000000'_x000D_
          ]_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
`_x000D_
_x000D_
In the above example, the xml element generated will be like this:_x000D_
`<city type="metropolitan" population="10000000">New York</city>`_x000D_

title: Fix IE11 compatibility mode redirect
author: Alex-Bond
body:
In IE11 when you turn on compatibility mode Yii stops redirecting the user to login page._x000D_
Problem is that accepted types contains ```*/*``` but is positioned as the last type, not first._x000D_
Technically there is 2 option to fix that:_x000D_
1. Proposed change when we just adding ```*/*``` to acceptableRedirectTypes and system will try to find it at any position_x000D_
2. We change L758 and move the ```*/*``` check to separate loop where Yii will check ```*/*``` at any position in the array._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | none_x000D_

title: Xml element attributes feature
author: codespede
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
This will allow having attributes for xml elements generated from yii\web\XmlResponseFormatter._x000D_
_x000D_
For having attributes for an XML element, one has to return an array as the value of that element in the following format:_x000D_
_x000D_
`[_x000D_
	'value' => 'value for that element',_x000D_
	'xml-attributes' => [_x000D_
		'attribute-1' => 'value-1',_x000D_
		'attribute-2' => 'value-2',_x000D_
		..._x000D_
		..._x000D_
	]_x000D_
]`_x000D_
_x000D_
For example, if the element returned is 'city', and it needs two attributes 'type' and 'population', the return value for the attribute 'city' should be like:_x000D_
`_x000D_
_x000D_
    return [_x000D_
          'value' => 'New York',_x000D_
          'xml-attributes' => [_x000D_
                  'type' => 'Metropolitan',_x000D_
                  'population' => '10000000'_x000D_
          ]_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
`_x000D_
_x000D_
In the above example, the xml element generated will be like this:_x000D_
`<city type="metropolitan" population="10000000">New York</city>`_x000D_

title: Fixed #16104 bug: use schema name from table path in PostgreSQL QueryBuilder::dropIndex()
author: wapmorgan
body:
Fixed PostgreSQL `QueryBuilder::dropIndex()` if index is used in non-default schema, e.g:_x000D_
There's an index `idx_news_id` in table `site.news`._x000D_
_x000D_
## Current behavior_x000D_
_x000D_
Now in **master**:_x000D_
```php_x000D_
News::getDb()->getQueryBuilder()->dropIndex('idx_news_id', 'site.news')_x000D_
```_x000D_
will generate_x000D_
```sql_x000D_
DROP INDEX "idx_news_id"_x000D_
```_x000D_
which fails._x000D_
_x000D_
## After applying this PR_x000D_
The same code will generate right query:_x000D_
```sql_x000D_
DROP INDEX "site"."idx_news_id"_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
**Note**: if schema is already defined in index name (e.g. **site.idx_news_id**), then no modifications will be performed._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: Ability to customize database query if condition is true
author: mg-code
body:
Sometimes it is necessary to customize query if some condition is true._x000D_
_x000D_
Now you can do this by using this function:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$model = Product::find()_x000D_
    ->when(\Yii::$app->user->identity, function (Query $query, User $user) {_x000D_
        $query->orderBy($user->getProductOrder());_x000D_
    }_x000D_
    ->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
You can pass additional parameters:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$model = Product::find()_x000D_
    ->when(\Yii::$app->user->identity, function (Query $query, User $user) use ($defaultOrder) {_x000D_
        if ($orderBy = $user->getProductOrder()) {_x000D_
            $query->orderBy($orderBy);_x000D_
        } else {_x000D_
            $query->orderBy($defaultOrder);_x000D_
       }_x000D_
    }_x000D_
    ->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
You can pass callback that will be applied if value is false:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$user = Yii::$app->user->identity;_x000D_
$model = Product::find()_x000D_
    ->when($user ? $user->getProductOrder() : false, function (Query $query, $productOrder) {_x000D_
          $query->orderBy($productOrder);_x000D_
    }, function (Query $query) use ($defaultOrder) {_x000D_
          $query->orderBy($defaultOrder);_x000D_
    })_x000D_
    ->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
What is your opinion on this? _x000D_
If everything is ok, I will create tests and changelog entry._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_

title: kB instead of KB
author: diegotibi
body:
When kilobyte is referred to 1000 bytes the abbreviation should be written with lower case "k" as kB. Upper case K is usually intended to refer to 1024 multiplier_x000D_
See this page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kilobyte_x000D_

title: WIP: Active Record attribute getters and setters
author: armpogart
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | https://github.com/yiisoft/active-record/issues/4_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR is still work in progress. I will remove `WIP` when PR is final._x000D_
_x000D_
I have several questions to discuss before finishing it:_x000D_
_x000D_
1. Is it better to have `getName`, `setName` or `getNameAttribute` and `setNameAttribute` style getters and setter. I personally like to have simple getters and setters (without any suffix), as it is more intuitive for programmers (they are like usual getters and setters), though I think it can be confusing and may add place for mistakes and difficulty debugging (maybe)._x000D_
2. If you check `setAttribute` setter, you will see it returns the value. Is it better to just set the value there without returning it, as it is just setter, the body will become something like `$this->attributes['name'] = 'something';`. I did with returning value, as it is more intuitive for me that setter mutates the value and returns it, but if we come closer to programming setters, the setter must have `void` type and just do it's job._x000D_
3. I have already mentioned in original issue (and referenced stackoverflow) that `method_exists` has very small performance hit, but I agree that caching would be better anyways. The thing is there can be 2 approaches for caching. Caching getter and setter names (actually storing some map, that there is getter and/or setter for attribute) and accessing it without doing further `method_exists` checks or the second method would be to cache only setters and for getters to cache actual value returned by it. It will also save on any calculations done in getter, but it has one downside. If we consider getter simply mutator for the specific attribute (I mean getter is working only with that attribute value), it will work ok. but if the getter is calculating final value based on other attributes we can have stale cache when other attribute changes between 2 calls to getter._x000D_
4. Do I need to add any docs? Are we doing docs for 3.0 already?_x000D_
_x000D_
Thanks for your attention._x000D_

title: added pdo class feature
author: Ragazzo
body:
This is a port of Yii1 feature https://github.com/yiisoft/yii/blob/master/framework/db/CDbConnection.php#L251. This will also enable such features like custom `pdoClass` with nested transaction (it is commonly used in Yii1) https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/1645.  
I also removed check for those three drivers and added a comment to `pdoClass` property about it, because of if this check will be for those db there will be no custom pdo class support as you can see.

title: Add support for setting charset via connection property
author: SamMousa
body:
Currently there's 2 methods of setting the character set of a database connection:_x000D_
  - via the DSN_x000D_
  - via `$charset` property_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR allows everyone to always use the `$charset` property._x000D_
It is fully backwards compatible._x000D_
_x000D_

body:
It's not only possible, but quite normal, that an action loads more than one data model. Using the singular, suggesting that it (necessarily or typically) loads only one model, is confusing._x000D_
_x000D_
You may want to consider these alternatives:_x000D_
- "The action loads zero or more data models"_x000D_
- "The action optionally loads one or more data models"_x000D_
_x000D_

title: `BaseDataProvider::getModels()` add `$forcePrepare` param.
author: hubeiwei
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | yes_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$array = [_x000D_
    [_x000D_
        'user_id' => 1,_x000D_
        'math' => 90,_x000D_
        'physical' => 80,_x000D_
        'biological' => 70,_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    [_x000D_
        'user_id' => 2,_x000D_
        'math' => 70,_x000D_
        'physical' => 80,_x000D_
        'biological' => 90,_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
    [_x000D_
        'user_id' => 3,_x000D_
        'math' => 80,_x000D_
        'physical' => 90,_x000D_
        'biological' => 80,_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
];_x000D_
_x000D_
$dataProvider = new ArrayDataProvider([_x000D_
    'allModels' => $array,_x000D_
    'sort' => [_x000D_
        'attributes' => [_x000D_
            'math',_x000D_
            'physical',_x000D_
            'biological',_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
before:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$sort = $dataProvider->getSort();_x000D_
_x000D_
$sort->setAttributeOrders(['math' => SORT_DESC], false);_x000D_
$dataProvider->prepare(true);_x000D_
$math = $dataProvider->getModels();_x000D_
_x000D_
$sort->setAttributeOrders(['physical' => SORT_DESC], false);_x000D_
$dataProvider->prepare(true);_x000D_
$physical = $dataProvider->getModels();_x000D_
_x000D_
$sort->setAttributeOrders(['biological' => SORT_DESC], false);_x000D_
$dataProvider->prepare(true);_x000D_
$biological = $dataProvider->getModels();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
after:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$sort = $dataProvider->getSort();_x000D_
_x000D_
$sort->setAttributeOrders(['math' => SORT_DESC], false);_x000D_
$math = $dataProvider->getModels(true);_x000D_
_x000D_
$sort->setAttributeOrders(['physical' => SORT_DESC], false);_x000D_
$physical = $dataProvider->getModels(true);_x000D_
_x000D_
$sort->setAttributeOrders(['biological' => SORT_DESC], false);_x000D_
$biological = $dataProvider->getModels(true);_x000D_
```

title: Proposal for #46: Implementation of Image helper based on Imagine library
author: tonydspaniard
body:
Closes #46 

Implements common used methods for Image manipulation: 
- crop  
  `Yii::$app->image->crop('/path/to/image.jpg', 200, 200, 720, 450);`
- thumb (keeping aspect ratio)  
  `Yii::$app->image->thumb('/path/to/image.jpg',120, 120);`
- text  
  `Yii::$app->image->text('/path/to/image.jpg', 'Yii-2 Image', ['font' => 'path/to/font.otf', 'size' => 12, 'color' =>'000']);`
- watermark  
  `Yii::$app->image->crop('/path/to/image.jpg', /path/to/watermark.jpg' );`
- frame  
  `Yii::$app->image->frame('/path/to/image.jpg', 5 );`

It uses Imagine library. It also contains a method to access Imagine methods  directly (ie when used for simple image manipulations): 

```
Yii::$app->image->getImagine()
   ->open('/path/to/image.jpg')
   ->save('/path/to/image.jpg', array('quality' => 50));
```

Edit: This extension is on WIP, methods are proven to work, if accepted. Then will write the tests

title: Facility for DataProvider-oriented custom template rendering through REST APIs
author: codespede
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
Facility for DataProvider-oriented custom template rendering through REST which features the following:_x000D_
- Pagination Headers will be present in the Response Headers just as how it will be present when returning a DataProvider - which helps the client to navigate through the pages._x000D_
- Allows pagination, sorting, filtering and all other operations supported by DataProvider._x000D_
_x000D_
### Use Cases_x000D_
 - Suppose they want to deliver the data in CSV like below:_x000D_
```_x000D_
title,image,content_x000D_
ABC,abc.jpg,Content of ABC_x000D_
MNO,mno.jpg,Content of MNO_x000D_
XYZ,xyz.jpg,Content of XYZ_x000D_
```_x000D_
 - Suppose one has to render the API response in a specific format like below:_x000D_
```_x000D_
-begin-_x000D_
--title=ABC_x000D_
--image=abc.jpg_x000D_
--content=Content of ABC_x000D_
---_x000D_
--title=MNO_x000D_
--image=mno.jpg_x000D_
--content=Content of MNO_x000D_
---_x000D_
--title=XYZ_x000D_
--image=xyz.jpg_x000D_
--content=Content of XYZ_x000D_
-end-_x000D_
```_x000D_
 - Or in any situation where the user has to deliver custom formatted data through the API._x000D_
_x000D_
In all the above cases, the data can be paginated, sorted and filtered._x000D_
_x000D_
One can use this by simply returning the TemplateRenderer object as shown in the below code:_x000D_
```_x000D_
public function actionTest(){_x000D_
    $dataProvider = new ActiveDataProvider(['query' => Model::find()->where($condition)])_x000D_
    return new \yii\rest\TemplateRenderer([_x000D_
            'dataProvider' => $dataProvider,_x000D_
            'parentView' => '/path/to/parent-view', //path to the parent or wrapper view file_x000D_
            'itemView' => '/path/to/item-view', //path to the item view file_x000D_
        ]);_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: Add CONTRIBUTING.md with workflow
author: suralc
body:
https://github.com/blog/1184-contributing-guidelines

I just copied the content of the workflow document for now and changed the unaviable links (http ://github,com/github/git-reference/issues/71).

While links to the corresponding pages are in the readme, they might be overlooked, if one does not want to drive into core development and just opens a pull-request or an issue. I'm not sure that the document in it's current form is ideal as it would appear on pull-requests _and_ issues. Having some short description as [symfony](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) or the structure [zf2](https://github.com/zendframework/zf2/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) uses might be better suited.

However, if directions should be more exact. We could create some wiki-articles for different scenarios (writing documentation using GitHub for Windows, the WebInterface, PhpStorm, MarkPad, or doing small fixes etc.).

Tbh.: I dislike gifs, but I created this 7 months ago, if this could be usefull I'd rework and extend it to a series of wiki entries.
https://github.com/suralc/yii2/wiki/Contribute:-Small-and-Doc-fixes

**For example:**_x000D_

```php_x000D_
$result = (new \yii\db\Query())->select(new \yii\db\Expression("question, avg(assessment_value) `avg`, DATE(assessment_created_at) `date`"))_x000D_
    ->from('assessment')_x000D_
    ->groupBy(['date', 'question'])_x000D_
    ->indexBy('date')->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
_result:__x000D_
26 rows returned, but_x000D_
![2018-10-10_10-20-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12899080/46719253-1d06eb00-cc76-11e8-957a-5f69f2754469.png)_x000D_
_x000D_
--------_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$result = (new \yii\db\Query())->select(new \yii\db\Expression("question, avg(assessment_value) `avg`, DATE(assessment_created_at) `date`"))_x000D_
    ->from('assessment')_x000D_
    ->groupBy(['date', 'question'])_x000D_
    ->indexBy('date', true)->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
_result:__x000D_

author: onmotion
body:
allow appendTimestamp to `registerCssFile()` and `registerJsFile()`_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_

_x000D_
```php_x000D_
// will be generated <script src="/js/jquery.js"></script>_x000D_
$view->registerJsFile('/js/jquery.js', ['appendTimestamp' => false]); _x000D_
// will be generated <script src="/js/jquery.js?v=1541056962"></script>_x000D_
$view->registerJsFile('/js/jquery.js', ['depends' => 'yii\web\AssetBundle']); _x000D_
// will be generated <script src="/js/jquery.js"></script>_x000D_
$view->registerJsFile('/js/jquery.js', ['depends' => 'yii\web\AssetBundle']); _x000D_
// will be generated <link href="/css/stub.css?v=1541055635" rel="stylesheet">_x000D_
$view->registerCssFile('/css/stub.css', ['appendTimestamp' => true]); _x000D_
// will be generated <link href="/css/stub.css" rel="stylesheet">_x000D_
$view->registerCssFile('/css/stub.css'); _x000D_
// will be generated <link href="/css/stub.css?v=1541055635" rel="stylesheet">_x000D_
$view->registerCssFile('/css/stub.css', ['depends' => 'yii\web\AssetBundle']); _x000D_
// will be generated <link href="/css/stub.css" rel="stylesheet">_x000D_
$view->registerCssFile('/css/stub.css', ['depends' => 'yii\web\AssetBundle']); _x000D_
_x000D_
```

title: [Bug] MysqlMutexTest and PgsqlMutexTest allows to acquire the same lock multiple times
author: rob006
body: I'm not sure if this is a bug, but it is quite surprising and a little scary that I can acquire the same lock multiple times if I use the same component (and the same DB connection).

title: Increase frequency of lock tries when $timeout is used in FileMutex
author: rob006
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
_x000D_
This changes frequency of lock tries for `FileMutex::acquireLock()` when `$timeout` is provided (and make it configurable). Previously it was once try per second, now it is 20 tries per second. _x000D_
_x000D_
See https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2-queue/pull/244#issuecomment-406853925_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Formatter fallback methods for very big numbers
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #14950_x000D_
_x000D_
This one is tricky and I'm not sure if you want it that way._x000D_
_x000D_
I couldn't find any reliable way to check when normalized value are mispresented because of internal casting, floating point numbers presentation or precision configuration of PHP but my tests show that comparing normalized value to original one as strings gives a pretty good hint that final output may be broken._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately internal casting of very big numbers can't be fixed even with fallback methods since the original value is already corrupted when passed to the method. That is why I've added hint in phpdoc to pass numbers as strings in case of very big ones._x000D_
_x000D_
I've added more tests for other formatters to see if these are subjects to the same issue and yes, `integer`, `percent` and `currency` needed to be fixed as well._x000D_
_x000D_
Strictly `intl` formatters are basically fine except `ordinal` where I've added phpdoc warning for v. big numbers (it should not be used with them anyway).

title: csrf docs added
author: Ragazzo
body:
Added small docs about csrf validation in controller. 
Also @qiangxue i think it would be better if this property also can be an array or we need `$excludeCsrfValidate = []` this array will hold actions that should be excluded from csrf validation of the current request. 
Can be helpful for example for upload action (usually it is standalone `Upload < Action`), anyway currently there is no way to cansell csrf validation per some actions. Can submit PR if needed. Only small modifications here are needed: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/yii/web/Controller.php#L93

_x000D_
Otherwise it is practically impossible to extend this widget._x000D_
_x000D_
I wanted to create a slightly different table rendering, example:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class SimpleTable extends Table_x000D_
{_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @var array table chars_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    protected  $_chars = [_x000D_
        self::CHAR_TOP => '═',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_TOP_MID => '╤',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_TOP_LEFT => '╔',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_TOP_RIGHT => '╗',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_BOTTOM => '═',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_BOTTOM_MID => '╧',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_BOTTOM_LEFT => '╚',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_BOTTOM_RIGHT => '╝',_x000D_
_x000D_
        self::CHAR_LEFT => '>',_x000D_
_x000D_
        self::CHAR_LEFT_MID => '╟',_x000D_
_x000D_
        self::CHAR_MID => null,_x000D_
_x000D_
        self::CHAR_MID_MID => '┼',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_RIGHT => '',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_RIGHT_MID => '╢',_x000D_
        self::CHAR_MIDDLE => '',_x000D_
    ];_x000D_
_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * @return string the rendered simple table_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function run()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $this->calculateRowsSize();_x000D_
        $buffer = '';_x000D_
        // Header_x000D_
        $buffer .= $this->renderRow($this->_headers,_x000D_
            $this->_chars[self::CHAR_LEFT],_x000D_
            $this->_chars[self::CHAR_MIDDLE],_x000D_
            $this->_chars[self::CHAR_RIGHT]_x000D_
        );_x000D_
_x000D_
        // Content_x000D_
        foreach ($this->_rows as $row) {_x000D_
            $buffer .= $this->renderRow($row,_x000D_
                $this->_chars[self::CHAR_LEFT],_x000D_
                $this->_chars[self::CHAR_MIDDLE],_x000D_
                $this->_chars[self::CHAR_RIGHT]);_x000D_
        }_x000D_
_x000D_
        return $buffer;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```

title: Update Request.php (add file methods)
author: gozoro
body:
Add methods Request::file($name) and Request::files($name)._x000D_
input[type=text] and input[type=file] it's one request._x000D_
The request object must have a methods to retrieve the uploaded files._x000D_
_x000D_
This is ugly code:_x000D_
$form->attributes = Yii::$app->request->post();_x000D_
$form->file           = UploadedFile::getInstance($form, 'file');_x000D_
_x000D_
This is a beautiful code:_x000D_
$form->attributes = Yii::$app->request->post();_x000D_
$form->file           = Yii::$app->request->file('file');_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fixes CommandTest::testCreateView() cleanup logic
author: rugabarbo
body:
View must be deleted before deleting the tables on which it depends, otherwise we will get errors when rerunning the tests in the same environment._x000D_
_x000D_
For example:_x000D_
```_x000D_
1) yiiunit\framework\db\mysql\CommandTest::testCreateView_x000D_
yii\db\Exception: SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1356 View 'yii2_test.testCreateView' references invalid table(s) or column(s) or function(s) or definer/invoker of view lack rights to use them_x000D_
The SQL being executed was: SHOW FULL COLUMNS FROM `testCreateView`_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
