title: Fix of Oracle tests for proper skipping
author: rugabarbo
body:
PHPUnit must get the data that will be passed to the tests, before executing them. That's why you can't prevent the dataProvider to be executed using `$this->markTestSkipped()` inside a test. Instead, you must use a skipping inside data provider when the test cannot be executed._x000D_
_x000D_
Now Oracle tests are skipped without fails when Oracle isn't installed:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$ vendor/bin/phpunit --filter=BuildLikeCondition --group=oci --verbose_x000D_
_x000D_
..._x000D_
_x000D_
There was 1 skipped test:_x000D_
_x000D_
1) yiiunit\framework\db\oci\QueryBuilderTest::testBuildLikeCondition_x000D_
Test for yiiunit\framework\db\oci\QueryBuilderTest::testBuildLikeCondition skipped by data provider_x000D_
Could not execute Connection::quoteValue() method: Connection::dsn cannot be empty._x000D_
```

title: added multi array feature
author: Ragazzo
body:
Added multi array feature for getValue. Now you can do this:

``` php
$search = ['0'=>1, 'something' => 2,3,4,'first' => ['second' => ['third' => 'fourth']]];
var_dump(ArrayHelper::getValue($search, 'first.second.third.fourth', 'nothing'));
var_dump(ArrayHelper::getValue($search, 'first.second', 'nothing'));
var_dump(ArrayHelper::getValue($model, 'profile.last_name', 'nothing object'));
```

output

```
"nothing" 
array(1) { ["third"]=> "fourth" } 
"last_name_1"
```

Also works with gridview as:

``` php
    <?php echo GridView::widget([
        'dataProvider' => $dataProvider,
        'filterModel' => $searchModel,
        'columns' => [
            ['class' => 'yii\grid\SerialColumn'],

            'id',
            'login',

            ['class' => 'yii\grid\ActionColumn'],
            'profile.last_name',
        ],
    ]); ?>
```

title: allow to add event listeners to a pjax widget
author: albertborsos
body:
allow to add pjax event listeners to a widget via Pjax::clientEvents property_x000D_ _x000D_ | Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? |no_x000D_ | New feature? | yes_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | no_x000D_ | Tests pass? | yes/no_x000D_ | Fixed issues | comma-separated list of tickets # fixed by the PR, if any_x000D_ _x000D_ based on this ticket: https://github.com/albertborsos/yii2-pjax/issues/2_x000D_ _x000D_ With this feature it is possible to easily update menu items after a pjax requests._x000D_ _x000D_ In my app there is a menu:_x000D_ _x000D_ ```php_x000D_ 'menu-sidebar',_x000D_ 'linkSelector' => false,_x000D_ 'clientEvents' => [_x000D_ 'pjax:end' => new \yii\web\JsExpression("function() { $('.sidebar-menu').tree() }"),_x000D_ ],_x000D_ ]); ?>_x000D_ [_x000D_ // items_x000D_ ],_x000D_ ])?>_x000D_ _x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ and the content, which updates menu items on `pjax:end` (and shows a loading overlay on `pjax:start` )_x000D_ _x000D_ ```php_x000D_ 'summary',_x000D_ 'clientEvents' => [_x000D_ 'pjax:success' => new \yii\web\JsExpression("function () { $.pjax.reload({container: '#menu-sidebar', timeout: 10000}); }"),_x000D_ 'pjax:start' => new \yii\web\JsExpression("function() { window.spinner.formSpinnerOverlay('#summary .box'); }"),_x000D_ ],_x000D_ ]); ?>_x000D_
_x000D_ $tabItems,_x000D_ ]) ?>_x000D_
_x000D_ _x000D_ ```_x000D_

title: Fixed random fails of RetryAcquireTraitTest
author: rugabarbo
body:
Property `RetryAcquireTrait::$retryDelay` sets the minimum delay, but not the exact delay. In fact, delay may be longer. Because of this, sometimes less than 20 blocking attempts occur. Checking the exact number of locks sometimes leads to the following errors:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$ vendor/bin/phpunit --filter=testRetryAcquire_x000D_
PHPUnit 4.8.34 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors._x000D_
_x000D_
F_x000D_
_x000D_
You should really fix these slow tests (>500ms)..._x000D_
 1. 1050ms to run yiiunit\framework\mutex\RetryAcquireTraitTest:testRetryAcquire_x000D_
_x000D_
Time: 4.08 seconds, Memory: 44.00MB_x000D_
_x000D_
There was 1 failure:_x000D_
_x000D_
1) yiiunit\framework\mutex\RetryAcquireTraitTest::testRetryAcquire_x000D_
Failed asserting that 19 is identical to 20._x000D_
_x000D_
/yii2/tests/framework/mutex/RetryAcquireTraitTest.php:36_x000D_
/yii2/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit:52_x000D_
_x000D_
FAILURES!_x000D_
Tests: 1, Assertions: 3, Failures: 1._x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I reworked the test so that it checks duration of delays, but not the exact number of blocking attempts.

After ensureBehaviors() call $this->_behaviors is an array already.

title: Fixes #15167: fixed loading of default value `current_timestamp()` for MariaDB >= 10.2.3
author: rugabarbo
body:
When displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS table, a default CURRENT TIMESTAMP is displayed as `CURRENT_TIMESTAMP` up until MariaDB 10.2.2, and as `current_timestamp()` from MariaDB 10.2.3._x000D_
_x000D_
See details here: https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/now/#description_x000D_
_x000D_
Related PRs:_x000D_
* closes #16408_x000D_
* closes #16933_x000D_

title: Actualize phpunit usage approach
author: creocoder
body:
1) Yii 2 unit tests is not working with `phpunit.phar`
2) Since we are composer guys its better to have `phpunit` under `require-dev` section as recommended at http://phpunit.de/manual/3.7/en/installation.html
3) PEAR is dead a long time ago

After merge there is two ways to run tests:

1) Download `phpunit.phar` and run it
2) `composer update` and run `./vendor/bin/phpunit`

title: optimize performance SQL-query (IN) with composite keys
author: pvsaintpe
body: @samdark, Hi!_x000D_ _x000D_ On large tables, there are serious problems with the performance of a SQL query, since indexes are not used in the construction_x000D_ ```SQL_x000D_ WHERE (`a`,` b`, ..) IN ((1, 2, ..), (3, 2, ..), ..)_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ Below I present the evidence and tests on a small database in 130 thousand lines._x000D_ _x000D_ Please consider and download this pool request in yii2 (2.0.15.1) at least, since I do not want to fence bicycles and redefine your native traits._x000D_ _x000D_ SchemaTable (indexes):_x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ My relation code in model:_x000D_ ```PHP_x000D_ /**_x000D_ * @return \common\models\query\ContractStepQuery|\yii\db\ActiveQuery_x000D_ */_x000D_ public function getLastContractStep()_x000D_ {_x000D_ return $this->hasOne(ContractStep::class, [_x000D_ 'contract_id' => 'id',_x000D_ 'number' => 'number_steps'_x000D_ ]);_x000D_ }_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ generated SQL (with your ActiveRelationTrait):_x000D_ ```SQL_x000D_ SELECT * FROM `contract_step` `lastContractStep` WHERE (`contract_id`, `number`) IN (('74548', 2), ('74432', 4), ('74575', 2), ('74490', 3), ('74545', 4), ('74607', 3), ('74544', 2), ('74463', 4), ('74543', 3), ('74542', 5), ('74516', 4), ('74485', 5), ('74465', 5), ('74572', 3), ('74606', 2), ('74581', 5), ('74547', 4), ('74583', 3), ('74464', 4), ('74604', 4))_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ Explain:_x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ Execution Time (on 130k rows in table):_x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ Execution Time (on 2.5m rows in table): 2.6 sec_x000D_ _x000D_ After my changes in ActiveRelationTrait...._x000D_ _x000D_ generated SQL:_x000D_ ```SQL_x000D_ SELECT * FROM `contract_step` `lastContractStep` WHERE ((`contract_id`='115199') AND (`number`=5)) OR ((`contract_id`='115198') AND (`number`=5)) OR ((`contract_id`='115193') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115192') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115191') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115190') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115189') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115187') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115186') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115185') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115183') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115182') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115181') AND (`number`=1)) OR ((`contract_id`='115165') AND (`number`=5)) OR ((`contract_id`='115124') AND (`number`=5)) OR ((`contract_id`='115123') AND (`number`=3)) OR ((`contract_id`='115122') AND (`number`=3)) OR ((`contract_id`='115121') AND (`number`=3)) OR ((`contract_id`='115120') AND (`number`=3)) OR ((`contract_id`='115107') AND (`number`=1))_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ Explain:_x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ in my version, indexes are already used (PRIMARY), due to which maximum performance is achieved._x000D_ _x000D_ Execution time (on 130к rows):_x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ Execution time (on 2.5m rows): 0.0007 - 0.0010 (stable time!!!)_x000D_ _x000D_ Please consider this situation and comment on why you made such a decision in the implementation. If my argument is not enough, please contact me._x000D_ _x000D_ | Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? | yes_x000D_ | New feature? | no_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | no_x000D_ | Tests pass? | yes

title: Issue #12182 support context for translations `Yii::t`
author: FilipBenco
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | no_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | yes_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | https://github.com/yiisoft/i18n/issues/4 (it was moved form yii2 before I was able to finish it.. :/ )_x000D_
_x000D_
THIS IS DRAFTED PULL REQUEST. Please look at this, and tell mi four opinion, or what I should improve. I would be very happy, if this feature became part of Yii framework. Thanks!_x000D_
_x000D_
Message command is able to extract message context from `Yii:t()` calls containing `/* */` comments. To allow message context extraction, you need to set `extractContext` paramter to `true`._x000D_
_x000D_
After integrating this into Yii2, I will then port this also to upcoming Yii3._x000D_
_x000D_
## Reasoning_x000D_
Our applications run in multiple markets and thus have to support multiple languages. Currently it is quite impossible, to just use extract command and send generated files to our translators, because the have no knowledge, where and how is some message used in our application. Mainly if for one English sentence there might be multiple Slovak translations, depending on context and vice versa. _x000D_
Also, translators have no idea, in which format or what kind of values can have parameters, used in messages._x000D_
Much deeper discussion about this topic can be found here: [yiisoft/yii-core/issues/70](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii-core/issues/70)_x000D_
_x000D_
## Goal & Inspirations_x000D_
To be able to add some context to translation messages, that can be used also in external localisation management tools like [Crowdin](https://crowdin.com/)._x000D_
Similar approach is used for example in wordpress: https://codex.wordpress.org/I18n_for_WordPress_Developers_x000D_
_x000D_
## Features_x000D_
- Extract context for messages and params_x000D_
- Locate file, from which was context for given message extracted. In case, message is used in multiple files, all files with given context are located and context is extracted._x000D_
_x000D_
## Context extraction_x000D_
### Main Message context_x000D_
Message description should be specified as comment `/* */`, be inside `Yii::t()` call and follow directly after message and before params._x000D_
`Yii:t('category', 'message' /* mesasge description */)`_x000D_
`Yii:t('category', 'message with {param}' /* mesasge description */, ['param' => 'parameter'])`_x000D_
_x000D_
### Message Parameter context_x000D_
Parameter description should be specified as comment `/* */`, be inside `Yii::t()` call._x000D_
For named parameters, it should follow directly after parameter name (key)._x000D_
`Yii:t('category', 'message with {param}', ['param' /* param description */ => $param])`_x000D_
For unnamed parameters, it should be before parameter value:_x000D_
`Yii:t('category', 'message with {0}', [/* param description */ $param])`_x000D_
_x000D_
## How extracted context is saved_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php // views/site/index.php_x000D_
echo Yii:t(_x000D_
    'category',_x000D_
    'message with {param} and {anotherParam}' /* message description */,_x000D_
    ['param' /* parameter description */ => $value, 'anotherParam' => $anotherValue]_x000D_
);_x000D_
```_x000D_
### PHPMessageSource_x000D_
Result is saved normally into `category.php` message file. Context is saved in comments above extracted message. _x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php // messages/en_US/category.php_x000D_
return [_x000D_
/**_x000D_
 * @file views/site/index.php_x000D_
 * @description message description_x000D_
 * @param {param} parameter description_x000D_
 * @param {anotherParam}_x000D_
 */_x000D_
'message with {param} and {anotherParam}'  => ''_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
### POMessageSource_x000D_
Result is saved in PO file. Context is saved in `#.` gettext paramters, which refers to extracted comments and `#:` which refers to message reference. For more info about PO file format: [PO Format manual](https://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/manual/html_node/PO-Files.html)_x000D_
```gettext_x000D_
#: views/site/index.php_x000D_
#. message description_x000D_
#. {param} parameter description_x000D_
#. {anotherParam}_x000D_
msgctxt "category"_x000D_
msgid "message with {param} and {anotherParam}"_x000D_
msgstr ""_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
### DBMessageSource_x000D_
not yet implemented. I think, I will store it in custom table, containing context for each occurrence of some message, but I am open to discussion.

title: modified tests, improved configuration, introduced aspect
author: Ragazzo
body:
I improved current testing support by adding `AspectMock` and `Specify`. What benefits we get:
1. `AspectMock` allows us to mock directly to the class. Great ability. Can be compared to mockery but it uses class aliases and can cause fatal error when same name class will be included.
2. `Specify` syntax sugar that adds good readability. Also it is a best practice to structure in blocks your assertions, so they will be easy to read and understand.

This two repos are maintained by @DavertMik so we will get support from him i think. Also you can review and see by yourself that tests are easy to use/read/understand.

I made some `_bootstrap.php` modifications because of AspectMock should be initialized before Yii, and load it internally.

title: PHP 7.2 compatibility fix
author: evilito
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | no_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #16317, kartik-v/yii2-grid#800_x000D_
_x000D_
Fixes the issue when a dataProvider has no data as a parameter for a GridView. PHP 7.2 would throw a warning: _x000D_
_x000D_
> count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable_x000D_
_x000D_
Documentation for the function can be [found here](https://www.yiiframework.com/doc/api/2.0/yii-data-basedataprovider#prepareTotalCount()-detail)._x000D_
_x000D_
If it is expected to return an integer, then the value 0 is returned if `$this->allModels` is not an array._x000D_
_x000D_
This has been addressed before on several locations, see issue #14489.

I suggest to introduce format into fixture data:_x000D_
```['ActiveRecordModelName', 'ForeignModelDataAlias', 'ModelProperty']```_x000D_
_x000D_
It will be beneficial to get foreign data from dependent fixtures, especially the generated data like id, updated_at etc._x000D_
_x000D_
Example of use:_x000D_
```['app\models\User', 'disabled_user', 'id']```_x000D_
_x000D_
It was made to work, so feedback is welcome._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately it is not possible to implement such feature without changes in Yii2 itself._x000D_

title: Activating Open Collective
author: monkeywithacupcake
body:
Hi, I'm making updates for Open Collective. Either you or a supporter signed this repo up for Open Collective. This pull request adds backers and sponsors from your Open Collective https://opencollective.com/yii2 ❤️
  
  It adds two badges at the top to show the latest number of backers and sponsors. It also adds placeholders so that the avatar/logo of new backers/sponsors can automatically be shown without having to update your README.md. [[more info](https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective/wiki/Github-banner)]. See how it looks on [this repo](https://github.com/apex/apex#backers).
We have also added a `postinstall` script to let people know after `npm|yarn install` that you are welcoming donations (optional). [[More info](https://github.com/OpenCollective/opencollective-cli)]
You can also add a "Donate" button to your website and automatically show your backers and sponsors there with our widgets. Have a look here: https://opencollective.com/widgets

  P.S: As with any pull request, feel free to comment or suggest changes. The only thing "required" are the placeholders on the README because we believe it's important to acknowledge the people in your community that are contributing (financially or with code!).

  Thank you for your great contribution to the open source community. You are awesome! 🙌
  And welcome to the open collective community! 😊

  Come chat with us in the #opensource channel on https://slack.opencollective.com - great place to ask questions and share best practices with other open source sustainers!

title: Handle DB session callback custom fields before session closed
author: lubosdz
body:
Attempt to fix #9438, #13740, #15037._x000D_
This fixes error `Unkown: Failed to write session data (user)`._x000D_
Explanation of cause [here](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/9438#issuecomment-469625968)._x000D_
_x000D_
Please review - perhaps somebody might get better idea how to populate fields before closing the session without corrupting the data integrity .. (e.g. if a session variable stored into session field changed between being populated and closing the session). Personally I am not happy with this commit, but so far haven't found better solution :-|

title: Amends the yii module to prevent modules from double initialization, and adds the opportunity to set names for the target directories of asset bundles meant to be published
author: webactivist
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | yes_x000D_
| New feature?  | yes_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | no_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | no_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
The root yii module has been corrected a bit to prevent modules from double initialization caused by late initialization of the module itself in the ready method of jQuery when it's possible to get other external scripts initialized before the root script, and later reinitialized during the root module initialization. That could result in various unpredictable errors._x000D_
_x000D_
I found convenient to have the opportunity to define meaningful names for target directories of asset bundles intended to be published.

title: Improve performance of select() and addSelect()
author: brandonkelly
body: We just profiled a 25.8s request with Blackfire, and found that 11.5s / 44.5% was spent on `yii\db\Query::getUniqueColumns()` (called by `select()` and `addSelect()`), and its callee, `getUnaliasedColumnsFromSelect()`._x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ [View on Blackfire ➡️](https://blackfire.io/profiles/26b68fc8-ccb8-424c-a9b6-06010fbb06e9/graph?settings%5Bdimension%5D=wt&settings%5Bdisplay%5D=landscape&settings%5BtabPane%5D=nodes&selected=yii%5Cdb%5CQuery%3A%3AgetUniqueColumns%3F34f7364a45ee985db52f3b3a2c668108&callname=main())_x000D_ _x000D_ We rewrote `select()` and `addSelect()` to be more efficient, avoiding `getUniqueColumns()` altogether and ensuring uniqueness by normalizing SELECT columns similar to the way `orderBy()` / `normalizeOrderBy()` works. Now aliases are always normalized into the `['alias' => 'column']` syntax, and even un-aliased _column names_ (excluding expressions, sub-selects, and strings with parentheses) are aliased to themselves (`['column' => 'column']`)._x000D_ _x000D_ The result: `select()` isn’t even showing up on Blackfire’s radar anymore, and `addSelect()` is only taking up 663ms (17.3x faster), bringing the request time down to 14.1s (1.8x faster)._x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ [View on Blackfire ➡️](https://blackfire.io/profiles/62b0108f-2492-406b-8352-a6c8bfd8cc14/graph?settings%5Bdimension%5D=wt&settings%5Bdisplay%5D=landscape&settings%5BtabPane%5D=nodes&selected=craft%5Cdb%5CQuery%3A%3AaddSelect&callname=main())_x000D_ _x000D_ We hope that is a performance improvement worth considering :)_x000D_ _x000D_ | Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? | no_x000D_ | New feature? | no_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | no_x000D_ | Tests pass? | yes

title: Improve quoteColumnName() performance
author: brandonkelly
body:
When profiling a long-running request, we noticed that `yii\db\Connection::quoteColumnName()` was a particularly heavy hitter. By memoizing its results, we were able to take it from 1.77s down to 131ms._x000D_
_x000D_
Here are the Blackfire profiles:_x000D_
_x000D_
[Before ➡️](https://blackfire.io/profiles/26b68fc8-ccb8-424c-a9b6-06010fbb06e9/graph?settings%5Bdimension%5D=wt&settings%5Bdisplay%5D=landscape&settings%5BtabPane%5D=nodes&selected=yii%5Cdb%5CConnection%3A%3AquoteColumnName%3Ff00dc918117e345938b92b556774aea2&callname=main())_x000D_
[After ➡️](https://blackfire.io/profiles/6b945003-0a13-4b57-8625-a87a8640a2f1/graph?settings%5Bdimension%5D=wt&settings%5Bdisplay%5D=landscape&settings%5BtabPane%5D=nodes&selected=yii%5Cdb%5CConnection%3A%3AquoteTableName%3Ff00dc918117e345938b92b556774aea2&callname=main())_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: fix to call static method of an interface defined in DI Container
author: albertborsos
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Context:_x000D_
I use the DI container to use ARs through repositories. Every AR related methods are exists only in the repositories._x000D_
_x000D_
In a form model, i would like to validate a uniqueness of an attribute:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function rules()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            [['name'], 'unique', 'targetClass' => \app\models\mysql\Singer::class, 'targetAttribute' => 'name'],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
But I do not want to burn in the mysql AR class to my rules, so I would like to use the `dataModelClass` interface method of the repository which is in use:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function rules()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            [['name'], 'unique', 'targetClass' => Yii::createObject([SingerRepositoryInterface::class, 'dataModelName']), 'targetAttribute' => 'name'],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Now it is only possible with a hack:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    public function rules()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $repository = \Yii::createObject(SingerRepositoryInterface::class);_x000D_
        $targetClass = call_user_func([get_class($repository), 'dataModelClass']);_x000D_
        return [_x000D_
            [['name'], 'unique', 'targetClass' => $targetClass, 'targetAttribute' => 'name'],_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
But I extended the `BaseYii::createObject()` method, so now it is working as the desired way._x000D_
_x000D_
What do you think?_x000D_

| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
_x000D_
The existing implementation of select queries building has got a flaw. If you are using the distinct() the query may be built incorrectly. For example for Oracle it does not allow to use database hints together with a distinct(), because order are matter._x000D_
_x000D_
Query:_x000D_
```Table::find()->distinct()->select(['t.COLUMN'], '/*+INDEX ("t" I_UK)*/')```_x000D_
built as:_x000D_
```SELECT DISTINCT /*+INDEX ("t" I_UK)*/ "t"."COLUMN" FROM "SCHEMA"."TABLE"```_x000D_
_x000D_
After changes built this query as:_x000D_
```SELECT /*+INDEX ("t" I_UK)*/ DISTINCT "t"."COLUMN" FROM "SCHEMA"."TABLE"```_x000D_

title: MSSQL: fix `i18n_init` migration
author: alexkart
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Fixed `m150207_210500_i18n_init.php` migration for MSSQL as there is no `RESTRICT` constraint in MSSQL. The equivalent is `NO ACTION`._x000D_
Added `\yiiunit\framework\db\mssql\DbMessageSourceTest` for testing this migration._x000D_
_x000D_
Also, changed `batchInsert()` to the `message` table in this test to single inserts as `batchInsert()` incorrectly inserts russian text into the table._x000D_
```sql_x000D_
INSERT INTO [message] ([id], [language], [translation])_x000D_
VALUES (2, 'ru', 'Собака бегает быстро.'),_x000D_
       (5, 'ru', 'На диване {n, plural, =0{нет кошек} =1{лежит одна кошка} one{лежит # кошка} few{лежит # кошки} many{лежит # кошек} other{лежит # кошки}}!')_x000D_
```_x000D_
Strings should be repended with `N`:_x000D_
```sql_x000D_
INSERT INTO [message] ([id], [language], [translation])_x000D_
VALUES (2, 'ru', N'Собака бегает быстро.'),_x000D_
       (5, 'ru', N'На диване {n, plural, =0{нет кошек} =1{лежит одна кошка} one{лежит # кошка} few{лежит # кошки} many{лежит # кошек} other{лежит # кошки}}!')_x000D_
```_x000D_
or maybe use prepared statement. Should be a separate issue.

title: Split Session class into Session and SessionHandler
author: nineinchnick
body:
Resolves #1476 by extracting some methods from Session and derivatives into separate handler classes.

It gives the ability to use an existing class implementing SessionHandlerInterface when it can't be modified to extend the ones provided by Yii.
Also, it's more visible what features does the Yii's Session component provides over a mere handler.

At the same time, the changes are not significant and I don't feel strongly about this. Maybe let it sink in for some time.

Request for comment on:
- should the _owner_ property be left as it is?
- should anything be moved between matching *Session and *SessionHandler classes? I left it as it is to keep the handlers simpler and not to create duplicate code.
- shouldn't DbSession's sessionTable property contain table prefix?

Sorry for no benchmark results.

title: Making migration generator generate namespaced migrations
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #17437 _x000D_
_x000D_
This allows generator to understand camelcased commands._x000D_
_x000D_
1. Namespaced class name is generated according to namespaced format `M<YYMMDDHHMMSS><Name>` where `Name` is camelized version of what is provided for generator._x000D_
2. Table names provided for generator are underscored in migration (so `User` is `user`, `MyData` is `my_data`, and `BOB` is `b_o_b` unless the name is preceded with underscore (for BC) then name case is kept as-is._x000D_
3. If table name should be suffixed with underscore you must use two underscores for generator._x000D_
4. Unintentional change but I don't want to fight it - now you can run generator with any mix of cases and/or underscores separating command words like `create_userTable`, `CreateUsertabLE` and so on. In guide I'm using official format every time._x000D_
5. Guide is updated for this (also PL version is added).

title: fix populates the model with input data
author: aaronlei
body:
When you use load() as follows_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
         $post = Yii::$app->request->post();_x000D_
         $model = new DealerOrder();_x000D_
         $model->load($post,'DealerOrder');//1. Specify formName_x000D_
         $model->load($post);//2. Do not specify formName_x000D_
         $model->load(['DealerOrder'=>$post]);//3. Use form submission in the browser_x000D_
         $model->load($post,'');//4. Give formName an empty string_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
You will find that neither the first nor the second can successfully set properties for the model. The third and fourth styles can successfully set properties for the model._x000D_
_x000D_
After I modified load(), the first and second styles were also supported._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: Added to the basic app, fixed config, added to core commands.

body:
I added to the basic application `console.php` config to avoid unnecessary exception with `fixtures path is not configured right` and added db config (`db` is needed for apply/clear actions), i also added folder `templates` where by default will be hosted templates for `yii2-faker`, so user should not worry how to configure it and everything will be by default for him.
Added fixture to the core commands. Improved some messages and checks.

title: Proposal: do not publish dummy asset bundle
author: onmotion
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
**Proposal:**_x000D_
Change the dummy bundle to a real dummy instance AssetBundle_x000D_
_x000D_
**The reason**_x000D_
If used dynamic initializer in some AssetBundle, for example, to initiate js like so_x000D_
```php_x000D_
// yii\web\AssetBundle _x000D_
public function init()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $this->sourcePath = '@vendor/webcreate/jquery-ias/src';_x000D_
        $this->js = [_x000D_
            'callbacks.js',_x000D_
        ];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
If disable whole assetManager bundles `\Yii::$app->assetManager->bundles = false;` expected in accordance with docs *>>[If a value is false, it means the corresponding asset bundle is disabled and getBundle() should return null.](https://www.yiiframework.com/doc/api/2.0/yii-web-assetmanager#$bundles-detail)* But in this case, **$js** will be overridden and assets will still be registered, therefore. Plus it requires unnecessary resource allocation.

title: Added Yii 3 DI compatibility
author: hiqsol
body:
- Allowed `__class` and `__construct()` in configurations:_x000D_
    - `'__class' => SomeClass::class`_x000D_
    - `'__construct()' => ['ConstructorArg1', 'ConstructorArg2']`_x000D_
- Allowed wider use of `Instance::of()`:_x000D_
    - in definitions: `'SomeInterface' => Instance::of('SomeService')`_x000D_
    - in get: `$container->get(Instance::of('SomeInterface')`_x000D_
- Allowed static call DI definition:_x000D_
    - `'SomeInterface' => [SomeFactory::class, 'createMethod']`_x000D_
- Added more tests_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_

title: Issue 17597 postgresql12
author: batyrmastyr
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_

`CheckConstraint.expression` is database-dependent and it is not used by Yii itself, so breakage should be small._x000D_

Also noticed several places ([1](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/f8611d170d77f8b89f24bd80e7f3b6b2a8947380/tests/framework/db/SchemaTest.php#L129), [2](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/f8611d170d77f8b89f24bd80e7f3b6b2a8947380/tests/framework/db/SchemaTest.php#L150), [3](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/f8611d170d77f8b89f24bd80e7f3b6b2a8947380/tests/framework/rbac/PgSQLManagerCacheTest.php#L30), [4](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/f8611d170d77f8b89f24bd80e7f3b6b2a8947380/tests/framework/rbac/MySQLManagerCacheTest.php#L28)) in database-related test where usage of `FileCache` may lead to falsy failures if you didn't clear cache between test runs.

title: (fix) Widget::getId() generates same identifiers when ajax request
author: zalatov
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
---_x000D_
_x000D_
EN: Widget::getId() generates same identifiers when ajax request, because counter was reset to zero every request. This creates conflicts when JavaScript/jQuery linking to widgets identifiers, bu they already exists on page._x000D_
_x000D_
RU: Widget::getId() генерирует одинаковые идентификаторы при AJAX-запросах, так как при каждом запросе счётчик сбрасывается в ноль. Это создаёт конфликты, когда JavaScript/jQuery завязывается на идентификаторы виджетов, но они уже есть на странице.

title: (fix) BaseFileHelper::createDirectory() now catch Throwable after cat…
author: zalatov
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
---_x000D_
_x000D_
EN:  _x000D_
BaseFileHelper::createDirectory() catching mkdir() error via @ and error_get_last() because when it called via __toString method ErrorHandler marks file exists warning as fatal error and PHP exit._x000D_
_x000D_
RU:_x000D_
BaseFileHelper::createDirectory() ловит ошибки mkdir() через @ и error_get_last(), потому что когда функция вызвана из метода __toString, то ErrorHandler отмечает предупреждение file exists как фатальную ошибку, и PHP завершает работу.

title: Add support for boolean data attributes to Html::renderTagAttributes()
author: brandonkelly
body:
Currently the following produce inconsistent results:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
Html::renderTagAttributes(['data-foo' => true]);_x000D_
// output: ' data-foo'_x000D_
_x000D_
Html::renderTagAttributes(['data' => ['foo' => true]]);_x000D_
// output: ' data-foo="1"'_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR causes boolean `data` sub-keys to be treated the same way top-level boolean keys are treated: `true` will cause the attribute to be added without a value; `false` will prevent the attribute from being added at all._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  |_x000D_

_x000D_
This is a commonly used feature, I found that yii2 is not available, I think it would be helpful to add it._x000D_
_x000D_
### Use case:_x000D_
#### With formatter component_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$intro = Yii::$app->formatter->asText($model->description, ['width' => 20]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
#### With GridView widget_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$widget = GridView::begin([_x000D_
     'dataProvider' => $dataProvider,_x000D_
     'filterModel' => $searchModel,_x000D_
     'columns' => [_x000D_
          ['class' => 'yii\grid\SerialColumn'],_x000D_
          'id',_x000D_
          [_x000D_
               'attribute' => 'title',_x000D_
               'format' => ['text', ['width' => 20]],_x000D_
          ],_x000D_
          [_x000D_
               'attribute' => 'description',_x000D_
               'format' => ['text', ['width' => 40, 'suffixSymbol' => '---']]_x000D_
          ],_x000D_
          'link:url',_x000D_
          'weight',_x000D_
     ],_x000D_
]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fix wrong overriden application core component configuration when uses Yii3 style
author: yus-ham
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
If you overrides core component config using `__class` in it, you may get an error message: `setting unknown prop __class`. It because the config at this time become like this_x000D_
```_x000D_
[_x000D_
  '__class' => 'MyRequest',_x000D_
  'prop1' => '1234',_x000D_
  'class' => 'yii\web\Request',_x000D_
]_x000D_
```

title: Error handler cleaner registration
author: SamMousa
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR allows the error handler (`handleException()`) to be used when the error handler is not registered._x000D_
Currently the error handler works great in a request cycle (because that generally ends after the error handler is called), but causes issues during testing._x000D_
Specifically `handleException()` calling `unregister()` which changes PHPs global state even when it shouldn't._x000D_
_x000D_
This implementation simply stores the registration status and uses that to determine of `register()` / `unregister()` should do something.

title: tests improved, verify added
author: Ragazzo
body:
I improved a little bit tests and introduced `codeception/verify` extension. This extension is just simple wrapper against some very used asserts. The main benefits we get:
1. Increases readability of tests, and writing of it.
2. It is more likely and almost often so, that user first think about specification (to be simple, message that goes first), and only then perform some assertions. So users will not be reading first assertions and only after that reading expectation message.
3. As it simple wrapper over some asserts id does not touch some internal logic or smth. like this, and all phpunit assertions can be used by developers as they want. This is just simple syntax sugar.
4. As you would look into ruby rspec/minitest they do it similar: first goes message, then assertions.

I think it can be merged, because for end-user it is more friendly and readable, so they can start playing around with tests with some fun :)

title: Rectifying wrong instruction
author: melvinroest
body:
Hi guys, I have a very humble contribution for newcomers._x000D_
_x000D_
The text used to say:_x000D_
running the following console command while in the project `web` directory_x000D_
_x000D_
It now says:_x000D_
running the following console command while in the project root directory_x000D_
_x000D_
Why:_x000D_
I tried it, the `web` directory didn't work._x000D_
_x000D_
I'm brand new to yii, so to double check if it was an issue with my environment I asked an expert on it. He stated that the yii command-line tool is in the root directory and that it isn't possible to have a new basic install run in the `web` directory if you `curl`ed it just before. _x000D_
_x000D_
If it is possible to run it with the `web` directory with other installation methods, then both folders should be suggested._x000D_
_x000D_

body:
Proposed fix for "StringValidator fails on integer #13327"_x000D_
_x000D_
Adds a $strict property to StringValidator._x000D_
If true (default) then it validates as it does currently_x000D_
If false, then it will use php's is_scalar to convert any scalar values to strings before the existing validation is applied._x000D_

title: Fix yii\web\UploadedFile::saveAs() failing when error value in $_FILES entry is a string
author: haveyaseen
body:
This fixes a regression introduced in v2.0.32 (#17729)._x000D_
_x000D_
`saveAs()` must not check strict equality as `error` can be a string. It returned early if `error === '0'` instead of the integer `0`._x000D_
_x000D_

title: queryScalar() fix
author: brandonkelly
body:
If an exception ends up getting thrown from `$this->createCommand()` within `Query::queryScalar()`, then the query’s `select`, `orderBy`, `limit`, and `offset` params will never get reverted to their original state. `select` will still be set to `[$selectExpression]`, and the others will be `null`._x000D_
_x000D_
With this PR, any throwables/exceptions that are thrown by `createCommand()` will be caught, and then re-thrown once those params have been reverted to their original state._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_

title: Use `Instance::ensure()` to initialize `UrlManager::$cache`
author: rob006
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ?_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #16721_x000D_
_x000D_
This allows to pass configuration component for `UrlManager::$cache` (like in many other similar cases) so you could create custom cache instance just for `UrlManger` without a need to declare it as global component (see https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/16721#issuecomment-422143911 and https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/16721#issuecomment-422315982)._x000D_
_x000D_
Technically this could be a BC break - previously misconfiguration (for example typo in component name) was silently ignored. Now it will throw an exception if configured cache component cannot be initialized. IMO this is a bugfix - configuration errors should not be hidden in this way, especially in such cases where lack of cache affects performance and it is easy to miss it.

title: fix yii.validation.js trim function for bs4 custom-control fields
author: dicrtarasov
body:
| Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? | ✔️_x000D_ | New feature? | ❌_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | ❌_x000D_ | Tests pass? | ❌_x000D_ | Fixed issues | 17893_x000D_ _x000D_ For BS4 `custom-control` fields, the `id` attribute is placed on parent `div` element, not `input`, where the `trim` function expecting it._x000D_ _x000D_ ```html_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_
_x000D_ ```_x000D_ yii.validation.js trim expect element by `id` is a `input`:_x000D_ ```js_x000D_ trim: function ($form, attribute, options, value) {_x000D_ var $input = $form.find(attribute.input);_x000D_ if ($input.is(':checkbox, :radio')) {_x000D_ return value;_x000D_ ```_x000D_ In the `yii.activeForm.js` this problem is already fixed:_x000D_ ```js_x000D_ var findInput = function ($form, attribute) {_x000D_ var $input = $form.find(attribute.input);_x000D_ if ($input.length && $input[0].tagName.toLowerCase() === 'div') {_x000D_ // checkbox list or radio list_x000D_ return $input.find('input');_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ so, I copied it to `yii.validation.js` also:_x000D_ ```js_x000D_ trim: function ($form, attribute, options, value) {_x000D_ var $input = $form.find(attribute.input);_x000D_ _x000D_ // custom-control field in bs4 has `id` on `div` element (copied from `yii.activeForm:findInput`)_x000D_ if ($input.length && $input[0].tagName.toLowerCase() === 'div') {_x000D_ // checkbox list or radio list_x000D_ $input = $input.find('input');_x000D_ }_x000D_ ```_x000D_

title: Fix for `Command::getRawSql`
author: alex-code
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️/❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
_x000D_
`Expression`s in params are treated as strings and quoted when bound but not quoted in `Command::getRawSql`_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
(new \yii\db\Query)_x000D_
  ->from('my_table')_x000D_
  ->where('NOW() = :now', [':now' => new yii\db\Expression('NOW()')])_x000D_
  ->scalar());_x000D_
```_x000D_
Will actually execute as on MySQL (with quotes)_x000D_
```php_x000D_
SELECT * FROM `my_table` WHERE NOW() = 'NOW()'_x000D_
```_x000D_
The DB query log on the debug toolbar causes a bit of confusion as it reports the query as (without quotes)_x000D_
```php_x000D_
SELECT * FROM `my_table` WHERE NOW() = NOW()_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
This may have BC implications if anyone has used `Command::getRawSql` and `Expression`s in params and isn't expecting the quotes.

title: Fixed yii\web\Response event classes
author: brandonkelly
body:
The event constants in `yii\web\Response` claim to use a `ResponseEvent` class that doesn’t exist. Fixed to reference `yii\base\Event` instead. (Fully qualified class name because there’s no other reference to `yii\base\Event` in that class, so importing it would just end up getting automatically removed by PhpStorm code reformatting.)_x000D_

author: ricardomm85
body:

_x000D_

title: Issues #17941, #13433 Conflicting controller creation (mapped, namespaced and under sub_module)!!! proposed changes
author: djidji01
body:
Here is my proposed final changes on issues #17941, #13433 mentioned above:_x000D_
_x000D_
- The Module::createController method will return [$controller, $actionId, $args] which are already validate for running to gather or false._x000D_
- The Module::createController will be used for both routing and url creation respectively for requested url and designated route if no urlManager rule specified._x000D_
- Named parameter will be prettified in the order declared in the action method and if parameter is required will have to be declared in the route for url creation and in the url for parsing rather than getting them form $_GET._x000D_
- Caching and Performance ??!!_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: Fixed label attributes in BaseHtml
author: zhuravljov
body:
``` php
<?= $form->field($model, '[1]field') ?>
```

This code rendered label tag:

``` html
<label for="model-field">...</label>
```

After fix render:

``` html
<label for="model-1-field">...</label>
```

title: Improve `yii\db\Connection` master and slave failover
author: cebe
body:
no connection attempt was made when all servers are marked as_x000D_
unavailable._x000D_
_x000D_
if server status cache is enabled and no server is available,_x000D_
we now ignore the cache and try to connect anyway._x000D_
_x000D_
This helps to recover from short downtime much quicker._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fixes #17722
author: SamMousa
body:
This draft PR implements action injection inspired by my implementation here: https://github.com/SAM-IT/yii2-magic/blob/master/src/Traits/ActionInjectionTrait.php_x000D_
_x000D_
Since that implementation the core framework has improved action param handling with things like type validation when using scalar type hints in modern PHP versions._x000D_
_x000D_
This is why this implementation uses a different route; it alters the existing parameter iteration and checks for type hints that are NOT built in (thus class type hints)._x000D_
_x000D_
## TODO_x000D_
- [x] Add test for container exceptions, currently there is no exception handling._x000D_
- [x] Add test for optional injection (IE nullable type)._x000D_
_x000D_
## Design decisions_x000D_
1. First try to resolve the variable as a component of the module._x000D_
2. Don't put the injected stuff into `actionParams` (since this is used by the Url helper to create canonicalized URLs)._x000D_
3. Put descriptions of the injections into `\Yii::$app->requestedParams`. _x000D_
_x000D_
### Motivation 1_x000D_
Local-first injection allows us to override configuration for specific modules. It could even be argued that we should not fall back to the DI container at all. The issue I have with the DI container is that it will instantiate any class, even if it has no definition._x000D_
While some of my services live in the DI container (and are defined there) we should in my opinion definitely not promote code like this:_x000D_
```_x000D_
public function actionCreateCar(Car $newCar) {_x000D_
    // Do stuff here_x000D_
    $newCar->save()_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
### Motivation 2_x000D_
Other code than the URL helper might depend on this array, that code might not be able to (securely) handle action params. (For example serializing them could leak DB passwords)_x000D_
_x000D_
### Motivation 3_x000D_
The in the current code base the only thing that uses `\Yii::$app->requestedParams` is the log panel. It tries to serialize this array and using a string description guarantees us that we can actually serialize it (a class containing a closure for example would cause exceptions). Also, when checking the log panel it shows sensible information:_x000D_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/547021/81191482-5bcb6700-8fb9-11ea-9080-1e0072d52382.png)_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ?_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #17722 _x000D_

title: Debug module mail panel
author: 6pblcb
body:
For https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/1667
This PR allows you to view email messages that are saved if 

``` php
public $fileTransport => true
```

You can view all the message parameters except body and attachments.
You can download the *. EML file messages.

During operation, I had a small question, I decided to ask it here and do not include to PR.
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/6ed8d1767cf9d00dc4efae3ee3c52e8c386a9d87/framework/yii/mail/MessageInterface.php#L52
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/6ed8d1767cf9d00dc4efae3ee3c52e8c386a9d87/framework/yii/mail/MessageInterface.php#L84

As indicated in phpdoc these two methods should return a string, but in the implementation
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/41685a2409964add5c17b72e90e62615000d1665/extensions/yii/swiftmailer/Message.php
methods return arrays.

Sincerely!

title: Remove yii\web\Request::getScriptFile() & setScriptFile()
author: brandonkelly
body:
I noticed that `yii\web\Request::getScriptFile()` and `setScriptFile()` were doing the exact same thing as `yii\base\Request`, just in slightly different syntaxes._x000D_
_x000D_
The one notable exception is that `yii\base\Request::setScriptFile()` is parsing the passed-in path for aliases, and validating that the path is a file – which seem like things that `yii\web\Request` would benefit from._x000D_
_x000D_
I do wonder if it would be better for `getScriptFile()` to set `$this->_scriptFile` directly though, rather than going through `setScriptFile()`, to avoid that extra overhead, since `$_SERVER['SCRIPT_FILENAME']` can probably be trusted._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | n/a_x000D_

title: Adding support for custom rule in EachValidator
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | should_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #18051 _x000D_
_x000D_
This changes a bit how the InlineValidator is created in case of model-method-based inline validators. Instead of just passing a method's name now there is an array with an instance of Model in question and the method's name. This works thanks to the fact that `call_user_func` can take such array as first parameter so there should be no BC change._x000D_
_x000D_
Since EachValidator creates a new instance of DynamicModel internally this change allows inline validators defined in the original model to be used._x000D_
_x000D_
I haven't checked all possible drawbacks here. Definitely now method that is inline validator cannot have limited visibility but I haven't checked if it could be the case before this change._x000D_
_x000D_
Please take a look and see if this can be the solution to the issue. If so, I will add changelog.

title: Add deep merge for configuration of definitions
author: bscheshirwork
body:
If I try to use 2 level configuration of class (for example pluginOptions['assumeNearbyYear'])_x000D_
config:_x000D_
```_x000D_
    'container' => [_x000D_
        'definitions' => [_x000D_
            \kartik\date\DatePicker::class => [_x000D_
                'pluginOptions' => [_x000D_
                    'assumeNearbyYear' => true,_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ],_x000D_
    ],_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
usage:_x000D_
```_x000D_
            ->widget(DatePicker::class, [_x000D_
                'pluginOptions' => [_x000D_
                    'autoclose' => true,_x000D_
                    'format' => 'dd.mm.yyyy',_x000D_
                    'todayHighlight' => true,_x000D_
                    'endDate' => '0d',_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                'removeButton' => false,_x000D_
            ]);_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I lose my 2 level configuration params from definitions_x000D_
for _x000D_
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/f2d32fab77393c700b40d872866a62000174f6c9/framework/di/Container.php#L171_x000D_
I have `$definition`_x000D_
```_x000D_
Array_x000D_
(_x000D_
    [pluginOptions] => Array_x000D_
        (_x000D_
            [assumeNearbyYear] => 1_x000D_
        )_x000D_
_x000D_
)_x000D_
```_x000D_
and `$config`_x000D_
```_x000D_
Array_x000D_
(_x000D_
    [pluginOptions] => Array_x000D_
        (_x000D_
            [autoclose] => 1_x000D_
            [format] => dd.mm.yyyy_x000D_
            [todayHighlight] => 1_x000D_
            [endDate] => 0d_x000D_
        )_x000D_
_x000D_
    [removeButton] => _x000D_
    ..._x000D_
```_x000D_
so... array_merge set `pluginOptions` from `config` only, i.e. I have_x000D_
 `$config`_x000D_
```_x000D_
Array_x000D_
(_x000D_
    [pluginOptions] => Array_x000D_
        (_x000D_
            [autoclose] => 1_x000D_
            [format] => dd.mm.yyyy_x000D_
            [todayHighlight] => 1_x000D_
            [endDate] => 0d_x000D_
        )_x000D_
_x000D_
    [removeButton] => _x000D_
    ..._x000D_
```_x000D_
same array after merge_x000D_
_x000D_
I think this behavir is wrong. _x000D_
I think we must use recursive merging:_x000D_
 `$config`_x000D_
```_x000D_
Array_x000D_
(_x000D_
    [pluginOptions] => Array_x000D_
        (_x000D_
            [assumeNearbyYear] => 1_x000D_
            [autoclose] => 1_x000D_
            [format] => dd.mm.yyyy_x000D_
            [todayHighlight] => 1_x000D_
            [endDate] => 0d_x000D_
        )_x000D_
_x000D_
    [removeButton] => _x000D_
    ..._x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fix for PDO_DBLIB (MSSQL).
author: darkdef
body:
Set flag ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON to ON for current connect to DB._x000D_
_x000D_
This flag modifies the behavior of the session to override default nullability of new columns._x000D_
By default, for some versions of dblib + freetds, this flag is off._x000D_
ANSI recommends default behavior - NULL for new fields without default setted null/not null_x000D_
_x000D_

title: master/slave → primary/replica
author: brandonkelly
body: There is a growing call for the tech industry to move away from “master”/“slave” terminology in the interest of inclusion, especially toward the Black community._x000D_ _x000D_ In that spirit, this PR deprecates those terms as they relate to read/write splitting, in favor of “primary” and “replica” – which I’d argue are not just more inclusive terms, but also more semantically correct. (The replica servers are not merely “taking orders” from their “master” server; they are replicating it.)_x000D_ _x000D_ I’ve managed to do this in a non-breaking way, by keeping old master/slave methods around as aliases for the new ones, and adding magic getter/setter methods for the old master/slave properties. I’ve also introduced a couple traits to document the now-deprecated properties, based on https://stackoverflow.com/a/51890536/1688568._x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ _x000D_ | Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? | ❌_x000D_ | New feature? | ❌_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | ❌_x000D_ | Tests pass? | ✔️_x000D_

_x000D_
I checked the problem described in issue #18090 and found that the problem was in rewriting element in `gridEventHandlers` in `yii.gridView.js` file in `initEventHandler` function. _x000D_
Looks like the CheckboxColumn was designed to use only once in one GridView Widget. _x000D_
After a few different tries to fix this issue and not fail a lot of test, I found this solution, with fails inly one JS test. _x000D_
Now all seems to be work good, so I think we need to update *setSelectionColumn method with repeated calls* JS test (line 675 in `yii.gridView.test.js`), because it was designed to work only with one checkbox column. I'm not a big specialist in JS test, so some help needed.

title: master/slave → primary/replica (take 2)
author: brandonkelly
body:
This PR reimplements the changes made in #18102 in a definitely non-breaking way, as suggested by @rob006 (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/18102#issuecomment-643847335)._x000D_
_x000D_
- The old master/slave properties are back, but deprecated._x000D_
- The new primary/replica properties are now implemented by magic getter/setter methods, and documented with `@property` tags._x000D_
- All Yii code is now referencing the deprecated properties/methods, to ensure that any overridden properties/methods are still used._x000D_
_x000D_
You can view the combined changes made by #18102 and this PR here: https://github.com/brandonkelly/yii2/compare/9a3093442c8f7a39d1fa5972b58127266d8504f7...61ead1d890b589db98834205cc92f5b01667c1db_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Add optional param `--silent-exit-on-exception` in `yii\console\Controller`
author: egorrishe
body:
**Example**:_x000D_
- `./tests/bin/yii fixture/load 'notExistedFixture' --interactive=0 --silent-exit-on-exception=0`_x000D_
    - this command will crash with exit code `1`_x000D_
_x000D_
**Backward compatibility** - default behavior remain the same. _x000D_
Next commands are equal, and crash with exit code `0`:_x000D_
- `./tests/bin/yii fixture/load 'notExistedFixture' --interactive=0`_x000D_
- `./tests/bin/yii fixture/load 'notExistedFixture' --interactive=0 --silent-exit-on-exception=1`_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fixed parameters binding for mysql when prepare emulation is off
author: rskrzypczak
body:
The same as here: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/2201bf14e239477b52cfb1f331e0c7b92d98e2cb_x000D_
When PDO::ATTR_EMULATE_PREPARES => false in DB config this uses native preparation which means that you cannot use the same parameter twice._x000D_
_x000D_
It only works when $emulatePrepare = true, but it's usually false, so it doesn't work :)_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Adding optional authorization check
author: saidbakr
body:
An introduction to override the parent class, BaseHtml, of the Html class methods to check authorization of the user, optionally, before evaluate the output. I started with `a()`_x000D_
_x000D_
Usage Example:_x000D_
```_x000D_
<?= Html::a(Yii::t('app', 'Update'), ['update', 'id' => $model->id,], ['class' => 'btn btn-primary', 'userCan' => 'createPlaylist']) ?>_x000D_
        <?= Html::a(Yii::t('app', 'Delete'), ['delete', 'id' => $model->id], [_x000D_
            'class' => 'btn btn-danger',_x000D_
            'data' => [_x000D_
                'confirm' => Yii::t('app', 'Are you sure you want to delete this item?'),_x000D_
                'method' => 'post',_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ]) ?>_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Added Getter for Table Alias
author: dmitriy-malyar89
body:
Adds the flexibility of using aliases._x000D_
Example Query:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public function active()_x000D_
{_x000D_
    return $this->andWhere(['=', "$this->alias.status", 'active']);_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
User::find()->alias('instructor')->active()->all();_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Result:_x000D_
_x000D_
```sql_x000D_
SELECT * FROM user instructor WHERE instructor.status = 'active';_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_

When Hindi translation messages were added via https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/18023/files , below point was not fulfilled _x000D_
_x000D_
Contributing guide: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/internals/translation-workflow.md#framework-messages_x000D_
_x000D_
Point 1:_x000D_
_x000D_
> 1. Check framework/messages/config.php and make sure your language is listed in languages. If not, add your language there (remember to keep the list in alphabetical order). The format of language code should follow IETF language tag spec, for example, ru, zh-CN._x000D_
_x000D_
This PR adds that missing Hindi (hi) language code in message config array._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fix 18210
author: alex-code
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #18210_x000D_
_x000D_
Allow strict comparison for multi select inputs._x000D_
`in_array` does loose checking so can have unexpected results._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$a = ['1.1', '1.10'];_x000D_
_x000D_
foreach ($a as $v) {_x000D_
    var_dump(in_array($v, ['1.1']));_x000D_
}_x000D_
// Returns, `true`, `true`._x000D_
foreach ($a as $v) {_x000D_
    var_dump(in_array($v, ['1.1'], true));_x000D_
}_x000D_
// Returns, `true`, `false`._x000D_
```

title: Respect ini session.use_strict_mode
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️/❌ Only if `Session::openSession()` and/or `Session::writeSession()` are overwritten._x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #18061_x000D_
_x000D_
Implements support for session.use_strict_mode by the Yii2 Session handler._x000D_
When a session is started with a non existing session id a new id will be generated. This imitates the behavior for the `session_set_save_handler` `validate_sid` param (which requires PHP >= 7.0)._x000D_
The session will only be stored under the newly generated id._x000D_
_x000D_
To Do's to fully implement:_x000D_
_x000D_

title: disable pathInfo urldecode to fix #18266
author: dicrtarasov
body:
Fix #18266 _x000D_
_x000D_
Example path:  `/prod/2%2f3`_x000D_
Consists of 2 parts: `prod` and `2/3`_x000D_
_x000D_
Request::resolvePathInfo() doing:_x000D_
``` $pathInfo = urldecode($pathInfo);```_x000D_
that convert pathInfo to `prod/2/3` that is broken and now I have 3 parts in my path instead of 2: `prod`, `2` and `3`,_x000D_
which is not correct._x000D_
Disabling urldecode fix this bug._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | _x000D_
| Tests pass?   | _x000D_
| Fixed issues  | 18266_x000D_

title: fix Request::resolvePathInfo urldecode
author: dicrtarasov
body:
Have slug path: `/prod/2%2F3`_x000D_
which consists of 2 parts: `prod` and `2/3`_x000D_
_x000D_
Request::resolvePathInfo() doing:_x000D_
```$pathInfo = urldecode($pathInfo);```_x000D_
_x000D_
after which path converted into incorrect: `/prod/2/3` _x000D_
and now my slug path consists of 3 parts: `prod`, `2` and `3` instead of 2._x000D_
Removing incorrect `urldecode` of path fix problem._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: fix for non-seekable streams
author: schmunk42
body:
prevents error message `fseek(): stream does not support seeking`_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | should not_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | see CI_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | Issue from Slack "eseperio 1.9.2020"_x000D_
_x000D_
In our case we got streams (images) from AWS S3 which threw the above error._x000D_
We could not determine the underlying reason, but in all cases we need to check if a stream is seekable before calling `fseek()`, this might also apply to other code in the `Response` class._x000D_
_x000D_
CC: @eluhr @handcode

_x000D_
postgresql_x000D_
```_x000D_
create schema test;_x000D_
create type test.my_type as enum('VAl1', 'VAL2', 'VAl3');_x000D_
create table test.test(test_type test.my_type[]) ;_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Yii model_x000D_

class Test extends ActiveRecord_x000D_
{_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * {@inheritDoc}_x000D_
     */_x000D_

    {_x000D_
        return '{{%test.test}}';_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
php test-case_x000D_
```_x000D_
$model = new \app\models\test\Test();_x000D_

title: Fix model validate for unknown attributes.
author: nickeatingsalsage
body:
### How it's a problem_x000D_
_x000D_
Once we had a list of attributes in a defined model: $model._x000D_
```_x000D_
class AnotherModel extends yii\base\Model { # It could be ActiveRecord model too._x000D_
       public $knownProperty_x000D_
       public $anotherKownProperty;_x000D_
      _x000D_
       ## rules and another methods..._x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
$model = new AnotherModel();_x000D_
$model->knownProperty = 'valid value';_x000D_
$model->anotherKownProperty = 'valid value';_x000D_
_x000D_
$model->validate(['not known attribute']) # True, We are validating what? A unknown attribute?_x000D_
$model->validate('not known attribute') # True, We are validating what? A unknown attribute?_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
We could put validate method in a unknown state. Returning true or false based on a not set property._x000D_
_x000D_
### How it's fixed_x000D_
_x000D_
We just have to check every attribute passed as first argument to yii\base\Model validate method and then check if there is a unknown attribute to be validated  throws a InvalidArgumentException to alert the developers to correct the incorrect usage._x000D_
 _x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️ We should not call validate() passing $attributeNames with wrong parameters._x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️It allows the developers to quickly fix the wrong usage of validate() method._x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌ It breaks only the wrong usage of validate() method with wrong attributes name, it throws a InvalidArgumentException so the developer can fix it._x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️ Added two more tests and the previous works just fine._x000D_
| Fixed issues  | It fix misunderstanding of the usage of validate()._x000D_

title: feat(cache): Stopped generating constant directory level
author: githubjeka
body:
As described in #18263 FileCache generate directories with permanent names when using key prefix cache_x000D_

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/874234/96184211-d1f8d000-0f40-11eb-943d-7f65d71760c2.png)_x000D_

This PR removed `\yii\caching\FileCache::$keyPrefix` for result of `\yii\caching\FileCache::getCacheFile()` to avoid generating constant cache directory levels_x000D_

title: Update tutorial-core-validators.md
author: tobiase
body:
The `DefaultValueValidator` works only with closures not with any callable as suggested._x000D_
See https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/f8337a15c2d48951b4e3b34d331e61e2eb784b97/framework/validators/DefaultValueValidator.php#L47_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
    /**_x000D_
     * {@inheritdoc}_x000D_
     */_x000D_
    public function validateAttribute($model, $attribute)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        if ($this->isEmpty($model->$attribute)) {_x000D_
            if ($this->value instanceof \Closure) {_x000D_
                $model->$attribute = call_user_func($this->value, $model, $attribute);_x000D_
            } else {_x000D_
                $model->$attribute = $this->value;_x000D_
            }_x000D_
        }_x000D_
    }_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_

title: Add support for setting Response::$stream to a callable
author: brandonkelly
body:
A Craft customer has a need for streaming data from a controller (craftcms/cms#7148), and I realized there’s no elegant way to do that currently, outside of manually sending the response headers and then echoing/flushing the data out piece by piece, which would bypass the typical response events like `EVENT_BEFORE_SEND`, etc._x000D_
_x000D_
With this PR, it would be possible to set `yii\web\Response::$stream` to a callable, which would be looped through and the results would be echoed/printed one-by-one, within the normal response flow._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$this->response->stream = function() {_x000D_
    for ($i = 1; $i <= 3; $i++) {_x000D_
        yield "$i\n";_x000D_
    }_x000D_
};_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_

author: albertborsos

I tried to use FileMutex, but I realised it checks for acquired lock files in `$_locks` property instead of `$_files` property. Also if jobs runs over, the latter job finds nothing in `$_files` because it is an other process, so I checked for the existing `*.lock` file.

title: Add resetCounter method to BaseDataProvider
author: AlShahawi
body:
This adds the ability to reset the ActiveDataProvider counter while being run in Test Cases._x000D_
_x000D_
Take this test case example_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
    // a lot of test cases that create tens of active data provider instances which increases the $counter property..._x000D_
_x000D_
    public function it_list_orders_sorted_by_its_id_descending(FunctionalTester $I, Scenario $scenario)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        // Here is its usage:_x000D_
        \Yii\Data\ActiveDataProvider::resetCounter();_x000D_
_x000D_
        $I->wantTo('List orders sorted by its id descending');_x000D_
        $I->sendGET('/v1/my-orders-api-endpoint', ['sort' => '-orderId', 'fields' => 'orderId,deliveryDate']);_x000D_
        $I->seeResponseIsJson();_x000D_
        $I->seeResponseCodeIsSuccessful();_x000D_
        $response = Json::decode($I->grabResponse());_x000D_
        // more assertions..._x000D_
    }_x000D_
   _x000D_
    // a lot of test cases that create tens of active data provider instances which increases the $counter property..._x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Without using `resetCounter` we must maintain the `sort` parameter which will end up like `dp-14-sort`._x000D_
_x000D_
**Note** I know there is another solution for this by using Reflection APIs but I think IMO this is more readable and elegant solution.

title: [PoC] Resolving dependencies automatically
author: bizley
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️ (should)_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
Based on the brief discussion at Slack (https://yii.slack.com/archives/C6H833X42/p1606392783295800) here is my PoC to allow DI container to instantiate class-typed dependencies of an object automatically._x000D_
_x000D_
This allows to keep configuration of objects with strings only (class names) and removes the requirement of preconfiguring Container for dependencies (but it's still possible)._x000D_
_x000D_
I have used `mergeDependencies()` to resolve dependency with provided argument because in `resolveDependencies()` it's already too late (original constructor dependency info is lost) so it obviously requires some refactoring (new method maybe, called before `mergeDependencies()`)._x000D_
_x000D_
Let me know what you think.

title: Ability to use separate attributes for data model and filter model of `yii\grid\GridView` in `yii\grid\DataColumn`
author: PowerGamer1
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
In a use case like this: https://www.yiiframework.com/wiki/653/displaying-sorting-and-filtering-model-relations-on-a-gridview it is better to separate the actual "data" model (GridView table is filled with data of this model) from the "filter" model (the one specified in GridView::filterModel and used to setup validation rules for filter inputs)._x000D_
_x000D_
While currently it it possible to specify GridView::filterModel as an object of a class different from "data" model, when GridView renders the filter inputs it assumes that GridView::filterModel will have attributes with same name as the ones specified in DataColumn::attribute which are actually the attributes of "data" model. This leads to workarounds like in the link above where the user has to define DataColumn::attribute with the name from "filter" model and DataColumn::value to render the value of actual "data" model attribute which might have a different name._x000D_
_x000D_
With this PR the user can setup DataColumn::attribute with the attribute from data model (eliminating the need to define DataColumn::value) and setup any attribute name from "filter" model in DataColumn::filterAttribute eliminating the need to ensure that "data" model and related "filter" model attribute have the same name._x000D_
_x000D_
P.S. The doc comment for `DataColumn::filterAttribute` might need adding `@since` version note.

title: Support for rendering objects with ResponseFormatterInterface.
author: edin
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
_x000D_
Adds support for rendering objects that implements ResponseFormatterInterface. For example:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class CustomResponse implements ResponseFormatterInterface_x000D_
{_x000D_
    private string $message;_x000D_
_x000D_
    public function __construct(string $message)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $this->message = $message;_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    public function format($response)_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        $response->setStatusCode(200);_x000D_
        $response->getHeaders()->add("Content-Type", "application/json; charset=UTF-8");_x000D_
        $response->content = \yii\helpers\Json::encode([_x000D_
            'message' => $this->message_x000D_
        ]);_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Then somewhere in controller, it would be possible to:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public function actionHello()_x000D_
{_x000D_
    return new CustomResponse("Hello World");_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: BatchQueryResult reset/finish events
author: brandonkelly
body:
This PR adds new `EVENT_RESET` and `EVENT_FINISH` events to `yii\db\BatchQueryResult`. With these in place, it can be possible to [open a new unbuffered MySQL connection](https://www.yiiframework.com/doc/guide/2.0/en/db-query-builder#batch-query-mysql) for just the duration needed by a batched query, and then close it once the cursor has reached the end._x000D_
_x000D_
Real world usage: https://github.com/craftcms/cms/commit/662dbf199e90c5a67d8e7432ae1cc8b4f751bb45#diff-83772e0b3826d092cca0e5b1eb833373320d8dc106d735c9ebbab093962dc567R216-R223_x000D_

title: [PoC] Refactoring action parameter binding to support registering custom model binders
author: edin
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌ (it can be optional component)_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
_x000D_
Hi, this is attempt to refactor action parameter binding to allow custom binders to be registered and used for specific data types. _x000D_
This can be optional component to keep backward compatability. Interface is based on existing bindActionParams controller method so it can be easly used to provide custom binding._x000D_
_x000D_
Following types (using php8 syntax) are used to define parameter bindings._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
final class BindingContext {_x000D_
    public Request $request;_x000D_
    public ModelBinderInterface $binder;_x000D_
    public Action $action;_x000D_
    public array $params;_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
// Wraps succesfull binding result_x000D_
final class BindingResult {_x000D_
    public mixed $value;  // Binding value_x000D_
    public mixed $message = null; // Optional hint that binder may provide_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
// Result of action binding with list of parameters, resolved arguments and missing argument names_x000D_
final class ActionBindingResult {_x000D_
    public array $parameters = []; //Action parameters array<parameterName, BindingTargetInterface>_x000D_
    public array $arguments = []; //Resolved values _x000D_
    public array $missing = [];	//Missing values_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
// Component will implement this interface to provide custom action parameter binding_x000D_
interface ActionParameterBinderInterface {_x000D_
    public function bindActionParams(Action $action, array $params): ActionBindingResult;_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
// Custom type binder will implement this interface to provide value binding  _x000D_
// Interface may be used to provide custom binding like a factory or class may implement interface to support binding_x000D_
interface ModelBinderInterface {_x000D_
    public function bindModel(BindingTargetInterface $target, BindingContext $context): BindingResult | null;_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
// Helps figthing with various PHP versions and provides uniform interface  over _x000D_
// ReflectionParameter and ReflectionProperty with frequently used methods_x000D_
// Binding target may be either a parameter or property_x000D_
interface BindingTargetInterface {_x000D_
    public function getTarget(): ReflectionParameter|ReflectionProperty;_x000D_
    public function getName(): string;_x000D_
    public function getValue(): mixed;  // Default value that binder may use for binding_x000D_
    public function getType(): ReflectionType|null;_x000D_
    public function getTypeName(): string|null;_x000D_
    public function isArray(): bool;_x000D_
    public function isInstanceOf($typeName): bool;_x000D_
    public function isBuiltin(): bool;_x000D_
    public function allowsNull(): bool;_x000D_
    public function hasDefaultValue(): bool;_x000D_
    public function getDefaultValue(): mixed;_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Here is example from unit test that illustrates some of the binding that is currently supported._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
class Point {_x000D_
    public int $x = 0;_x000D_
    public int $y = 0;_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
class Circle {_x000D_
    public ?Point $center;_x000D_
    public float $radius = 0;_x000D_
    public string $color = "";_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
class Composite {_x000D_
    public \yii\web\Request $request;_x000D_
    public Circle $circle;_x000D_
    public \yii\data\ActiveDataFilter $filter;_x000D_
    public \DateTime $date;_x000D_
}_x000D_
_x000D_
class ActionBindingController extends \yii\base\Controller_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public function actionComposite(Composite $model)  { }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
public function testActionComposite()_x000D_
{_x000D_
	$action = $this->getControllerAction("actionComposite");_x000D_
	$result = $this->parameterBinder->bindActionParams($action, [_x000D_
		"model" => [_x000D_
			"circle" => [_x000D_
				"center" => [_x000D_
					"x" => "25",_x000D_
					"y" => "35"_x000D_
				],_x000D_
				"radius" => "50",_x000D_
				"color" => "purple"_x000D_
			],_x000D_
			"filter" => [_x000D_
				"name" => "value"_x000D_
			]_x000D_
		]_x000D_
	]);_x000D_
_x000D_
	$instance = $result->arguments["model"];_x000D_
	$circle = $instance->circle;_x000D_
	$filter = $instance->filter;_x000D_
_x000D_
	$this->assertNotNull($instance);_x000D_
	$this->assertNotNull($circle);_x000D_
	$this->assertNotNull($filter);_x000D_
	$this->assertInstanceOf(\yii\web\Request::class, $instance->request);_x000D_
	$this->assertInstanceOf(\yii\data\ActiveDataFilter::class, $filter);_x000D_
	$this->assertInstanceOf(Circle::class, $circle);_x000D_
	$this->assertInstanceOf(Point::class,  $circle->center);_x000D_
	$this->assertSame(25, $circle->center->x);_x000D_
	$this->assertSame(35, $circle->center->y);_x000D_
	$this->assertSame(50.0, $circle->radius);_x000D_
	$this->assertSame("purple", $circle->color);_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I know that there is some work left to do here,  let me know what you think._x000D_
_x000D_
