title: Fix #17241 ActiveField::widget() input options
author: yugaego
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️/❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #17241_x000D_
_x000D_
The issue is rooted in having several points of control over a widget's input attributes. The points of control - the ones I am aware of - are listed below in order of precedence, from lowest to highest:_x000D_
_x000D_
1. subInputWidget::options class property default value._x000D_
2. subInputWidget::options DI container configuration._x000D_
3. ActiveField::inputOptions._x000D_
4. ActiveField::widget(,$config['options'])._x000D_
_x000D_
The first two were used before Yii 2.0.17 and prevented from the load by #16681 and #17299 fixes._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Support for MySQL ANSI/ANSI_QUOTES modes
author: brandonkelly
body: This PR adds support for MySQL’s `ANSI` and `ANSI_QUOTES` modes, by checking for `"` characters in addition to \` whenever parsing the results of a `SHOW CREATE TABLE` command._x000D_ _x000D_ `ANSI_QUOTES` is enabled by default on DigitalOcean for MySQL 8, so it would be great to get this pulled in._x000D_ _x000D_ | Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? | ✔️_x000D_ | New feature? | ❌_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | ❌_x000D_ | Tests pass? | ✔️_x000D_ | Fixed issues | #8750_x000D_

title: Add support for ngrok's X-Original-Host header
author: brandonkelly
body:
When ngrok sends requests to the local web server, it will send an `X-Original-Host` header which contains the `XXXXXXXX.ngrok.io` hostname._x000D_
_x000D_
This PR updates `yii\web\Request::getHostInfo()` to check for that header, right after `X-Forwarded-Host`, so that the Yii app is aware of the hostname the browser is actually requesting, and can generate front-end URLs accordingly._x000D_
_x000D_
I’ve also added `X-Original-Host` to the `$secureHeaders` array, so this change won’t have any impact unless `X-Original-Host` is explicitly allowed via `$trustedHosts`._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_

title: Execute tests/bootstrap.php via autoload-dev
author: brandonkelly
body:
The contributing guide [states](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/internals/git-workflow.md#unit-tests):_x000D_
_x000D_
> You can execute unit tests by running `phpunit` in the repo root directory. If you do not have phpunit installed globally you can run `php vendor/bin/phpunit` or `vendor/bin/phpunit.bat` in case of execution from the Windows OS._x000D_
_x000D_
I’m finding this to not be true, because `tests/bootstrap.php` is not executed when you try this, so several things don’t get set up properly for the tests to be able to run._x000D_
_x000D_
With this change, when the yii2 repo is Composer-installed directly, `tests/bootstrap.php` will get executed on each request before PHPUnit is run._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_

title: Db Pgsql getRawSql params replace fix
author: sartor
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_

_x000D_
using Postgresql there is error now with getRawSql function._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
echo $db->createCommand("SELECT * FROM customer WHERE id::integer IN (:in, :out)", [':in' => 1, ':out' => 2])->getRawSql();_x000D_
```_x000D_
Expected: `SELECT * FROM customer WHERE id::integer IN (1, 2)`_x000D_
Actual: `SELECT * FROM customer WHERE id:1teger IN (1, 2)`_x000D_
_x000D_
This pull request fixes it_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Allows router to be aliased
author: markhuot
body:
This allows the `yii serve` command to accept an aliased router (as the document root is). An example of this could be routing to your `@app/web/index.php` file._x000D_
_x000D_
One use case for this is that, by default, `yii serve` will not route `.json` files through your router by default. However, if you use `yii serve --router="@app/web/index.php"` it will force all requests through the router, which will send `.json` requests through your application._x000D_
_x000D_
This is not a BC break because it does not change the default functionality (although I would argue we should make `$this->router = "@app/web/index.php";`). Instead it just supports that functionality for people who need it._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | n/a_x000D_

I am new to YII, but following the examples to learn, I think there is a mistake._x000D_
_x000D_
On line 75, _x000D_
use app\models\EntryForm;_x000D_
_x000D_
It should be replaced by_x000D_
use frontend\models\EntryForm;_x000D_
_x000D_
Because otherwise it generates an error_x000D_
_x000D_
Unable to find 'app\models\EntryForm' _x000D_
or _x000D_
Class 'frontend\controllers\EntryForm' not found_x000D_

body:

_x000D_
This PR adds support for enabling pretty print on the Json helper. _x000D_
Pretty printing can be very useful during development, for example in case of an error in a ElasticSearch query (By default all queries consist of a single line, when pretty print is enabled ElasticSearch can point to the correct line).

title: fix $descriptor | yiisoft\yii2\web\AssetConverter.php
author: AntonyZ89
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
All pipes as 'w' are causing an infinite loading and just stop if restart Apache. The sass command works perfectly, but website never finish loading_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
$descriptor = [_x000D_
    1 => ['pipe', 'w'],_x000D_
    2 => ['pipe', 'w'],_x000D_
];_x000D_
_x000D_
..._x000D_
_x000D_
$stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);_x000D_
$stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
This fix the error_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
$descriptor = [_x000D_
    0 => ['pipe', 'r'],_x000D_
    1 => ['pipe', 'w'],_x000D_
];_x000D_
_x000D_
..._x000D_
_x000D_
$stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[0]);_x000D_
$stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);_x000D_
```

title: Json processdata fix for objects with zero-indexed keys
author: zebraf1
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
Fixed bug when an object with zero-indexed keys (ie indexed array cast to stdClass) is encoded to JSON as array instead of dictionary._x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
$json = Json::encode((object)[0 => 'value']);_x000D_
 ```_x000D_
 Expected output: '{"0": "value"}'_x000D_
 Actual output: '["value"]'_x000D_
_x000D_
This fix allows ensuring dictionary in JSON output for strict API consumers (ie TypeScript) and resolves inconsistent return types._x000D_
_x000D_
Not to break BC - added option for Json and JsonResponseFormatter which is false by default

title: Allows router to be aliased
author: markhuot
body:
This allows the `yii serve` command to accept an aliased router (as the document root is). An example of this could be routing to your `@app/web/index.php` file._x000D_
_x000D_
One use case for this is that, by default, `yii serve` will not route `.json` files through your router by default. However, if you use `yii serve --router="@app/web/index.php"` it will force all requests through the router, which will send `.json` requests through your application._x000D_
_x000D_
This is not a BC break because it does not change the default functionality (although I would argue we should make `$this->router = "@app/web/index.php";`). Instead it just supports that functionality for people who need it._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | n/a_x000D_
_x000D_
Note, this is a second PR after initial conversation over in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/18656 because I messed up the merge and fudged the history. Instead of force pushing to get things back in line I started a new branch off `master` and am now opening this new PR. Sorry._x000D_
_x000D_
All feedback from the previous PR has been addressed, documentation has been updated, null values have been checked._x000D_

title: Several \yii\bootstrap\NavBar fixes
author: creocoder
body:
- links to bootstrap site was actualized
- `padded` renamed to `renderInnerContainer` to be consistent with other "do-something" boolean options
- `innerContainerOptions` added which very important for custom bootstrap assemblies
- special `tag` attribute now recognized inside options, this is very important to get correct html5 markup in several cases. For example if you want make navigation bar as header with role banner like on bootstrap site
- `collapseOptions` added, this is very important to get correct html5 markup in several cases. For example if you want make inner navigation as nav with role navigation like on bootstrap site
- overall refactoring

Why the hell all this needed? :) All simple here is example:

``` php
NavBar::begin([
    'brandLabel' => 'Company label here',
    'options' => ['tag' => 'header', 'role' => 'banner'],
    'collapseOptions' => ['tag' => 'nav', 'role' => 'navigation'],
    'innerContainerOptions' => ['class' => 'container-16'], // this is highly often used while you use bootstrap as framework and have more than 1 grid system
]);
...
NavBar::end();
```

title: Reduce memory copy in "afterRender" event
author: LeoOnTheEarth
body:
Since `$output` parameter is already a reference, we could assign to `ViewEvent::$output` property directly with the reference of `$output` parameter. Then we can reduce some memory._x000D_
_x000D_
I found it when my `$event->output` is very large, the memory usage is wired with this line: `$output = $event->output;`, it does some unnecessary memory copy._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Cache: use defaultDuration for multiSet when no duration is provided
author: OscarBarrett
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #17119_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR addresses an inconsistency between `set` and `multiSet`: `set` has a default duration of null (which falls back to `$defaultDuration`) whereas `multiSet` currently has a default duration of 0 (no expiry)._x000D_
_x000D_
[multiSet was added 6 years ago](), while [set was updated to use the  default duration 5 years ago](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/9a1c168939a5534c9dc8c881c6933b616ecc5de3)._x000D_
_x000D_
As per #17119, TagDependencies do not expire as they are set using `multiSet`. As such, this PR makes the set commands in `Cache` more consistent, and as a result allows TagDependencies to expire using the default cache duration.

title: Update `BaseVarDumper::export()`: adds left offset and optimizes code
author: WinterSilence
body:
- add optional line offset at left (parameter `$offset`)_x000D_
- оptimize and extend `BaseVarDumper::exportInternal()`_x000D_
_x000D_
@samdark for example, gii template generates some function:_x000D_
~~~php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
$data = ['foo' => 1, 'bar' => 2];_x000D_
?>_x000D_
_x000D_
function foo() {_x000D_
    return <?=VarDumper::export($data)?>;_x000D_
}_x000D_
~~~_x000D_
generates:_x000D_
~~~php_x000D_
function foo() {_x000D_
    return [_x000D_
    'foo' => 1,_x000D_
    'bar' => 2_x000D_
];_x000D_
}_x000D_
~~~_x000D_
With offset:_x000D_
~~~php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
$data = ['foo' => 1, 'bar' => 2];_x000D_
?>_x000D_
_x000D_
function foo() {_x000D_
    return <?=VarDumper($data, true)?>_x000D_
}_x000D_
~~~_x000D_
generates:_x000D_
~~~php_x000D_
function foo() {_x000D_
    return [_x000D_
        'foo' => 1,_x000D_
        'bar' => 2_x000D_
    ];_x000D_
}_x000D_
~~~_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Tests pass?   | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_

title: Annotate Model $errors consisting of 2-dim array
author: EtienneBruines
body:

title: Add generic typing to `createObject()`
author: brandonkelly
body:
This PR enhances the `Yii::createObject()` docblock types with generics, which give code introspection tools like PhpStorm and PHPStan better insight into what will be returned by the method._x000D_
_x000D_
With this change, both PHPStan and PhpStorm will now be smart enough to know that `$entry` in the following example is going to be an object of type `craft\elements\Entry`:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$entry = Yii::createObject('craft\elements\Entry');_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
PHPStan would also be able to understand the following examples:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
$entry = Yii::createObject(function(): Entry {_x000D_
    return new 'craft\elements\Entry';_x000D_
});_x000D_
_x000D_
$entry = Yii::createObject([_x000D_
    'class' => 'craft\elements\Entry',_x000D_
    // ..._x000D_
]);_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Resources:_x000D_
_x000D_
- [Generics in PHP using PHPDocs](https://phpstan.org/blog/generics-in-php-using-phpdocs) (PHPStan)_x000D_
- [PHPDoc Types: class-string](https://phpstan.org/writing-php-code/phpdoc-types#class-string) (PHPStan)_x000D_
- [PhpStorm 2021.2: Support for generics](https://blog.jetbrains.com/phpstorm/2021/07/phpstorm-2021-2-release/#generics) (PhpStorm)_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_

title: suppress "Array to string conversion" error caused by rendering input element with non-string form value
author: kamicup
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  |_x000D_
_x000D_
## Issue_x000D_
_x000D_
The code below result in "Array to string conversion" NOTICE error in PHP 7.x and WARNING error in PHP8._x000D_
As Yii2's search model is often used to load data from query parameter, malignant visitor can easily cause Internal Server Error that would be logged and bother system admins._x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
error_reporting(E_ALL);_x000D_
$m = new class extends \yii\base\Model_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $hoge;_x000D_
    public function formName()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return 'f';_x000D_
    }_x000D_
_x000D_
    public function rules()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return [['hoge', 'string']];_x000D_
    }_x000D_
};_x000D_
$m->load([$m->formName() => ['hoge' => []]]);_x000D_
$m->validate(); // validator is ineffective in preventing error in next line_x000D_
echo \yii\helpers\Html::activeInput('text', $m, 'hoge'); // error occurs here_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
## Measures_x000D_
_x000D_
Simply suppress error._x000D_

title: Pagination and sorting for rest index action
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR adds support for configuration of the pagination and sorting for the REST index action. E.g. :_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
<?php_x000D_
namespace site\modules\api\controllers;_x000D_
_x000D_
use yii\rest\ActiveController;_x000D_
use common\models\MyModel;_x000D_
_x000D_
class MyApiController extends ActiveController_x000D_
{_x000D_
    public $modelClass = MyModel::class;_x000D_
    _x000D_
    public function actions()_x000D_
    {_x000D_
        return ArrayHelper::merge(parent::actions(), [_x000D_
            'index' => [_x000D_
                'pagination' => [_x000D_
                    'pageSize' => 10,_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
                'sort' => [_x000D_
                    'defaultOrder' => [_x000D_
                        'created_at' => SORT_DESC,_x000D_
                    ],_x000D_
                ],_x000D_
            ],_x000D_
        ]);_x000D_
    }_x000D_
}_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
ToDo:_x000D_
- [x] Code_x000D_
- [x] Tests_x000D_
- [x] Docs

title: PHPStan level 0
author: bizley
body:
This is an attempt to introduce static analysis to Yii 2 with well known and widely used PHPStan package (level 0 for the good start)._x000D_
Few things were required:_x000D_
- composer's config.platform was removed in order to install PHPStan (it requires PHP 7|8)_x000D_
- composer's constraint for friendsofphp/php-cs-fixer was changed to `^2.2` because of the above removal._x000D_
_x000D_
As we can see even with level 0 it proves to show some things to be fixed, like missing returns. To keep everything as it was before I've added `ignore` comments for the lines with `new static` (PHPStan correctly throws warnings there, see https://phpstan.org/blog/solving-phpstan-error-unsafe-usage-of-new-static )._x000D_
_x000D_
If we want to keep it I would be happy to increase the level as high as possible while keeping Yii 2 compatible with PHP 5.4.

title: Replace deprecated $.trim() in yii.validation.js
author: WinterSilence
body:
> Note: This API has been deprecated in jQuery 3.5; please use the native String.prototype.trim method instead. Unlike jQuery.trim, String.prototype.trim does not work with types other than strings (null, undefined, Number). Make sure that your code is compatible when migrating._x000D_
_x000D_
`yii.validation.trim()` also converts number, null, undefined._x000D_
Adds optional option `chars` to emulate PHP `trim()`._x000D_

title: fix bodyParams return value for psalm
author: albertborsos
body:
because the value of yii\web\Request::$_bodyParams is never an object_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
Since I updated to a psalm 4.23, I get a lot of errors like this:_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
ERROR: PossiblyInvalidArgument - controllers/UrlNodesController.php:351:22 - Argument 1 of models\UrlNode::load expects array<array-key, mixed>, possibly different type array<array-key, mixed>|mixed|object provided (see https://psalm.dev/092)_x000D_
        $model->load(Yii::$app->getRequest()->getBodyParams(), '');_x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I checked the `\yii\web\Request` class and I think the return value cannot be an object.

title: Delay exit in error handler
author: arrilot
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌ i suppose it's not likely that anyone relies on the current behavior_x000D_
_x000D_
Our use case is the following. We want to collect prometheus metrics regarding http requests and console commands - rps, duration, number of errors, timeouts e.t.c._x000D_
The way we do it is via register_shutdown_function in a filter attached to route or application._x000D_
The problem is that ErrorHandler gets on the road._x000D_
Error handler registers its own `register_shutdown_function callback and when a fatal error occurs (e.g. a request exceeds max_execution_time) calls exit(1) in the end of it._x000D_
As a result no other `register_shutdown_function` callbacks registered in userland have a chance to be invoked and we lose all the metrics for this request._x000D_
It is also worth noting that errorHandler is registered in Yii Application very early during request lifecycle that makes things even worse. _x000D_
_x000D_
This is by no mean a new issue. It was raised at least [one](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/9769), [two](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/6637) times_x000D_
_x000D_
In the last issue Cebe said "If you have any alternative fixes in mind, feel free to do a suggestion" so here we go._x000D_
_x000D_
The idea was taken from Yii's logger - https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/log/Logger.php#L135_x000D_
According to php docs "Shutdown functions may also call register_shutdown_function() themselves to add a shutdown function to the end of the queue."_x000D_
By moving exit(1) to the end shutdown callbacks queue we preserve the final exit code and leave a room for developers' own callbacks to be executed._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

> Working directory of the script can change inside the shutdown function under some Web servers, e.g. Apache._x000D_
2. Adds event to call user's handler on application shutdown_x000D_
_x000D_

title: Improve reflection param/return types in console\Controller
author: brandonkelly
body:
This clarifies exactly which reflection classes `yii\console\Controller::parseDocCommentTags()`, `parseDocCommentSummary()`, and `parseDocCommentDetail()` should accept for their `$reflection` param, since `getdocComment()` isn’t actually implemented by the base `Reflection` class._x000D_
_x000D_
(It’s implemented separately for [ReflectionClass](https://www.php.net/manual/en/reflectionclass.getdoccomment.php), [ReflectionProperty](https://www.php.net/manual/en/reflectionproperty.getdoccomment.php), and [ReflectionFunctionAbstract](https://www.php.net/manual/en/reflectionfunctionabstract.getdoccomment.php).)_x000D_
_x000D_
The `@return` type for `getActionMethodReflection()` was also changed, from `ReflectionMethod` to `ReflectionFunctionAbstract`, making room for subclasses to return a `ReflectionFunction` object._x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_

title: Support for 'X-Forwarded-Port' header in `\yii\web\Request`
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR adds support for the 'X-Forwarded-Port' header in `\yii\web\Request` and fixes redirection (`\yii\web\Response::redirect()`) to the incorrect port if the SSL connection is terminated at a load balancer and the app itself runs on port 80. E.g. [AWS Elastic Load Balancing](_x000D_
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/x-forwarded-headers.html#:~:text=Forwarded%2DProto%3A%20https-,X%2DForwarded%2DPort)

title: Fixes a virtual relation not working because of new isset checks
author: wvanheumen
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | _x000D_
_x000D_
2.0.45 has new check to prevent warnings, but fail because object are interpreted as arrays._x000D_
_x000D_
```_x000D_
$object = new ArModel();_x000D_
$object->virtualField = 1;_x000D_
var_dump(isset($object['virtualField'])); #result: false_x000D_
var_dump($object['virtualField']); #result:  1_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
Seems to only happen if the AR model does not have the fields in the attributes array. Therefor, called it a virtual relation._x000D_
_x000D_
Added a test that fails on 2.0.45, success on 2.0.44_x000D_

title: Enable console commands also on hostings where exec() not allowed
author: lubosdz
body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?_x000D_
_x000D_
Executing console commands (CLI) throws error on hostings with limited shell script support. _x000D_
Typically some function like `exec()`, `file_get_contents()` etc. may be disabled by hosting administrators._x000D_
In such a case an error e.g. `Error: exec() has been disabled for security reasons.` pops up and command cannot be executed (e.g. migration)._x000D_
_x000D_
### What is the expected result?_x000D_
_x000D_
Execute console command, e.g. migration._x000D_
_x000D_
### What do you get instead?_x000D_
_x000D_
Error e.g. `Error: exec() has been disabled for security reasons.` ._x000D_
_x000D_
### Additional info_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q                | A_x000D_
| ---------------- | ---_x000D_
| Yii version      | 2.0.45_x000D_
| PHP version      |  any_x000D_
| Operating system | linux, windows_x000D_
_x000D_
### Reason & solution_x000D_
_x000D_
The reason of this message is [exec()](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/helpers/BaseConsole.php#L704) method in `/helpers/BaseConsole::getScreenSize()`. Using supress operator `@` allows further code execution._x000D_

title: Docs: fix typo: input tabular data: remove unnecessary "-1"
author: vilkoz
body:
Before the change, with this input:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$_POST = [_x000D_
    'Setting' => [_x000D_
        0 => ['value' => 'value0'],_x000D_
        1 => ['value' => 'value1'],_x000D_
    ]_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
contents of $settings would be created as follows:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$settings = [_x000D_
    Setting(value='value0'),_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_
after the change it will be:_x000D_
```_x000D_
$settings = [_x000D_
    Setting(value='value0'),_x000D_
    Setting(value='value1'),_x000D_
];_x000D_
```_x000D_

title: default strict=true for gridview filter (#19508)
author: alnidok
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/19508_x000D_
_x000D_
Gridview filter behavior was changed https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/19508 after merge PR https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/19331_x000D_
_x000D_
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/340666010a1292b62d7b348ead579b3d95a2cfd9/framework/helpers/BaseHtml.php#L1917_x000D_
because `strict=false` by default_x000D_
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/340666010a1292b62d7b348ead579b3d95a2cfd9/framework/helpers/BaseHtml.php#L1881_x000D_
_x000D_
---_x000D_
_x000D_
It means that we should add this code for every boolean column or numeric column with allowable value=0 (ie statuses)_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'filterInputOptions' => [_x000D_
    'class' => 'form-control',_x000D_
    'strict' => true,_x000D_
],_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
I think that it is a bug and **strict should be true by default for GridView filters**._x000D_
This PR do it.

title: Docs: Wrong operator format
author: OndrejVasicek
body:
Based on the docs and mainly my experience with Yii, I believe the "and" operator format here is wrong. The condition parts which the "and" separates have to be each in an array, otherwise the where() doesn't know where the condition starts and where ends._x000D_
_x000D_

title: Fixes comparison completly  in `BaseHtml::renderSelectOptions()`
author: WinterSilence
body:
Current `BaseHtml::renderSelectOptions()` behavior is incorrect:_x000D_
- multiple selection: always converts `$selection` and `$key` to strings_x000D_
- single selection: converts `$selection` and `$key` to strings at strict comparation (`strcmp()`)_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #19522_x000D_

title: Option to pass callable as key prefix
author: nadar
body:
There are different reason where cache key should be evaluated dynamically in the config, for example something like this:_x000D_
_x000D_
```php_x000D_
'cache' => [_x000D_
            'class' => 'yii\redis\Cache',_x000D_
            'redis' => 'redis',_x000D_
            'keyPrefix' => function() {_x000D_
                return getenv('SERVER_ENV') ?: 'defaultprefix';_x000D_
             }_x000D_
],_x000D_
```_x000D_
_x000D_
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
_x000D_
Let me know if this is acceptable, so i will add some more phpdocs and changelog._x000D_

title: Do not reset retryHandler when yii\db\Command::reset() called
author: erickskrauch
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #17811_x000D_
_x000D_
Logically, this PR violates backward compatibility. But so far this functionality was nowhere described and was of little use on real projects because almost any operation with `Command` or `Query` was done by calling `setSql()`, which called `reset()` method inside, which sets `_errorHandler` to `null`. So I don't think it's so much a change as more of a design bug fix._x000D_
_x000D_
Should I mention this functionality in the docs? I could only find this functionality by reading the source code._x000D_
_x000D_
I also wanted to reflect these changes in the tests, but found that the behavior with resetting the field when `reset()` was called was not covered with tests.

title: Prevent trailing or duplicate spaces in class attribute
author: MoritzLost
body:
| Q | A_x000D_ | ------------- | ---_x000D_ | Is bugfix? | ❌_x000D_ | New feature? | ✔️_x000D_ | Breaks BC? | ❌_x000D_ _x000D_ This is a tiny, backwards-compatible improvement to the `BaseHtml::renderTagAttributes` method. It removes empty elements from the classes array for the `class` attribute, preventing duplicate or trailing whitespaces in the generated HTML._x000D_ _x000D_ ```php_x000D_
[_x000D_ 'my-custom-element',_x000D_ $someCondition ? 'my-custom-element--modifier' : null,_x000D_ ]]) ?>>
_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ If `$someCondition` is false, this will result in the output:_x000D_ _x000D_ ```html_x000D_
_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ Notice the extra space at the end of the attribute. This is pretty common if you're using this function in Twig templates, where you can omit the last part of the ternary operator._x000D_ _x000D_ By filtering out empty elements from the array of classes before joining it, you instead get this:_x000D_ _x000D_ ```html_x000D_
_x000D_ ```_x000D_ _x000D_ Which is much nicer to look at.

title: Change property visibility to allow more flexibility for apps
author: lubosdz
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ❌_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | introduced by #18975, fixes #19696_x000D_
_x000D_
Commit #18975 throws warning when reusing the `View` object more than once in a single request. This unfortunately ignores possible legit use cases. For example in one our app we have CMS admin, which requires in first step fetching & parsing View output from the page being edited (find placeholders) and then in returned view (2. View usage) display editable areas. Since 2.0.44 our logger is bloated with warnings `You\'re trying to register a file after View::endBody() has been called`. Since the property has been assigned `private`, there is no way to allow overriding behavior in an application e.g. for specific controllers only._x000D_
_x000D_
This commit alleviates aforementioned issue by changing property visibility from `private` to `protected`.

```_x000D_
  Problem 1_x000D_
    - Root composer.json requires ezyang/htmlpurifier ^4.15 -> satisfiable by ezyang/htmlpurifier[v4.15.0, v4.16.0]._x000D_
    - ezyang/htmlpurifier[v4.15.0, v4.16.0] require php ~5.6.0 || ~7.0.0 || ~7.1.0 || ~7.2.0 || ~7.3.0 || ~7.4.0 || ~8.0.0 || ~8.1.0 || ~8.2.0 -> your php version (5.4; overridden via config.platform, actual: 8.2.1) does not satisfy that requirement._x000D_

There is no way to extend the `yii/db/Query` class._x000D_

author: rhertogh
body:

_x000D_
Many function in the `yii\web\Request` are cached in private properties. This PR adds the same functionality for the `getUserIP`  and `getSecureForwardedHeaderTrustedParts` functions._x000D_
This greatly improves performance when a lot of `trustedHosts` are set (e.g. when using CloudFlare or AWS CloudFront)._x000D_

title: Via joined
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ❌_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ❌_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #1429, #10174, #16606, #17166, #17558_x000D_
_x000D_
This PR adds several functions to the `\yii\db\ActiveQuery` class to support relations using 'inner join' to resolve the 'via' relation(s). This solves the problems described in the "fixed issues" list above and on the following websites:_x000D_
_x000D_
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27690401_x000D_
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69329769_x000D_
https://forum.yiiframework.com/t/how-to-orderby-on-viatable-in-hasmany-model-relationship/80043_x000D_
https://copyprogramming.com/howto/can-t-sort-hasmany-relationship-in-yii2_x000D_
_x000D_
The new functions are:_x000D_
`viaJoined()`: Same as `via()` but using inner join(s)._x000D_
`viaJoinedTable()`: Same as `viaTable()` but using inner join._x000D_
`viaJoinedTables()`: Supports multiple via tables using inner joins._x000D_
_x000D_
ToDo:_x000D_
- [x] Unit tests_x000D_
- [ ] PHP DocBlocks_x000D_
- [ ] Documentation

title: Support default value for `Console::select()`
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | -_x000D_
_x000D_
Currently `yii\helpers\BaseConsole::prompt()` and `yii\helpers\BaseConsole::confirm()` support a "default" value._x000D_
This PR adds similar support to `yii\helpers\BaseConsole::select()` and `yii\console\Controller::select()`._x000D_

`yii\console\Controller::select()` now also respects the `yii\console\Controller::$interactive` setting.

title: Action after run result
author: rhertogh
body:
| Q             | A_x000D_
| ------------- | ---_x000D_
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️_x000D_
| New feature?  | ✔️_x000D_
| Breaks BC?    | ✔️_x000D_
| Fixed issues  | #13484_x000D_
_x000D_
The `\yii\base\Action::afterRun()` [documentation](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/base/Action.php#L115-L116) states:_x000D_
> "You may override this method to do post-processing work for the action run"_x000D_
_x000D_
Currently post-processing is not possible since the `$result` is not passed to the `afterRun()` function in the [`\yii\base\Action::runWithParams()`](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/base/Action.php#L94) function._x000D_
_x000D_
This was discussed earlier, but since Yii 2.1 is cancelled I would like to re-submit this feature._x000D_
_x000D_
ToDo:_x000D_
- [x] Implementation_x000D_
- [ ] Documentation/Changelog/Upgrade steps_x000D_
- [ ] Unit tests

title: fix JS redirect in OAuth callback view
author: tanakahisateru
body:
OAuth success/cancel callback shows a view which includes JavaScript redirect back logic.

When my app configured to use this view without popup window, 

``` php
<?php $authChoice = yii\authclient\widgets\Choice::begin([
    'baseAuthUrl' => ['site/auth'],
    'popupMode' => false,
]); ?>
```

but if the main window previously opened via `<a href="..." target="_blank">` or such as in browser tabs, I get no actions in the view.

Because `window.opener` was set something (that might be already closed). Also `window.close()` was ignored tab because it might not be floating window... I guess.

It should be checked correctly if it had been popped up by this component. I think that to add window name assigned by `yii\authclient\widgets\Choice` is safer way here:

https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/extensions/authclient/widgets/assets/authchoice.js#L61

title: Unittest app dependency
author: bwoester
body:
Another approach on issue #199.

Make unit tests responsible for creating app instance if they require one.

Also introduce a unit test param that defines which application class should be used for the unit tests. This way, we can quickly validate that the components not only work with one special application implementation.

Not yet happy with that param approach, because it requires us to hack the config and run tests twice. But didn't find a solution to automate that yet.

title: Advanced file excluding/including ported from git
author: nineinchnick
body:
Fixes #2048. This extends/fixes the _except/only_ options for _helpers/BaseFileHelper::findFiles()_ method to support not only file suffixes but wildcards.

The solution is ported from git (1.8.5.3, dir.c) to support same syntax as in _.gitignore_ files. Only the double asterisk (**) is not supported, because it requires the use of _wildmatch()_ function instead of _fnmatch()_.

title: issue #1659: released buildLimitOffset() for MSSQL
author: Ana1oliy
body: released buildLimitOffset method for MSSQL. Returns query part like `OFFSET x ROWS FETCH NEXT y ROWS`. `OFFSET x ROWS` part is required permanently, but `x` may be 0. This clause performed by 2012 or later versions of server. In earlier versions should use `SELECT TOP x` clause instead `LIMIT`. `OFFSET` can be emulated only.

title: Fixes for #2162. SphinxQL: COUNT(*) get error.
author: romeOz
body:
When trying to get the total number of items, an error is returned.
For example, this query returns an error:

``` sql
SELECT COUNT (*) FROM some_index WHERE MATCH ('foo');
```

![error](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3135712/2007226/f55f6370-8733-11e3-9474-12cdc1dc1224.png)

There are two ways to resolve:
1) Add `GROUP BY`.

``` sql
SELECT COUNT(*) AS cnt, 1 AS q FROM some_index WHERE MATCH ('foo') GROUP BY q;
```

![Add GROUP BY](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3135712/2007230/18ea62f4-8734-11e3-901b-befab4e72164.png)

2) use `SHOW META`

``` sql
SELECT * FROM some_index  WHERE MATCH ('foo') limit 0;
SHOW META;
```

![use SHOW META](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3135712/2007239/2a88ff34-8734-11e3-9abc-49d788c88359.png)

in the statistics table will be field **_total_found**_
http://sphinxsearch.com/forum/view.html?id=10212

This pull request must be connected with this: #2162 

**Update**: attached screenshots.

title: Add individual SELECT statements in UNION
author: romeOz
body:
This pull request must be connected with this: #2175

``` php
Foo::find()
    ->limit(15)
    ->unionFull(
        Bar::find()
        ->limit(16),
        true
    )
    ->createCommand()
    ->getSql();
```

or

``` php
(new Query())
    ->from(['foo'])
    ->limit(15)
    ->unionFull(
        (new Query())
        ->from(['bar'])
        ->limit(16),
        true
    )
    ->createCommand()
    ->getSql();
```

**Output:** 

``` sql
(SELECT * FROM `foo` LIMIT 15) UNION ALL ( SELECT * FROM `bar` LIMIT 16 )
```

body:
Resolves #492. **WIP - do not merge, request for comments.**

Introducing a generic message queue interface with following features:
- A single message queue as an application component
- Three implementations: System V, Redis and DB (SQL)
- Publish/Subscribe (delivery to multiple queues) with filtering by categories
- Peeking and reserving/locking messages with a timeout
- Blocking mode to allow running a consumer/worker that waits for messages
- Yii events

The design is suppose to allow creating job queues as well as messaging, notifications, logging, audits etc.

This PR is a request for comments. It means there are a few design issues to discuss:
1. Blocking
   Blocking is required to be able to implement an efficient consumer fired up as a deamon that waits for arriving messages. This is   implemented in the Redis and SysV queues and could be done for Db queue but requires a db engine specific sql expressions (locking,     notifications in PostgreSQL and queus in MsSQL).
   Currently it's a property of the queue component. Should it be an argument to the send/receive methods?
2. Db implementation
   Should AR models be used? They do simplify the queue interface implementation by removing raw SQL from it. Can the namespace hierarchy be improved? 
3. Separating PubSub interface
   Should the PubSub methods be extracted into a separate interface? A good example is the SysV implementation, which provide only a   single queue. It could implement the PubSub interface by storing subscriptions somewhere else, ie a database.
4. Should a console controller be included?
5. Are there any other implementations that should be available?

Note: db implementation is important to be able to use in a local dev enviroment (like mail with file delivery) and in enviroments where services like Redis cannot be installed (shared hosting). It CAN be acceptable in low traffic/congestion systems.

Note: the code here may not actually run. It has been ported into the framework from the [yii2-nfy module](https://github.com/nineinchnick/yii2-nfy) for discussion of the basic design.

Tests will be added after current design will be accepted and/or changes will be made.

Note: the pubsub in Redis requires resolving the #1932 issue first.

title: first draft of the extension generator
author: schmunk42
body:
### Description

Enter the desired values to create a Yii2 extension ready for usage with composer.
There are currently three files generated: composer.json, README.md and AutoloadExample.php.

**This is not final yet.** I need some input.
### Questions

Q: Should we enforce the `yii2-` prefix for the package name? 
I'd say yes. Will keep a consistent naming across extensions. Can still be changed manually.
How can I prepend yii-2 in the input field or render a form field without label?

Q: Which values should be available for `type`, do we need more? 

Q: How to handle the array input for keywords?
We could add the most popular tags from Yii1.
I'd like to do this input with a Select2 widget, but is it available already (in the core).

Q: What do you think about autogenerating the namespace, is the JavaScript implementation sufficient?

Q: Should title also be autogenerated?
ucFirst(packageName)

Q: Where should the extension be generated?

Q: What do you think about the testing explanation.

Validation and Prefix and Namespace rendering have to be improved, but I wanted to clear the above points first.

It’s better to use `application/javascript` instead of `text/javascript`.

Also it could be `application/json-p` in future.

See:
- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSONP#Security_concerns
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3128062/is-this-safe-for-providing-jsonp/3128948#3128948

title: Tests improved
author: Ragazzo
body:
Added permanent user logout to avoid different data-collisions. 
Currently per each `login()` or `...session->open()` new session will be started since there is no session id that can be passed from cookies in console, it is ok.

@qiangxue do we need to do some cleanup in `yii\codeception\TestCase` to avoid data-collisions since they all run in one thread in console, or it is fine to mention later in docs so that they can use `@backupGlobals` phpunit [annotation](http://phpunit.de/manual/3.7/en/appendixes.annotations.html) in test? 
However maybe some component should be cleaned - runtime dir, cache, etc?

title: Improved widget syntax
author: samdark
body:
Allows to use widgets in a simpler way.

**Current**

``` php
<?php echo Captcha::widget($this, array(
    'param' => 123,
))?>
```

**Proposed**

``` php
<?php echo Captcha::widget(array(
    'param' => 123,
))?>
```

If you need to pass custom view object (should be a rare case):

``` php
<?php echo Captcha::widget(array(
    'param' => 123,
    'view' => $myViewObject,
))?>
```

title: add findAndModify() method to the Collection class
author: mohorev
body:
The findAndModify command atomically modifies and returns a single document. By default, the returned document does not include the modifications made on the update. To return the document with the modifications made on the update, use the new option.

This is very useful function. Example usage:

``` php
/** @var \yii\mongodb\ActiveRecord $this */

$this->getCollection()->findAndModify(
    ['_id' => $this->_id],
    ['$inc' => ['inc' => 1]],
    ['inc' => true, '_id' => false],
    ['new' => true]
);
```

title: [doc]Composer is not a package manager.
author: qiansen1386
body:
It is a issue i found when I translate the composer.md file.
**Composer is not a package manager, It's a tool for dependency management.**

According to their [doc](https://getcomposer.org/doc/00-intro.md)

> **Composer is a tool for dependency management in PHP.** It allows you to declare the dependent libraries your project needs and it will install them in your project for you.

and 

> **Composer is not a package manager.** Yes, it deals with "packages" or libraries, but it manages > them on a per-project basis, installing them in a directory (e.g. vendor) inside your project. By > default it will never install anything globally. Thus, it is a dependency manager.

So i think, It would be better, if we remain their offical appellation. What do you think?

title: Better Secure Connection detection

body:
In PHP-FPM + nginx there is no such env $_SERVER['HTTPS'] and `Yii::$app->request->isSecureConnection` is always false.
So checking server port (what is not perfect) seems as ultimate way.

title: DI container
author: qiangxue
body:
Fixes https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/503

For performance reason, automatic constructor injection is not implemented.

The most obvious BC breaking change to existing code is the renaming from `Application::getComponent()` to `get()`.
- [x] refactor existing app components to make use of `Instance`
- [x] controller creation should make use of container
- [ ] guide titled "Dependency injection and service locator"

title: gii command
author: schmunk42
body:
## Draft

First off all I had a problem defining `gii` as a module for the console, it looks like the default controller is recognized as a command, so I had to configure the module as `console-gii` temporarily.

Sample output

```
$ ./yii

[...]
- console-gii/default   @author Qiang Xue <qiang.xue@gmail.com>
```

The command works like this:

```

$ ./yii gii/generate --generator=module --generate=true \
  --attributes='template:default;moduleClass:app\modules\foobar\Module;moduleID:foobar'
Loading generator 'module'...


Generating code using template "/Users/tobias/hrzg/gitlab/phundament/app-local-v4/vendor/yiisoft/yii2-dev/extensions/gii/generators/module/default"...
 generated modules/foobar/Module.php
 generated modules/foobar/controllers/DefaultController.php
 generated modules/foobar/views/default/index.php
done!
```

Custom generator:

```
$ ./yii gii/generate --generator=giiant --generate=true \
  --attributes='template:default;modelClass:app\models\TestBase;searchModelClass:app\models\TestBaseSearch;controllerClass:app\controllers\TestBaseController;providerList:\schmunk42\giiant\crud\providers\EditorProvider,\schmunk42\giiant\crud\providers\SelectProvider'




Loading generator 'giiant'...


Generating code using template "/Users/tobias/hrzg/gitlab/phundament/app-local-v4/vendor/schmunk42/yii2-giiant/crud/default"...
   skipped controllers/TestBaseController.php
   skipped models/TestBaseSearch.php
 overwrote views/test-base/_form.php
   skipped views/test-base/_search.php
   skipped views/test-base/create.php
   skipped views/test-base/index.php
   skipped views/test-base/update.php
   skipped views/test-base/view.php
done!
```

Error output:

```
Errors:
-------
template: A code template must be selected.
modelClass: Model Class cannot be blank.
searchModelClass: Search Model Class cannot be blank.
controllerClass: Controller Class cannot be blank.
```

It can run the creation process and generate the files. Let me know what you think about the syntax.
If we can run commands from commands there's no need for a config file loader immediately.
I'll also try to implement the interactive fallback, if this approach is OK so far.

I made a mistake in #2531. 
In case of a redirect in a pjax response, we need to send X-Pjax-Url header (to push this url into browser state), but we also need the X-Redirect (since pjax is actually a ajax request) to redirect browser.

title: Fixed overriding default message sources
author: samdark
body:
When overriding i18n translation sources from config using `app*` or `yii*` default `app` and `yii` sources were not removed resulting in using application source language for messages with `app` category.

``` php
'i18n' => [
    'translations' => [
        'app*' => [
            'class' => 'yii\i18n\PhpMessageSource',
            'sourceLanguage' => 'ru',
            'fileMap' => [
                'app' => 'app.php',
                'app/error' => 'error.php',
            ],
        ],
    ],
],
```

title: jquery installation and maintance with composer / packagists.
author: dmtrs
body:
Quoting from [Packagists](https://packagist.org/)

> Packagist is the main Composer repository. It aggregates all sorts of PHP packages that are installable with Composer.

Under [yiisoft packages](https://packagist.org/packages/yiisoft/) we can find pure javascript packages that should not be exist because they are...javascript.

Not that this brings extra effort in the development team ( maintain extra repo with js and their dependencies), it also brings a "bad" name (imho) to the project.

There are alternatives but this is not `git submodule` of course. It's called [bower](http://bower.io/)

>  Bower is a package manager for the web. It offers a generic, unopinionated solution to the problem of front-end package management.

This is the proper way to maintain the **front-end packages** but bad news is that it's written in node. It is obvious that an extra and particularly this dependency is not good for the a php framework but there is an alternative: [BowerPHP](http://bowerphp.org/#about).

To be honest I have not used this project, but seems to be the solution in this case that can give extra push to the php community around front-end package management.

title: Make selenium acceptance tests work for basic app
author: PaulVanSchayck
body:
The selector used for button clicking would not be trickered by the webdriver as it does not automatically look for button[name="click-var"], only for input[type=submit]. So this improves the selector.

Also, a wait() is required after submitting the wrong user/password.

Does not break PhpBrowser based tests.

title: Refactor UrlManager, bootstrap Gii to add its own routes.
author: hiltonjanfield
body:
These changes refactor UrlManager to allow Gii and other modules to add routes to UrlManager during the bootstrap process, after the main app has been initialized.

Also sets up Gii to add routes to UrlManager if bootstrapped. This saves users from having to manually add extra routes to their config file to get Gii to work when custom routes are set in their apps.

title: Refactor UrlManager, bootstrap Gii to add its own routes.
author: hiltonjanfield
body:
This change refactors UrlManager::compileRules() to expose two public functions to allow modules to create and add their own routes. The intent is for Gii to auto-register routes, however the functions should also be useful for other modules.

This change also adjusts Gii to use BootstrapInterface to automatically register routes to ensure it can be accessed with pretty URLs, no matter what routes are defined in the app config.

title: [Enhancement] Facebook auth dialog when displayed on popup mode
author: gajahlemu
body:
![facebook-auth-dialog-popup-warning](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1357280/2750690/26e22eca-c896-11e3-82f5-44b42cabcf21.png)
Override buildAuthUrl function to refine auth dialog when on popup mode.
You need to setup auth client collection application component like:

```
'components' => [
    'authClientCollection' => [
        'class' => 'yii\authclient\Collection',
        'clients' => [
            'facebook' => [
                'class' => 'yii\authclient\clients\Facebook',
                'clientId' => 'facebook_client_id',
                'clientSecret' => 'facebook_client_secret',
                'viewOptions' => [
                    'display'=>'popup',
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
    ...
]
```

title: Fix #2511 avoid publishing of convrtable files.
author: klimov-paul
body:
This is my attempt to fix #2511
I can not see other way to do it, but procesing of each asset file separately.

Warning: PR breaks a BC, if it is accepted Asset bundles should declare result JS and CSS files instead of converable source!

Change may impact the performace or have other drawbacks.

Opinions and critics are wellcome.

I'm just starting to use the template.  I'm sure I will have more feedback in a few weeks after some use of it.  This is mostly grammatical changes.

I did change the recommended composer installation command, as the composer website recommends using the `-sS` flags on `curl`.  The capital `S` from the curl manual:  "When used with -s it makes curl show an error message if it fails."

One important point of note, is the documentation says this:  

>  This application template also goes a bit further regarding features and provides essential database, signup and password restore out of the box.

Yet, it says nothing more than that about the signup, password restore, etc...

title: TypeAhead plugin

body:
Added TypeAhead plugin. Trying to keep the simplicity of the code at the `Modal` widget. 

Examples of use: 

```
// with active form
<?php echo \yii\bootstrap\TypeAhead::widget(array(
    'form' => $form,
    'model' => $model,
    'attribute' => 'name',
    'pluginOptions' => array(
        'source' => array('ESP', 'USA')
    )
));?>
```

without 

```
<?php echo \yii\bootstrap\TypeAhead::widget(array(
    'name' => 'test',
    'pluginOptions' => array(
        'source' => array('ESP', 'USA')
    )
));?>
```

closes #327

title: BaseMailer: Use textLayout for text version of Email when possible
author: armab
body:
For the moment even if `$textLayout` file exists it isn't used for rendering Text version of Email in this example: 

``` php
Yii::$app->mail->compose('confirm');
```

Only this construction will use `$textLayout` for rendering Text version of Email:

``` php
Yii::$app->mail->compose([
    'html' => 'confirm-html', // $htmlLayout
    'text' => 'confirm-text', // $textLayout
]);
```

---

The suggestion is:
When `$textLayout` file exists, use that template by default for generating Email Text Body, instead of `$htmlLayout`.

The change provided for BaseMailer.php is just to show the point.

Thanks.

title: Dropdown update, implement simple missing features
author: hiltonjanfield
body:
Implements headers and dividers in a logical manner similar to Yii 1.1. This allows use of dividers and headers in a more consistent manner (rather than having to manually add HTML), and allows 'visible' and other options to be used. Items with no URL will become a header. A string with three hyphens will become a divider. ``` php ['label' => 'Secret Areas'], ['label' => 'Nimh', 'url' => 'http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0084649'], '---' ['label' => 'Not Visible', 'visible' => false], ['label' => 'Yii', 'url' => 'http://www.yiiframework.com'] ``` will now become: ``` html
  • Secret Areas
  • Nimh
  • Yii
    • ``` Original code to output submenus (lines 92, 99-104) retained despite lack of support in Bootstrap 3, as functionality can be restored with a few lines of CSS as shown at http://www.bootply.com/86684 .

title: HHVM compatibility Fixes for Yii 2 Console Application
author: MethyleneGaming
body:
testing Yii 2 in HHVM I came across this issue.

https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/2926

It seems that the problem that is within HHVM when STDOUT etc. are called in a namespaced file it points to a null instance of STDOUT|STDIN, but you can not redefine it because its it already defined.

This is fixed by calling the global namespace of STDOUT etc. This might be fixed in HHVM but this makes the console application work.

title: [travis-ci] Allow fast finishing
author: DaSourcerer
body:
With a single test run easily exceeding half an hour of cumulative time, we should be getting build results a bit sooner. This PR allows [fast finishing](http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/build-configuration/#Fast-finishing) in Travis CI. As a result, a build is being marked as "passed" if either:
1. A job that is not allowed to fail has indeed failed
2. all remaining jobs are allowed to fail.

It is important to note that this doesn't actually _skip_ any jobs (cf travis-ci/travis-ci#2260).

See also: http://blog.travis-ci.com/2013-11-27-fast-finishing-builds/

title: timestamp precision added
author: Ragazzo
body:
Added explicitly precision to timestamp, to remove unnecessary precision. I dont think that someone need extra precision, it is not a common use-case. 
Also it is more useful and handful to work on php side with such precision. If someone still need extra precision he can manually create it in migration or in query builder by specifying explicitly column string.

``` sql
CREATE TABLE testing_table (
 id serial NOT NULL,
 description character varying(255),
 time_without_precision_tz timestamp(0) with time zone NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
 time_without_precision timestamp(0) without time zone NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
 time_with_precision_tz timestamp with time zone NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
 time_with_precision timestamp without time zone NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
 CONSTRAINT testing_table_pk PRIMARY KEY (id)
)
```

``` sql
INSERT INTO testing_table(description)
    VALUES ('some_description_0');
INSERT INTO testing_table(description)
    VALUES ('some_description_1');
```

``` yaml
SELECT * FROM testing_table;
-[ RECORD 1 ]-------------+------------------------------
id                        | 1
description               | some_description_0
time_without_precision_tz | 2014-05-14 17:42:42+04
time_without_precision    | 2014-05-14 17:42:42
time_with_precision_tz    | 2014-05-14 17:42:41.662101+04
time_with_precision       | 2014-05-14 17:42:41.662101
-[ RECORD 2 ]-------------+------------------------------
id                        | 2
description               | some_description_1
time_without_precision_tz | 2014-05-14 17:42:42+04
time_without_precision    | 2014-05-14 17:42:42
time_with_precision_tz    | 2014-05-14 17:42:41.662101+04
time_with_precision       | 2014-05-14 17:42:41.662101
```

title: Handle invalid code sequences in Html::encode()
author: DaSourcerer
body:
As described in [this blog post](http://nikic.github.io/2012/01/28/htmlspecialchars-improvements-in-PHP-5-4.html), PHP 5.4 introduced a new flag to `htmlspecialchars()` allowing invalid code sequences being replaced by � (REPLACEMENT CHARACTER).

Accepting this PR will highten security of Yii 2 apps and bring the framework closer to the recommendations found in the [Unicode Security Considerations](http://unicode.org/reports/tr36/#Some_Output_For_All_Input).

title: #3522 normalizepath to allow current path
author: skotos
body:
The patch for #3522  mainly affects BaseFileHelper.php::normalizePath() in the following ways:
- 55 - Added parentheses so that a . is preserved if it is the first part of the path.
- 52-54 A `..` part will not be cancelled if the preceding part that is popped is `.`  Therefore `./../a` becomes `../a` and not `a`.
- 61-63 Drops the preceeding . if there are more parts. ( `./a` becomes `a`)  This is places after the main logic so that `./a/../` will still be parsed to `.`

title: Update sqlite/QueryBuilder.php: batchInsert() limit
author: lrcg
body:
Using `UNION SELECT` to perform batch inserts in SQLite is [limited to a maximum of 500](http://www.sqlite.org/limits.html#max_compound_select) rows at a time, so add a `$row` length check.

Also, as of [3.7.11 (2012-03-20)](http://www.sqlite.org/releaselog/3_7_11.html),

> the INSERT syntax to allow multiple rows to be inserted via the VALUES clause.

I haven't changed the code to use that format because I don't know if you are supporting the legacy format intentionally or not.

Ideally the SQLite QueryBuilder should check for the version of SQLite in use and make use of newer features if they are available.

title: added run method to execute yii commands
author: schmunk42
body:
Discussion: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/350

ToDos:
- add params
- execute by namespace
- autoload by namespace

Can be tested with this `composer.json` and `composer install`:

```
"scripts": {
    "post-install-cmd": [
        "yii\\composer\\InstallHandler::setPermissions",
        "yii\\composer\\InstallHandler::run"
    ],
    "post-update-cmd": [
        "yii\\composer\\InstallHandler::setPermissions"
    ]
},
"extra": {
    "run": [
        ["help"],
        ["hello", "Hello World!"],
        ["yii\\console\\controllers\\HelpController"]
    ],
    "writable": [
        "runtime",
        "www/assets"
    ],
    "executable": [
        "yii"
    ]
}
```

Will execute `help` and `hello` (without params) without errors, but currently fails on yii\console\controllers\HelpController.

title: Added StringHelper::parseUri
author: suralc
body:
This pr adds StringHelper::parseUri.

PHPs default parse_url is as noted in the official docs not meant to spit/parse all variants of URIs. 

URIs that are to some extend valid like `assets:///ae823jss/js/compact.js` (and in my case delivered by an external api) result in `false` using parse_url. The added function is however capable of parsing this string into the correct output (omitting the non-exsistant parts):

```
array(2) {
  'scheme' =>
  string(6) "assets"
  'path' =>
  string(23) "/ae823jss/js/compact.js"
}
```

The regex used is exemplified in rfc 2396 Appendix B.

title: Allow rules with optional parameters
author: thiagotalma
body:
Today UrlRule not allow to create rules with optional parameters. Often they can be useful.

As the method escapes the parentheses, I thought of making the optional parameters using brackets. A rule might look like this:

``` PHP
'urlManager' => [
    'rules' => [
        'agenda/<formato:json|xml>{/p/<person:\d+>}?{/a/<agenda:\d+>}?' => 'agenda/init',
    ]
],
```

author: Ragazzo
body:
File validator mime - types added, also image validator adjusted. This PR is related with this [issue](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/3743).
Should we also drop `types` here or not ? As for me i almost always use `mimeTypes` , but for other developers it can be annoing to specify all mimeTypes that can be matched by file extensions, so they will like to make simple `types`. 
However i think `types` can be adjusted with mime-types check, so we will compare pathinfo extension + extension that is determined on mime - type, what do you think ? If so, then we will need some additional method in `BaseFileHelper` called `getExtensionByMimeType`, simple `return isset()` .

title: Refactored formatter class #2359
author: Enrica-r
body:
Formatter class in 'yii\base\formatter.php' has been rewritten. Formatter class in 'yii\i18n' is a dummy only for compatibility reason. In user guide formatter.md describes the usage and all functions.

Main change is a merge between yii\base\formatter and yii\i18n\formatter plus some further functions like unformat and format pattern conversion.

The motivation to refact formatter was the confusion with the format patterns and the behaviour between version of 'yii\base' and 'yii\i18n'. While base works with PHP syntax i18n version does accept ICU patterns from intl only. Further only i18n version supports terms like 'short', 'medium', 'long' or 'full'.

Most application should be able to react on locale settings (base is OK for US application only). If a developper creates an international application he has to convert between PHP format patterns und ICU format patterns and versa. I found 3rd party extension already (Kartik-V dataControl) which uses 'yii::$app->formatter->dateFormat'. The extension has no knowledge which class is used. Either it gets php pattern like 'd-m-Y' back or it gets ICU short term 'short' or 'dd-MM-yyyy' back. It's obvious that in case of i18n the extension will fail.

My refactored formatter class has following advantages:
- Class works with our without installed "intl" php extension with some restrictions. (no translated name of month or days without intl).
- Interface communication works per default with PHP format patterns (also if intl is loaded). 
- Named date formats like 'short', 'medium', 'long' or 'full' is possible without intl also.
- ICU format patterns can be used as parameter also if defined in another parameter.
- Invalid Input date like '2014-07-35' doesn't crash anymore. It formats like '2014-08-04'. (yii\base\formatter uses DateTime constructor which crashes with a fatal error which can't be catched).
- Dates larger than 2038 are supported correctly.
- asDecimal, asNumber, asDouble are synonyms and have same behaviour. Floats are rounded correctly.
- For numbers and currency a rounding rule (roundingIncrement) can be set. (For Swiss currency 5 cents rounding is already defined by default).
- "Unformat" function which reverse almost all formats. (dates, integer, decimals, perCent, Size etc.)
- Conversion functions of date patterns from PHP to ICU or ICU to PHP
- SetLocale function (chainable) which sets another locale setting (changes internally all patterns).
- Formatter.md has been written.

author: Ragazzo
body:
Added basic highlighting in `Debug` module with [this](https://github.com/scrivo/highlight.php) 3rd party lib. By default css similar to `github`. Since we dont have too particular code to highlight in `Debug` module, i've currently only highlighted sql queries + categories strings. Questions to discuss:
- should we highlight other pages with this one? Or we can skip it and make it later with simple css if needed and not wrapping them into `<pre>` highlight element like it is done for `category` attribute for example.

Also we can apply highlighting later on `Events` debug panel if it will be considered as enh. , there we can highlight json encoded event attributes and data .

title: Fix #2532: Allow AR behaviors to attach other behaviors to Query
author: klimov-paul
body:
This one attmpts to fix #2532: "Allow AR behaviors to attach other behaviors to Query"

I can not see other solution to do so, but changing `yii\base\Component::behaviors()` to be a static.
This allows `ActiveQuery` to browse behaviors declared for `ActiveRecord` searhing for specific ones implementing `ActiveQueryBehaviorInterface`.
This interface enforces behavior to declare method, which should return definition for the `ActiveQuery` specific behavior.

Unit test is attached.

Warning: this PR breaks a BC!

title: [WIP] formatter refactored
author: cebe
body:
refactored date formatting functions based on #3790

fixes #2359
- removed unformat methods, they do not belong here
- removed db format, which is also not purpose of this class
- refactored the whole set of methods to be simpler and better
  maintainable

More unit tests needed.

TODO:
- [x] refactor number formatting functions
- [x] support numberformatter options
- [x] make asSize compatible with number formatting
- [ ] ~~make format config compatible with the datepicker extension~~
- [x] unit tests for date time functoins
- [x] unit tests for number formatting
- [x] update docs public API
- [x] update docs protected API
- [x] update guide
- [x] https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/f3520187d62a28d5f9d1854f47467b563e6784a6
- [x] https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/46b553f01245daba6ba6e099bb35e1ebb8d0cb7e
- [x] CHANGELOG + UPGRADE note + rename references
## Changes from the UPGRADE file:

---
- The formatter class has been refactored to have only one class regardless whether PHP intl extension is installed or not.
  Functionality of `yii\base\Formatter` has been merged into `yii\i18n\Formatter` and `yii\base\Formatter` has been
  removed so you have to replace all usage of `yii\base\Formatter` with `yii\i18n\Formatter` in your code.
  Also the API of the Formatter class has changed in many ways.
  The signature of the following Methods has changed:
  - `asDate`
  - `asTime`
  - `asDateTime`
  - `asSize` has been split up into `asSize` and `asShortSize`
  - `asCurrency`
  - `asDecimal`
  - `asPercent`
  - `asScientific`
  
  The following methods have been removed, this also means that the corresponding format which may be used by a
  GridView or DetailView is not available anymore:
  - `asNumber`
  - `asDouble`
  
  Also due to these changes some formatting defaults have changes so you have to check all your GridView and DetailView
  configuration and make sure the formatting is displayed correctly.
  
  The configuration for `asSize()` has changed. It now uses the configuration for the number formatting from intl
  and only the base is configured using `$sizeFormatBase`.
  
  The specification of the date and time formats is now using the ICU pattern format even if PHP intl extension is not installed.
  You can prefix a date format with `php:` to use the old format of the PHP `date()`-function.

title: Update ViewRenderer.php
author: cansozeri
body:
I want to use my layouts in a different folder that calls base or main layout in project and use them every twig files that can be extended.

views
| site
  |index.htm
| layouts
  |main.htm

Now If I call render like this from Sitecontroller I can not extend main.htm, because it is not in site view folder, it is in the layouts folder. 

```
public function actionIndex()
{

    return $this->render('index.htm');
}
```

So from index.htm (inside site folder) want to extend main.htm (inside layouts folder) gives error. Can not find main.htm, because twig only look in to site folder....

{% extends "main.htm" %}

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24247569/twig-template-layout-yii2-framework

So I change the file and now I can define layouts folder with Twig_Loader_Filesystem and after that in function render, I can addPath my file folder path site/index.htm .. so twig search the files in two folders - layouts and site folders. If you want we can change the $define_layout as an array and from config file we can send more than one folders that can twig search for. If there is another simple way to do this I would be very happy to learn how can I do this .. 

Now I only use it like one variable.

Config : 

'define_layout' => '/views/layouts',

Regards,

title: Fix #4114: `Security::generateRandomKey()`
author: klimov-paul
body:
Fix #4114
Method `Security::generateRandomKey()` changed to return ascii string in...stead of binary one.

It should be safe to use bin4hex conversion. Indeed it reduces the entropy of original binary IV, but it returns just what is needed - random string of specified length. It is up to the developer which length he whould use.
I have increased default length to keep the strength, this should be enough.

title: Use array_replace_recursive instead of array_merge
author: alex-code
body:
Use `array_replace_recursive` instead of `array_merge` for `$config`

e.g.
I had this in with the config to set the `ActiveField` class for forms.

```
Yii::$container->set('yii\bootstrap\ActiveForm', [
    'fieldConfig' => [
        'class' => 'common\components\ActiveField',
    ],
]);
```

When using the form I wanted to change some css classes.

```
<?php $form = ActiveForm::begin([
    'layout' => 'horizontal',
    'fieldConfig' => [
        'horizontalCssClasses' => [
            'label' => 'col-sm-2',
            'wrapper' => 'col-sm-8',
            'hint' => 'col-sm-2'
        ]
    ]
]) ?>
```

This would overwrite the initial config falling back to the default `ActiveField` class

If it's OK I will update the changelog.

title: 4131 key longer than hash
author: tom--
body:
See discussions at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/4089 and https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/4131
1. Fixes the PHP implementation of PBKDF2 so it does not truncate output key when requested key length is greater than the hash function length.
2. Reverted to automatic fallback to PHP implementation of PBKDF2 in the case that the PHP built-in `hash_pbkdf2()` is not available. (The PHP implementation is not a lot slower than the built-in and is therefore acceptable.) The hmac/pbkdf2 key derivation strategy config is no longer needed. 
3. Add HKDF. This is useful when the user has a secure cryptographic key rather than a password to use for encryption. In this case there is no need to iterate. HKDF is much faster than PBKDF2.
4. Changed `Security::$deriveKeyStrategy` to select between `'password'` strategy (which uses PBKDF2) and `'key'` strategy (HKDF).
5. Changed the signature of `encrypt()` and `decrypt()` in two ways:
   - Changed name of second param from `$password` to `$secret` so it can encompass both passwords and secure keys.
   - Added optional third parameter `$info` which applies to HKDF, i.e. when `Security::$deriveKeyStrategy` =  `'key'`. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5869 Section 3.2. Example: an application has a key for storing user data in a database and sets `$info` to the User ID so the encryption key for each user is different.
6. Updated the encryption unit tests according to the above changes.
7. Added unit tests for `deriveKeyHkdf()` and `deriveKeyPbkdf2()` using test vectors from the corresponding RFCs.

title: Fixed limit applying for Oracle queries.
author: miramir
body:
In most DB limit applying on query done through concatenating query with limit string, like `LIMIT n OFFSET m`. Such case in Oracle done through wrapping whole query by special query. In all schemes, except `\yii\db\oci`, `QueryBuilder::buildLimit()` returns limit string for concatenating. `\yii\db\oci\QueryBuilder::buildLimit()` returns whole query with applied limit.
At first this brakes method behaviour. Also such behaviour does not work in `SqlDataProvider`.

title: Support for separating Read/Write Database
author: qiangxue
body:
Fixes #3708

Referenced: http://www.yiiframework.com/extension/dbreadwritesplitting/

Main features:
- Support a single master (for read/write) and multiple slaves (read only)
- Can detect dead slaves and use health one or the master
- Automatic detection of using whether the master or slave connection
- For pages that do not change data, only a single read connection is opened (the master will not be opened)
- all `Command::query()` operations use the slave, all `Command::execute()` operations use the master
- Transactions done with the master
- Support forcing the use of the master

Manually tested with the CRUD operations generated by Gii:
- For index, view pages, only a slave connection is open
- For create, update pages (POST), both of the master and the slave connections are used. The slave connection is used to load the model data and can be optimized by disabling the slave on the fly to use the master only. 

TODO:
- [x] sphinx support
- [x] unit tests
- [x] documentation

title: Move isOldMssql function to Connection class
author: mikejpeters
body:
`yii\db\mssql\QueryBuilder::isOldMssql()` reads a PDO attribute to get the database version, but some database drivers (e.g. dblib) do not support getting attributes and this causes an error:

```
Uncaught exception 'PDOException' with message 'SQLSTATE[IM001]: Driver does not support this function: driver does not support getting attributes' in ... 
```

Moving `isOldMssql()` to the `Connection` class makes it easier to override in a subclass, allowing a person to simply return true if they know the database involved in the connection is an old version of MSSQL.  I think that  this function is more of an attribute of the connection than the query, so it makes more sense here anyway.

title: Update ActiveField.php
author: abrahamy
body: When rendering multiple models in the same ActiveForm if any of the field names in the two models is the same then the clientOptions of the last rendered attribute will overwrite those of the previous attribute causing the client-side validation for the overwritten field not to run at all. Example: given two models Car and Owner with attributes {make, age} and {name, age} then if the Car is rendered first its age attribute will not have any client validation.

title: RBAC assignments that only apply to the current request
author: tvdavid
body:
Relates to #4430

This allows you to create RBAC assignments that won't persist to the database or file backend, but which only apply to the current request.

For example, you can develop your application while logged in as a regular user that doesn't have any special roles; then make a call to `authManager->assign($persistent = false)` (based on a cookie/post/get value) to view that page as administrator/moderator/whatever - without having to regenerate your RBAC rules or create/remove assignments every time you want to switch between roles.

title: [WIP] #4408 unicode characters in attribute names
author: kmindi
body:
This PR is WorkInProgress for the issue: #4408
The request is to support different names for attributes if the columns in the database contain special characters like german umlauts.
Those umlauts lead to an exception in activeTextInput and DetailView::widget "Attribute name must contain word characters only in vendor\yiisoft\yii2\helpers\BaseHtml.php"

---
- [ ] Does yii2 want to support non ASCII-characters in column names/attributes?
  - @samdark: "It's not the best practice to use umlauts in code"
  - @cebe: "we already accept them in gridview":
    There the regular expression accepts any character except ':' for the attribute name. That means "..." is a valid attribute name.
- [ ] Discuss valid attribute names (column names of database can contain Unicode characters?):
  - [MySQL](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/identifiers.html) states that "Permitted characters in quoted identifiers include the full Unicode Basic Multilingual Plane (BMP)"
- [ ] Discuss impact of attribute names in other classes than BaseHtml and DetailView
- [ ] Derive regular expression for valid attribute names
- [ ] Implement regular expression
- [ ] Implement tests

title: Asset Bundle remap feature
author: creocoder
body:
How this can be used:

``` php
'assetManager' => [
    'bundles' => [
        'yii\web\JqueryAsset' => [
            'class' => 'app\assets\JqueryAsset',
        ],
    ],
],
```

By doing this you can fast remap existing asset bundle to another custom class. Without that feature you need override **all classes** which depends on 'yii\web\JqueryAsset'.

It is not finalized - I whould like to hear opinion about it before writing docs and support files.

title: Fixes #2315
author: samdark
body:
This is attempt to fix #2315 by supporting passing any operator as the first argument:

``` php
$query = (new Query())->where(['<=', 'a', 'b']);
// results in WHERE "a" <= "b"
```

The pro of this solution is that any operator is supported. The con is that operator isn't whitelisted anymore and since it's not escaped, it may result in SQL injection of taken from user input.
